Correlation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify a correlation, i.e. a statistical relationship between two random variables or two sets of data.

Resource type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A type of computational resource used in bioinformatics.

Tool.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A bioinformatics package or tool, e.g. a standalone application or web service.

Database.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A digital data archive typically based around a relational model but sometimes using an object-oriented, tree or graph-based model.

Ontology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An ontology of biological or bioinformatics concepts and relations, a controlled vocabulary, structured glossary etc.

Directory metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A directory on disk from which files are read.

MeSH vocabulary.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Controlled vocabulary from National Library of Medicine. The MeSH thesaurus is used to index articles in biomedical journals for the Medline/PubMED databases.

HGNC vocabulary.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Controlled vocabulary for gene names (symbols) from HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee.

UMLS vocabulary.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compendium of controlled vocabularies for the biomedical domain (Unified Medical Language System).

Identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A text token, number or something else which identifies an entity, but which may not be persistent (stable) or unique (the same identifier may identify multiple things).

Database entry.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An entry (retrievable via URL) from a biological database.

Chemical formula.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A specification of a chemical structure.

QSAR descriptor.rdfs:comment: QSAR descriptors have numeric values that quantify chemical information encoded in a symbolic representation of a molecule. They are used in quantitative structure activity relationship (QSAR) applications. Many subtypes of individual descriptors (not included in EDAM) cover various types of protein properties.
QSAR descriptor.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A QSAR quantitative descriptor (name-value pair) of chemical structure.

Raw sequence.rdfs:comment: Non-sequence characters may be used for example for gaps and translation stop.
Raw sequence.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A raw molecular sequence (string of characters) which might include ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.

Sequence record.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A molecular sequence and associated metadata.

Sequence set.rdfs:comment: This concept may be used for arbitrary sequence sets and associated data arising from processing.
Sequence set.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A collection of multiple molecular sequences and associated metadata that do not (typically) correspond to molecular sequence database records or entries and which (typically) are derived from some analytical method.

Sequence mask character.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A character used to replace (mask) other characters in a molecular sequence.

Sequence mask type.rdfs:comment: Sequence masking is where specific characters or positions in a molecular sequence are masked (replaced) with an another (mask character). The mask type indicates what is masked, for example regions that are not of interest or which are information-poor including acidic protein regions, basic protein regions, proline-rich regions, low compositional complexity regions, short-periodicity internal repeats, simple repeats and low complexity regions. Masked sequences are used in database search to eliminate statistically significant but biologically uninteresting hits.
Sequence mask type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of sequence masking to perform.

DNA sense specification.rdfs:comment: The forward or 'top' strand might specify a sequence is to be used as given, the reverse or 'bottom' strand specifying the reverse complement of the sequence is to be used.
DNA sense specification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The strand of a DNA sequence (forward or reverse).

Sequence metadata.rdfs:comment: This is used for such things as a report including the sequence identifier, type and length.
Sequence metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Basic or general information concerning molecular sequences.

Sequence feature source.rdfs:comment: This might be the name and version of a software tool, the name of a database, or 'curated' to indicate a manual annotation (made by a human).
Sequence feature source.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: How the annotation of a sequence feature (for example in EMBL or Swiss-Prot) was derived.

Sequence search results.rdfs:comment: The score list includes the alignment score, percentage of the query sequence matched, length of the database sequence entry in this alignment, identifier of the database sequence entry, excerpt of the database sequence entry description etc.
Sequence search results.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report of sequence hits and associated data from searching a database of sequences (for example a BLAST search). This will typically include a list of scores (often with statistical evaluation) and a set of alignments for the hits.

Sequence signature matches.rdfs:comment: This ncluding reports of hits from a search of a protein secondary or domain database.
Sequence signature matches.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report on the location of matches in one or more sequences to profiles, motifs (conserved or functional patterns) or other signatures.

Sequence signature model.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data files used by motif or profile methods.

Sequence signature data.rdfs:comment: This can include metadata about a motif or sequence profile such as its name, length, technical details about the profile construction, and so on.
Sequence signature data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concering concerning specific or conserved pattern in molecular sequences and the classifiers used for their identification, including sequence motifs, profiles or other diagnostic element.

Sequence alignment (words).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of exact matches between subsequences (words) within two or more molecular sequences.

Dotplot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A dotplot of sequence similarities identified from word-matching or character comparison.

Sequence alignment.rdfs:comment: This includes the generation of alignments (the identification of equivalent sites), the analysis of alignments, editing, visualisation, alignment databases, the alignment (equivalence between sites) of sequence profiles (representing sequence alignments) and so on.
Sequence alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the alignment of molecular sequences or sequence profiles (representing sequence alignments).

Sequence alignment parameter.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Some simple value controlling a sequence alignment (or similar 'match') operation.

Sequence similarity score.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A value representing molecular sequence similarity.

Sequence alignment metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report of general information on a sequence alignment, typically include a description, sequence identifiers and alignment score.

Sequence alignment report.rdfs:comment: Use this for any computer-generated reports on sequence alignments, and for general information (metadata) on a sequence alignment, such as a description, sequence identifiers and alignment score.
Sequence alignment report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report of molecular sequence alignment-derived data or metadata.

Sequence profile alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A profile-profile alignment (each profile typically representing a sequence alignment).

Sequence-profile alignment.rdfs:comment: Data associated with the alignment might also be included, e.g. ranked list of best-scoring sequences and a graphical representation of scores.
Sequence-profile alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of one or more molecular sequence(s) to one or more sequence profile(s) (each profile typically representing a sequence alignment).

Sequence distance matrix.rdfs:comment: Methods might perform character compatibility analysis or identify patterns of similarity in an alignment or data matrix.
Sequence distance matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A matrix of estimated evolutionary distance between molecular sequences, such as is suitable for phylogenetic tree calculation.

Phylogenetic character data.rdfs:comment: As defined, this concept would also include molecular sequences, microsatellites, polymorphisms (RAPDs, RFLPs, or AFLPs), restriction sites and fragments
Phylogenetic character data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Basic character data from which a phylogenetic tree may be generated.

Phylogenetic tree.rdfs:comment: A phylogenetic tree is usually constructed from a set of sequences from which an alignment (or data matrix) is calculated. See also 'Phylogenetic tree image'.
Phylogenetic tree.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The raw data (not just an image) from which a phylogenetic tree is directly generated or plotted, such as topology, lengths (in time or in expected amounts of variance) and a confidence interval for each length.

Comparison matrix.rdfs:comment: The comparison matrix might include matrix name, optional comment, height and width (or size) of matrix, an index row/column (of characters) and data rows/columns (of integers or floats).
Comparison matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for amino acid or nucleotide sequence comparison.

Protein topology.rdfs:comment: The location and size of the secondary structure elements and intervening loop regions is usually indicated.
Protein topology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predicted or actual protein topology represented as a string of protein secondary structure elements.

Protein features report (secondary struc.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning secondary structure (predicted or real) of a protein.

Protein features report (super-secondary.rdfs:comment: Super-secondary structures include leucine zippers, coiled coils, Helix-Turn-Helix etc.
Protein features report (super-secondary.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning super-secondary structure of protein sequence(s).

Secondary structure alignment (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of the (1D representations of) secondary structure of two or more proteins.

Secondary structure alignment metadata (.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on protein secondary structure alignment-derived data or metadata.

RNA secondary structure.rdfs:comment: This includes thermodynamically stable or evolutionarily conserved structures such as knots, pseudoknots etc.
RNA secondary structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report of secondary structure (predicted or real) of an RNA molecule.

Secondary structure alignment (RNA).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of the (1D representations of) secondary structure of two or more RNA molecules.

Secondary structure alignment metadata (.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report of RNA secondary structure alignment-derived data or metadata.

Structure.rdfs:comment: The coordinate data may be predicted or real.
Structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a macromolecular tertiary (3D) structure or part of a structure.

Tertiary structure record.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An entry from a molecular tertiary (3D) structure database.

Structure database search results.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Results (hits) from searching a database of tertiary structure.

Structure alignment.rdfs:comment: This includes the generation, storage, analysis, rendering etc. of structure alignments.
Structure alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the superimposition of molecular tertiary structures or structural (3D) profiles (representing a structure or structure alignment).

Structure alignment report.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Structure alignment report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report of molecular tertiary structure alignment-derived data.

Structure similarity score.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A value representing molecular structure similarity, measured from structure alignment or some other type of structure comparison.

Structural profile.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Some type of structural (3D) profile or template (representing a structure or structure alignment).

Structural (3D) profile alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A 3D profile-3D profile alignment (each profile representing structures or a structure alignment).

Sequence-3D profile alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An alignment of a sequence to a 3D profile (representing structures or a structure alignment).

Protein sequence-structure scoring matri.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Matrix of values used for scoring sequence-structure compatibility.

Sequence-structure alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An alignment of molecular sequence to structure (from threading sequence(s) through 3D structure or representation of structure(s)).

Amino acid annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific amino acid.

Peptide annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific peptide.

Protein report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative human-readable report about one or more specific protein molecules or protein structural domains, derived from analysis of primary (sequence or structural) data.

Protein property.rdfs:comment: The report may be based on analysis of nucleic acid sequence or structural data. This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Protein property.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report of primarily non-positional data describing intrinsic physical, chemical or other properties of a protein molecule or model.

Protein structural motifs and surfaces.rdfs:comment: This includes conformation of conserved substructures, conserved geometry (spatial arrangement) of secondary structure or protein backbone, solvent-exposed surfaces, internal cavities, the analysis of shape, hydropathy, electrostatic patches, role and functions etc.
Protein structural motifs and surfaces.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning (3D) structural features or common 3D motifs within protein structures, including the surface of a protein structure, such as biological interfaces with other molecules.

Protein domain classification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning the classification of the sequences and/or structures of protein structural domain(s).

Protein features report (domains).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning structural domains or 3D folds in a protein or polypeptide chain.

Protein architecture report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on architecture (spatial arrangement of secondary structure) of a protein structure.

Protein folding report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on an analysis or model of protein folding properties, folding pathways, residues or sites that are key to protein folding, nucleation or stabilization centers etc.

Protein features (mutation).rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
Protein features (mutation).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on the effect of (typically point) mutation on protein folding, stability, structure and function.

Protein interaction raw data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
Protein interaction raw data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Protein-protein interaction data from for example yeast two-hybrid analysis, protein microarrays, immunoaffinity chromatography followed by mass spectrometry, phage display etc.

Protein interaction report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on the interactions (predicted or known) of a protein, protein domain or part of a protein with some other molecule(s), which might be another protein, nucleic acid or some other ligand.

Protein family report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific protein family or other classification or group of protein sequences or structures.

Vmax.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The maximum initial velocity or rate of a reaction. It is the limiting velocity as substrate concentrations get very large.

Km.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Km is the concentration (usually in Molar units) of substrate that leads to half-maximal velocity of an enzyme-catalysed reaction.

Nucleotide base annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific nucleotide base.

Nucleic acid property.rdfs:comment: The report may be based on analysis of nucleic acid sequence or structural data. This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Nucleic acid property.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report of primarily non-positional data describing intrinsic physical, chemical or other properties of a nucleic acid molecule.

Codon usage data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Codon usage data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data derived from analysis of codon usage (typically a codon usage table) of DNA sequences.

Gene report.rdfs:comment: This includes any report on a particular locus or gene.  This might include the gene name, description, summary and so on. It can include details about the function of a gene, such as its encoded protein or a functional classification of the gene sequence along according to the encoded protein(s).
Gene report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on predicted or actual gene structure, regions which make an RNA product and features such as promoters, coding regions, splice sites etc.

Gene classification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on the classification of nucleic acid / gene sequences according to the functional classification of their gene products.

DNA variation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning stable, naturally occuring mutations in a nucleotide sequence including alleles, naturally occurring mutations such as single base nucleotide substitutions, deletions and insertions, RFLPs and other polymorphisms.

Chromosome report.rdfs:comment: This includes basic information. e.g. chromosome number, length, karyotype features, chromosome sequence etc.
Chromosome report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific chromosome.

Genotype/phenotype report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on the set of genes (or allelic forms) present in an individual, organism or cell and associated with a specific physical characteristic, or a report concerning an organisms traits and phenotypes.

Nucleic acid features report (primers).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning PCR primers and hybridization oligos in a nucleic acid sequence.

PCR experiment report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning PCR experiments, e.g. quantitative real-time PCR.

Sequence trace.rdfs:comment: This is the raw data produced by a DNA sequencing machine.
Sequence trace.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Fluorescence trace data generated by an automated DNA sequencer, which can be interprted as a molecular sequence (reads), given associated sequencing metadata such as base-call quality scores.

Sequence assembly.rdfs:comment: This covers for example the alignment of sequences of (typically millions) of short reads to a reference genome.
Sequence assembly.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the assembly of fragments of a DNA sequence to reconstruct the original sequence.

Radiation Hybrid (RH) scores.rdfs:comment: Radiation Hybrid (RH) scores are used in Radiation Hybrid mapping.
Radiation Hybrid (RH) scores.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Radiation hybrid scores (RH) scores for one or more markers.

Genetic linkage report.rdfs:comment: This includes linkage disequilibrium; the non-random association of alleles or polymorphisms at two or more loci (not necessarily on the same chromosome).
Genetic linkage report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on the linkage of alleles.

Gene expression profile.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data quantifying the level of expression of (typically) multiple genes, derived for example from microarray experiments.

Microarray experiment report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning microarray experiments including conditions, protocol, sample:data relationships etc.

Oligonucleotide probe data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on oligonucleotide probes (typically for use with DNA microarrays).

SAGE experimental data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Output from a serial analysis of gene expression (SAGE) experiment.

Sequence tag profile (with gene assignme.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Tag to gene assignments (tag mapping) of SAGE, MPSS and SBS data. Typically this is the sequencing-based expression profile annotated with gene identifiers.

Protein NMR data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Protein nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) raw data.

Protein circular dichroism (CD) spectros.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Protein secondary structure from protein coordinate or circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopic data.

Electron microscopy volume map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Volume map data from electron microscopy.

Electron microscopy model.rdfs:comment: This might include the location in the model of the known features of a particular macromolecule.
Electron microscopy model.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotation on a structural 3D model (volume map) from electron microscopy.

Peptide mass fingerprint.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A set of peptide masses (peptide mass fingerprint) from mass spectrometry.

Peptide identification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Protein or peptide identifications with evidence supporting the identifications, typically from comparing a peptide mass fingerprint (from mass spectrometry) to a sequence database.

Pathway or network annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific biological pathway or network, typically including a map (diagram) of the pathway.

Biological pathway map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A map (typically a diagram) of a biological pathway.

Data resource definition.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A definition of a data resource serving one or more types of data, including metadata and links to the resource or data proper.

Workflow metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Basic information, annotation or documentation concerning a workflow (but not the workflow itself).

Mathematical model.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A biological model represented in mathematical terms.

Statistical estimate score.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A value representing estimated statistical significance of some observed data; typically sequence database hits.

EMBOSS database resource definition.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Resource definition for an EMBOSS database.

Version information.rdfs:comment: Development status / maturity may be part of the version information, for example in case of tools, standards, or some data records.
Version information.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a version of software or data, for example name, version number and release date.

Database cross-mapping.rdfs:comment: The cross-mapping is typically a table where each row is an accession number and each column is a database being cross-referenced. The cells give the accession number or identifier of the corresponding entry in a database. If a cell in the table is not filled then no mapping could be found for the database. Additional information might be given on version, date etc.
Database cross-mapping.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A mapping of the accession numbers (or other database identifier) of entries between (typically) two biological or biomedical databases.

Data index.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An index of data of biological relevance.

Data index report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report of an analysis of an index of biological data.

Database metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Basic information on bioinformatics database(s) or other data sources such as name, type, description, URL etc.

Tool metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Basic information about one or more bioinformatics applications or packages, such as name, type, description, or other documentation.

Job metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Textual metadata on a submitted or completed job.

User metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Textual metadata on a software author or end-user, for example a person or other software.

Small molecule report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific chemical compound.

Cell line report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report on a particular strain of organism cell line including plants, virus, fungi and bacteria. The data typically includes strain number, organism type, growth conditions, source and so on.

Scent annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific scent.

Ontology concept data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning or derived from a concept from a biological ontology.

Keyword.rdfs:comment: Boolean operators (AND, OR and NOT) and wildcard characters may be allowed.
Keyword.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Keyword(s) or phrase(s) used (typically) for text-searching purposes.

Citation.rdfs:comment: A bibliographic reference might include information such as authors, title, journal name, date and (possibly) a link to the abstract or full-text of the article if available.
Citation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Bibliographic data that uniquely identifies a scientific article, book or other published material.

Article.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A document of scientific text, typically a full text article from a scientific journal.

Text mining report.rdfs:comment: A text mining abstract will typically include an annotated a list of words or sentences extracted from one or more scientific articles.
Text mining report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An abstract of the results of text mining.

Entity identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a biological entity or phenomenon.

Data resource identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a data resource.

Identifier (typed).rdfs:comment: This concept exists only to assist EDAM maintenance and navigation in graphical browsers.  It does not add semantic information.  This branch provides an alternative organisation of the concepts nested under 'Accession' and 'Name'. All concepts under here are already included under 'Accession' or 'Name'.
Identifier (typed).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier that identifies a particular type of data.

Tool identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a bioinformatics tool, e.g. an application or web service.

Discrete entity identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a discrete entity (any biological thing with a distinct, discrete physical existence).

Entity feature identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of an entity feature (a physical part or region of a discrete biological entity, or a feature that can be mapped to such a thing).

Entity collection identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a collection of discrete biological entities.

Phenomenon identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a physical, observable biological occurrence or event.

Molecule identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a molecule.

Atom ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier (e.g. character symbol) of a specific atom.

Molecule type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type a molecule.

Chemical identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a chemical compound.

Compound name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique name of a chemical compound.

Chemical registry number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique registry number of a chemical compound.

Ligand identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Code word for a ligand, for example from a PDB file.

Nucleotide identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a nucleotide.

Chemical name (ChEBI).rdfs:comment: This is the recommended chemical name for use for example in database annotation.
Chemical name (ChEBI).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique name from Chemical Entities of Biological Interest (ChEBI) of a chemical compound.

Chemical name (IUPAC).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: IUPAC recommended name of a chemical compound.

Chemical name (INN).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: International Non-proprietary Name (INN or 'generic name') of a chemical compound, assigned by the World Health Organization (WHO).

Chemical name (brand).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Brand name of a chemical compound.

Chemical name (synonymous).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Synonymous name of a chemical compound.

Chemical registry number (CAS).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: CAS registry number of a chemical compound.

Chemical registry number (Beilstein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Beilstein registry number of a chemical compound.

Chemical registry number (Gmelin).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Gmelin registry number of a chemical compound.

HET group name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3-letter code word for a ligand (HET group) from a PDB file, for example ATP.

Amino acid name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: String of one or more ASCII characters representing an amino acid.

Nucleotide code.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: String of one or more ASCII characters representing a nucleotide.

Polypeptide chain ID.rdfs:comment: This is typically a character (for the chain) appended to a PDB identifier, e.g. 1cukA
Polypeptide chain ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a polypeptide chain from a protein.

Enzyme identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of an enzyme or record from a database of enzymes.

EC number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An Enzyme Commission (EC) number of an enzyme.

Sequence position specification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A specification (partial or complete) of one or more positions or regions of a molecular sequence or map.

Sequence feature ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of molecular sequence feature, for example an ID of a feature that is unique within the scope of the GFF file.

Sequence position.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A position of one or more points (base or residue) in a sequence, or part of such a specification.

Sequence range.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Specification of range(s) of sequence positions.

Nucleic acid feature identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of an nucleic acid feature.

Protein feature identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a protein feature.

Sequence feature key.rdfs:comment: A feature key indicates the biological nature of the feature or information about changes to or versions of the sequence.
Sequence feature key.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The type of a sequence feature, typically a term or accession from the Sequence Ontology, for example an EMBL or Swiss-Prot sequence feature key.

Sequence feature qualifier.rdfs:comment: Feature qualifiers hold information about a feature beyond that provided by the feature key and location.
Sequence feature qualifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Typically one of the EMBL or Swiss-Prot feature qualifiers.

Sequence feature label.rdfs:comment: A feature label identifies a feature of a sequence database entry. When used with the database name and the entry's primary accession number, it is a unique identifier of that feature.
Sequence feature label.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Typically an EMBL or Swiss-Prot feature label.

EMBOSS Uniform Feature Object.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a sequence feature-containing entity adhering to the standard feature naming scheme used by all EMBOSS applications.

Codon name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: String of one or more ASCII characters representing a codon.

Gene identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a gene, such as a name/symbol or a unique identifier of a gene in a database.

Gene symbol.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The short name of a gene; a single word that does not contain white space characters. It is typically derived from the gene name.

Gene ID (NCBI).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An NCBI unique identifier of a gene.

Gene identifier (NCBI RefSeq).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An NCBI RefSeq unique identifier of a gene.

Gene identifier (NCBI UniGene).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An NCBI UniGene unique identifier of a gene.

Gene identifier (Entrez).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An Entrez unique identifier of a gene.

Gene ID (CGD).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene or feature from the CGD database.

Gene ID (DictyBase).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from DictyBase.

Ensembl gene ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a gene (or other feature) from the Ensembl database.

Gene ID (SGD).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the SGD database.

Gene ID (GeneDB).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from the GeneDB database.

TIGR identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the TIGR database.

TAIR accession (gene).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an gene from the TAIR database.

Protein domain ID.rdfs:comment: This is typically a character or string concatenated with a PDB identifier and a chain identifier.
Protein domain ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein structural domain.

SCOP domain identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein domain (or other node) from the SCOP database.

CATH domain ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein domain from CATH.

SCOP concise classification string (sccs.rdfs:comment: An scss includes the class (alphabetical), fold, superfamily and family (all numerical) to which a given domain belongs.
SCOP concise classification string (sccs.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A SCOP concise classification string (sccs) is a compact representation of a SCOP domain classification.

SCOP sunid.rdfs:comment: A sunid uniquely identifies an entry in the SCOP hierarchy, including leaves (the SCOP domains) and higher level nodes including entries corresponding to the protein level.
SCOP sunid.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier (number) of an entry in the SCOP hierarchy, for example 33229.

CATH node ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A code number identifying a node from the CATH database.

Kingdom name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a biological kingdom (Bacteria, Archaea, or Eukaryotes).

Species name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a species (typically a taxonomic group) of organism.

Strain name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a strain of an organism variant, typically a plant, virus or bacterium.

URI.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A string of characters that name or otherwise identify a resource on the Internet.

Database ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a biological or bioinformatics database.

File name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).

Ontology name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of an ontology of biological or bioinformatics concepts and relations.

LSID.rdfs:comment: LSIDs provide a standard way to locate and describe data. An LSID is represented as a Uniform Resource Name (URN) with the following format: URN:LSID:<Authority>:<Namespace>:<ObjectID>[:<Version>]
LSID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A Life Science Identifier (LSID) - a unique identifier of some data.

Database name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a biological or bioinformatics database.

Sequence database name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a molecular sequence database.

Enumerated file name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a file (of any type) with restricted possible values.

File name extension.rdfs:comment: A file extension is the characters appearing after the final '.' in the file name.
File name extension.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The extension of a file name.

File base name.rdfs:comment: A file base name is the file name stripped of its directory specification and extension.
File base name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The base name of a file.

Database entry identifier.rdfs:comment: This concept is required for completeness. It should never have child concepts.
Database entry identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of an entry from a database where the same type of identifier is used for objects (data) of different semantic type.

Sequence identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of molecular sequence(s) or entries from a molecular sequence database.

Sequence set ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a set of molecular sequence(s).

Sequence signature identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a sequence signature (motif or profile) for example from a database of sequence patterns.

Sequence alignment ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a molecular sequence alignment, for example a record from an alignment database.

Phylogenetic distance matrix identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a phylogenetic distance matrix.

Phylogenetic tree ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a phylogenetic tree for example from a phylogenetic tree database.

Comparison matrix identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a comparison matrix.

Structure ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique and persistent identifier of a molecular tertiary structure, typically an entry from a structure database.

Structural (3D) profile ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier or name of a structural (3D) profile or template (representing a structure or structure alignment).

Structure alignment ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of tertiary structure alignments.

Amino acid index ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an index of amino acid physicochemical and biochemical property data.

Protein interaction ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a report of protein interactions from a protein interaction database (typically).

Codon usage table name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique name of a codon usage table.

Transcription factor identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a transcription factor (or a TF binding site).

Microarray experiment annotation ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of microarray data.

Electron microscopy model ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of electron microscopy data.

Gene expression report ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of a report of gene expression (e.g. a gene expression profile) from a database.

Genotype and phenotype annotation ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of genotypes and phenotypes.

Pathway or network identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of biological pathways or networks.

Workflow ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological or biomedical workflow, typically from a database of workflows.

Data resource definition ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a data type definition from some provider.

Biological model ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a mathematical model, typically an entry from a database.

Compound identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of chemicals.

Ontology concept ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique (typically numerical) identifier of a concept in an ontology of biological or bioinformatics concepts and relations.

Article ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a scientific article.

FlyBase ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an object from the FlyBase database.

WormBase name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of an object from the WormBase database, usually a human-readable name.

WormBase class.rdfs:comment: A WormBase class describes the type of object such as 'sequence' or 'protein'.
WormBase class.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Class of an object from the WormBase database.

Sequence accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A persistent, unique identifier of a molecular sequence database entry.

Sequence type.rdfs:comment: Sequence type might reflect the molecule (protein, nucleic acid etc) or the sequence itself (gapped, ambiguous etc).
Sequence type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing a type of molecular sequence.

EMBOSS Uniform Sequence Address.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a sequence-based entity adhering to the standard sequence naming scheme used by all EMBOSS applications.

Sequence accession (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of a protein sequence database entry.

Sequence accession (nucleic acid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of a nucleotide sequence database entry.

RefSeq accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of a RefSeq database entry.

UniProt accession (extended).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of a UniProt (protein sequence) database entry. May contain version or isoform number.

PIR identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of PIR sequence database entry.

TREMBL accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a TREMBL sequence database entry.

Gramene primary identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Primary identifier of a Gramene database entry.

EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a (nucleic acid) entry from the EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ databases.

Sequence cluster ID (UniGene).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of an entry (gene cluster) from the NCBI UniGene database.

dbEST accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a dbEST database entry.

dbSNP ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a dbSNP database entry.

EMBOSS sequence type.rdfs:comment: See the EMBOSS documentation (http://emboss.sourceforge.net/) for a definition of what this includes.
EMBOSS sequence type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The EMBOSS type of a molecular sequence.

EMBOSS listfile.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: List of EMBOSS Uniform Sequence Addresses (EMBOSS listfile).

Sequence cluster ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a cluster of molecular sequence(s).

Sequence cluster ID (COG).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the COG database.

Sequence motif identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a sequence motif, for example an entry from a motif database.

Sequence profile ID.rdfs:comment: A sequence profile typically represents a sequence alignment.

ELM ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the ELMdb database of protein functional sites.

Prosite accession number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the Prosite database.

HMMER hidden Markov model ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier or name of a HMMER hidden Markov model.

JASPAR profile ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier or name of a profile from the JASPAR database.

Sequence alignment type.rdfs:comment: Possible values include for example the EMBOSS alignment types, BLAST alignment types and so on.
Sequence alignment type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of a sequence alignment.

BLAST sequence alignment type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The type of a BLAST sequence alignment.

Phylogenetic tree type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of a phylogenetic tree.

TreeBASE study accession number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the TreeBASE database.

TreeFam accession number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the TreeFam database.

Comparison matrix type.rdfs:comment: For example 'blosum', 'pam', 'gonnet', 'id' etc. Comparison matrix type may be required where a series of matrices of a certain type are used.
Comparison matrix type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of a comparison matrix.

Comparison matrix name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique name or identifier of a comparison matrix.

PDB ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of an entry from the PDB database.

AAindex ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the AAindex database.

BIND accession number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the BIND database.

IntAct accession number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the IntAct database.

InterPro entry name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of an InterPro entry, usually indicating the type of protein matches for that entry.

InterPro accession.rdfs:comment: Every InterPro entry has a unique accession number to provide a persistent citation of database records.
InterPro accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Primary accession number of an InterPro entry.

InterPro secondary accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Secondary accession number of an InterPro entry.

Gene3D ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the Gene3D database.

PIRSF ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the PIRSF database.

PRINTS code.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The unique identifier of an entry in the PRINTS database.

Pfam accession number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of a Pfam entry.

SMART accession number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the SMART database.

Superfamily hidden Markov model number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier (number) of a hidden Markov model from the Superfamily database.

TIGRFam ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry (family) from the TIGRFam database.

ProDom accession number.rdfs:comment: ProDom is a protein domain family database.
ProDom accession number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A ProDom domain family accession number.

TRANSFAC accession number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the TRANSFAC database.

ArrayExpress accession number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the ArrayExpress database.

EMDB ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the EMDB electron microscopy database.

GEO accession number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the GEO database.

GermOnline ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the GermOnline database.

EMAGE ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the EMAGE database.

Disease ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of disease.

HGVbase ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the HGVbase database.

HIVDB identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the HIVDB database.

OMIM ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the OMIM database.

KEGG object identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an object from one of the KEGG databases (excluding the GENES division).

Pathway ID (reactome).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the Reactome database.

Pathway ID (aMAZE).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the aMAZE database.

Pathway ID (BioCyc).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an pathway from the BioCyc biological pathways database.

Pathway ID (INOH).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the INOH database.

Pathway ID (PATIKA).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the PATIKA database.

Pathway ID (CPDB).rdfs:comment: This concept refers to identifiers used by the databases collated in CPDB; CPDB identifiers are not independently defined.
Pathway ID (CPDB).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the CPDB (ConsensusPathDB) biological pathways database, which is an identifier from an external database integrated into CPDB.

Pathway ID (Panther).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological pathway from the Panther Pathways database.

MIRIAM identifier.rdfs:comment: This is the identifier used internally by MIRIAM for a data type.
MIRIAM identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a MIRIAM data resource.

MIRIAM data type name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a data type from the MIRIAM database.

MIRIAM URI.rdfs:comment: A MIRIAM URI consists of the URI of the MIRIAM data type (PubMed, UniProt etc) followed by the identifier of an element of that data type, for example PMID for a publication or an accession number for a GO term.
MIRIAM URI.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The URI (URL or URN) of a data entity from the MIRIAM database.

MIRIAM data type primary name.rdfs:comment: The primary name of a MIRIAM data type is taken from a controlled vocabulary.
MIRIAM data type primary name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The primary name of a data type from the MIRIAM database.

MIRIAM data type synonymous name.rdfs:comment: A synonymous name for a MIRIAM data type taken from a controlled vocabulary.
MIRIAM data type synonymous name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A synonymous name of a data type from the MIRIAM database.

Taverna workflow ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a Taverna workflow.

BioModel ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the BioModel database.

PubChem CID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Chemical structure specified in PubChem Compound Identification (CID), a non-zero integer identifier for a unique chemical structure.

ChemSpider ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the ChemSpider database.

ChEBI ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the ChEBI database.

BioPax concept ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the BioPax ontology.

GO concept ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from The Gene Ontology.

MeSH concept ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the MeSH vocabulary.

HGNC concept ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the HGNC controlled vocabulary.

NCBI taxonomy ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A stable unique identifier for each taxon (for a species, a family, an order, or any other group in the NCBI taxonomy database.

Plant Ontology concept ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the Plant Ontology (PO).

UMLS concept ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the UMLS vocabulary.

FMA concept ID.rdfs:comment: Classifies anatomical entities according to their shared characteristics (genus) and distinguishing characteristics (differentia). Specifies the part-whole and spatial relationships of the entities, morphological transformation of the entities during prenatal development and the postnatal life cycle and principles, rules and definitions according to which classes and relationships in the other three components of FMA are represented.
FMA concept ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from Foundational Model of Anatomy.

EMAP concept ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the EMAP mouse ontology.

ChEBI concept ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the ChEBI ontology.

MGED concept ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the MGED ontology.

myGrid concept ID.rdfs:comment: The ontology is provided as two components, the service ontology and the domain ontology. The domain ontology acts provides concepts for core bioinformatics data types and their relations. The service ontology describes the physical and operational features of web services.
myGrid concept ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the myGrid ontology.

PubMed ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: PubMed unique identifier of an article.

DOI.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of a published article.

Medline UI.rdfs:comment: The use of Medline UI has been replaced by the PubMed unique identifier.
Medline UI.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Medline UI (unique identifier) of an article.

Tool name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a computer package, application, method or function.

Tool name (signature).rdfs:comment: Signature methods from http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/InterProScan/help.html#results include BlastProDom, FPrintScan, HMMPIR, HMMPfam, HMMSmart, HMMTigr, ProfileScan, ScanRegExp, SuperFamily and HAMAP.
Tool name (signature).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The unique name of a signature (sequence classifier) method.

Tool name (BLAST).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a BLAST tool.

Tool name (FASTA).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a FASTA tool.

Tool name (EMBOSS).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of an EMBOSS application.

Tool name (EMBASSY package).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of an EMBASSY package.

Sequence set (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Any collection of multiple protein sequences and associated metadata that do not (typically) correspond to common sequence database records or database entries.

Sequence set (nucleic acid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Any collection of multiple nucleotide sequences and associated metadata that do not (typically) correspond to common sequence database records or database entries.

Sequence cluster.rdfs:comment: The cluster might include sequences identifiers, short descriptions, alignment and summary information.
Sequence cluster.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A set of sequences that have been clustered or otherwise classified as belonging to a group including (typically) sequence cluster information.

Psiblast checkpoint file.rdfs:comment: A Psiblast checkpoint file uses ASN.1 Binary Format and usually has the extension '.asn'.
Psiblast checkpoint file.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A file of intermediate results from a PSIBLAST search that is used for priming the search in the next PSIBLAST iteration.

HMMER synthetic sequences set.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Sequences generated by HMMER package in FASTA-style format.

Proteolytic digest.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein sequence cleaved into peptide fragments (by enzymatic or chemical cleavage) with fragment masses.

Restriction digest.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Restriction digest fragments from digesting a nucleotide sequence with restriction sites using a restriction endonuclease.

PCR primers.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Oligonucleotide primer(s) for PCR and DNA amplification, for example a minimal primer set.

vectorstrip cloning vector definition fi.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: File of sequence vectors used by EMBOSS vectorstrip application, or any file in same format.

Primer3 internal oligo mishybridizing li.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A library of nucleotide sequences to avoid during hybridization events. Hybridization of the internal oligo to sequences in this library is avoided, rather than priming from them. The file is in a restricted FASTA format.

Primer3 mispriming library file.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A nucleotide sequence library of sequences to avoid during amplification (for example repetitive sequences, or possibly the sequences of genes in a gene family that should not be amplified. The file must is in a restricted FASTA format.

primersearch primer pairs sequence recor.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: File of one or more pairs of primer sequences, as used by EMBOSS primersearch application.

Sequence cluster (protein).rdfs:comment: The sequences are typically related, for example a family of sequences.

Sequence cluster (nucleic acid).rdfs:comment: The sequences are typically related, for example a family of sequences.

Sequence length.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The size (length) of a sequence, subsequence or region in a sequence, or range(s) of lengths.

Word size.rdfs:comment: Word size is used for example in word-based sequence database search methods.

Window size.rdfs:comment: A window is a region of fixed size but not fixed position over a molecular sequence. It is typically moved (computationally) over a sequence during scoring.

Sequence length range.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Specification of range(s) of length of sequences.

Sequence information report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report on basic information about a molecular sequence such as name, accession number, type (nucleic or protein), length, description etc.

Sequence property.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report about non-positional sequence features, typically a report on general molecular sequence properties derived from sequence analysis.

Sequence features.rdfs:comment: This includes annotation of positional sequence features, organized into a standard feature table, or any other report of sequence features.  General feature reports are a source of sequence feature table information although internal conversion would be required.
Sequence features.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotation of positional features of molecular sequence(s), i.e. that can be mapped to position(s) in the sequence.

Sequence features (comparative).rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
Sequence features (comparative).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Comparative data on sequence features such as statistics, intersections (and data on intersections), differences etc.

Sequence property (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report of general sequence properties derived from protein sequence data.

Sequence property (nucleic acid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report of general sequence properties derived from nucleotide sequence data.

Sequence complexity report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on sequence complexity, for example low-complexity or repeat regions in sequences.

Sequence ambiguity report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on ambiguity in molecular sequence(s).

Sequence composition report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report (typically a table) on character or word composition / frequency of a molecular sequence(s).

Peptide molecular weight hits.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on peptide fragments of certain molecular weight(s) in one or more protein sequences.

Base position variability plot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A plot of third base position variability in a nucleotide sequence.

Sequence composition table.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A table of character or word composition / frequency of a molecular sequence.

Base frequencies table.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A table of base frequencies of a nucleotide sequence.

Base word frequencies table.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A table of word composition of a nucleotide sequence.

Amino acid frequencies table.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A table of amino acid frequencies of a protein sequence.

Amino acid word frequencies table.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A table of amino acid word composition of a protein sequence.

DAS sequence feature annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotation of a molecular sequence in DAS format.

Feature table.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotation of positional sequence features, organized into a standard feature table.

Map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A map of (typically one) DNA sequence annotated with positional or non-positional features.

Nucleic acid features.rdfs:comment: This includes nucleotide sequence feature annotation in any known sequence feature table format and any other report of nucleic acid features.
Nucleic acid features.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on intrinsic positional features of a nucleotide sequence.

Protein features.rdfs:comment: This includes protein sequence feature annotation in any known sequence feature table format and any other report of protein features.
Protein features.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on intrinsic positional features of a protein sequence.

Genetic map.rdfs:comment: A genetic (linkage) map indicates the proximity of two genes on a chromosome, whether two genes are linked and the frequency they are transmitted together to an offspring. They are limited to genetic markers of traits observable only in whole organisms.
Genetic map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A map showing the relative positions of genetic markers in a nucleic acid sequence, based on estimation of non-physical distance such as recombination frequencies.

Sequence map.rdfs:comment: A sequence map typically includes annotation on significant subsequences such as contigs, haplotypes and genes. The contigs shown will (typically) be a set of small overlapping clones representing a complete chromosomal segment.
Sequence map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A map of genetic markers in a contiguous, assembled genomic sequence, with the sizes and separation of markers measured in base pairs.

Physical map.rdfs:comment: Distance in a physical map is measured in base pairs. A physical map might be ordered relative to a reference map (typically a genetic map) in the process of genome sequencing.
Physical map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A map of DNA (linear or circular) annotated with physical features or landmarks such as restriction sites, cloned DNA fragments, genes or genetic markers, along with the physical distances between them.

Sequence signature map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Image of a sequence with matches to signatures, motifs or profiles.

Cytogenetic map.rdfs:comment: This is the lowest-resolution physical map and can provide only rough estimates of physical (base pair) distances.  Like a genetic map, they are limited to genetic markers of traits observable only in whole organisms.
Cytogenetic map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A map showing banding patterns derived from direct observation of a stained chromosome.

DNA transduction map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A gene map showing distances between loci based on relative cotransduction frequencies.

Gene map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Sequence map of a single gene annotated with genetic features such as introns, exons, untranslated regions, polyA signals, promoters, enhancers and (possibly) mutations defining alleles of a gene.

Plasmid map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Sequence map of a plasmid (circular DNA).

Genome map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Sequence map of a whole genome.

Restriction map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Image of the restriction enzyme cleavage sites (restriction sites) in a nucleic acid sequence.

InterPro compact match image.rdfs:comment: The sequence(s) might be screened against InterPro, or be the sequences from the InterPro entry itself. Each protein is represented as a scaled horizontal line with colored bars indicating the position of the matches.
InterPro compact match image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Image showing matches between protein sequence(s) and InterPro Entries.

InterPro detailed match image.rdfs:comment: The sequence(s) might be screened against InterPro, or be the sequences from the InterPro entry itself.
InterPro detailed match image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Image showing detailed information on matches between protein sequence(s) and InterPro Entries.

InterPro architecture image.rdfs:comment: The sequence(s) might be screened against InterPro, or be the sequences from the InterPro entry itself. Domain architecture is shown as a series of non-overlapping domains in the protein.
InterPro architecture image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Image showing the architecture of InterPro domains in a protein sequence.

SMART protein schematic.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: SMART protein schematic in PNG format.

GlobPlot domain image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Images based on GlobPlot prediction of intrinsic disordered regions and globular domains in protein sequences.

Sequence motif matches.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report on the location of matches to profiles, motifs (conserved or functional patterns) or other signatures in one or more sequences.

Sequence features (repeats).rdfs:comment: The report might include derived data map such as classification, annotation, organization, periodicity etc.
Sequence features (repeats).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Location of short repetitive subsequences (repeat sequences) in (typically nucleotide) sequences.

Gene and transcript structure (report).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on predicted or actual gene structure, regions which make an RNA product and features such as promoters, coding regions, splice sites etc.

Mobile genetic elements.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning mobile genetic elements, such as transposons, Plasmids, Bacteriophage elements and Group II introns.

Nucleic acid features report (PolyA sign.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning regions or sites in a eukaryotic and eukaryotic viral RNA sequence which directs endonuclease cleavage or polyadenylation of an RNA transcript.

Nucleic acid features (quadruplexes).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on quadruplex-forming motifs in a nucleotide sequence.

Nucleic acid features report (CpG island.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning CpG rich regions (isochores) in a nucleotide sequence.

Nucleic acid features report (restrictio.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning restriction enzyme recognition sites (restriction sites) in a nucleic acid sequence.

Nucleosome exclusion sequences.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report on nucleosome formation potential or exclusion sequence(s).

Nucleic acid features report (splice sit.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning splice sites in a nucleotide sequence or alternative RNA splicing events.

Nucleic acid features report (matrix/sca.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning matrix/scaffold attachment regions (MARs/SARs) in a DNA sequence.

Gene features (exonic splicing enhancer).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on exonic splicing enhancers (ESE) in an exon.

Nucleic acid features (microRNA).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on microRNA sequence (miRNA) or precursor, microRNA targets, miRNA binding sites in an RNA sequence etc.

Gene features report (operon).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning operons (operators, promoters and genes) from a bacterial genome.

Nucleic acid features report (promoters).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning whole promoters or promoter elements (transcription start sites, RNA polymerase binding site, transcription factor binding sites, promoter enhancers etc) in a DNA sequence.

Coding region.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein-coding regions including coding sequences (CDS), exons, translation initiation sites and open reading frames.

Gene features (SECIS element).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on selenocysteine insertion sequence (SECIS) element in a DNA sequence.

Transcription factor binding sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning transcription factor binding sites (TFBS) in a DNA sequence.

Protein features (sites).rdfs:comment: Use this concept for collections of specific sites which are not necessarily contiguous, rather than contiguous stretches of amino acids.
Protein features (sites).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on predicted or known key residue positions (sites) in a protein sequence, such as binding or functional sites.

Protein features report (signal peptides.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning signal peptides or signal peptide cleavage sites in protein sequences.

Protein features report (cleavage sites).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning cleavage sites (for a proteolytic enzyme or agent) in a protein sequence.

Protein features (post-translation modif.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning post-translation modifications in a protein sequence, typically describing the specific sites involved.

Protein features report (active sites).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning catalytic residues (active site) of an enzyme.

Protein features report (binding sites).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning ligand-binding (non-catalytic) residues of a protein, such as sites that bind metal, prosthetic groups or lipids.

Protein features (epitopes).rdfs:comment: Epitope mapping is commonly done during vaccine design.
Protein features (epitopes).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on antigenic determinant sites (epitopes) in proteins, from sequence and / or structural data.

Protein features report (nucleic acid bi.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning RNA and DNA-binding proteins and binding sites in protein sequences.

MHC Class I epitopes report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on epitopes that bind to MHC class I molecules.

MHC Class II epitopes report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on predicted epitopes that bind to MHC class II molecules.

Protein features (PEST sites).rdfs:comment: 'PEST' motifs target proteins for proteolytic degradation and reduce the half-lives of proteins dramatically.
Protein features (PEST sites).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report or plot of PEST sites in a protein sequence.

Sequence database hits scores list.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Scores from a sequence database search (for example a BLAST search).

Sequence database hits alignments list.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignments from a sequence database search (for example a BLAST search).

Sequence database hits evaluation data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on the evaluation of the significance of sequence similarity scores from a sequence database search (for example a BLAST search).

MEME motif alphabet.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for the motifs (patterns) that MEME will search for.

MEME motifs directive file.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: File of directives for ordering and spacing of MEME motifs.

Dirichlet distribution.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Dirichlet distribution used by hidden Markov model analysis programs.

HMM emission and transition counts.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Emission and transition counts of a hidden Markov model, generated once HMM has been determined, for example after residues/gaps have been assigned to match, delete and insert states.

Sequence motif.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Any specific or conserved pattern (typically expressed as a regular expression) in a molecular sequence.

Sequence profile.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Some type of statistical model representing a (typically multiple) sequence alignment.

Protein signature.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific or conserved protein sequence pattern.

Prosite nucleotide pattern.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A nucleotide regular expression pattern from the Prosite database.

Prosite protein pattern.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein regular expression pattern from the Prosite database.

Position frequency matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) that is a simple matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position.

Position weight matrix.rdfs:comment: Contributions of individual sequences to the matrix might be uneven (weighted).
Position weight matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) that is weighted matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position.

Information content matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) derived from a matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position that reflects information content at each position.

Hidden Markov model.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A statistical Markov model of a system which is assumed to be a Markov process with unobserved (hidden) states.

Fingerprint.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: One or more fingerprints (sequence classifiers) as used in the PRINTS database.

Domainatrix signature.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein signature of the type used in the EMBASSY Signature package.

HMMER NULL hidden Markov model.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: NULL hidden Markov model representation used by the HMMER package.

Protein family signature.rdfs:comment: Protein family signatures cover all domains in the matching proteins and span >80% of the protein length and with no adjacent protein domain signatures or protein region signatures.
Protein family signature.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein family signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.

Protein domain signature.rdfs:comment: Protein domain signatures identify structural or functional domains or other units with defined boundaries.
Protein domain signature.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein domain signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.

Protein region signature.rdfs:comment: A protein region signature defines a region which cannot be described as a protein family or domain signature.
Protein region signature.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein region signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.

Protein repeat signature.rdfs:comment: A protein repeat signature is a repeated protein motif, that is not in single copy expected to independently fold into a globular domain.
Protein repeat signature.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein repeat signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.

Protein site signature.rdfs:comment: A protein site signature is a classifier for a specific site in a protein.
Protein site signature.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein site signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.

Protein conserved site signature.rdfs:comment: A protein conserved site signature is any short sequence pattern that may contain one or more unique residues and is cannot be described as a active site, binding site or post-translational modification.
Protein conserved site signature.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein conserved site signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.

Protein active site signature.rdfs:comment: A protein active site signature corresponds to an enzyme catalytic pocket. An active site typically includes non-contiguous residues, therefore multiple signatures may be required to describe an active site. ; residues involved in enzymatic reactions for which mutational data is typically available.
Protein active site signature.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein active site signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.

Protein binding site signature.rdfs:comment: A protein binding site signature corresponds to a site that reversibly binds chemical compounds, which are not themselves substrates of the enzymatic reaction. This includes enzyme cofactors and residues involved in electron transport or protein structure modification.
Protein binding site signature.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein binding site signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.

Protein post-translational modification.rdfs:comment: A protein post-translational modification signature corresponds to sites that undergo modification of the primary structure, typically to activate or de-activate a function. For example, methylation, sumoylation, glycosylation etc. The modification might be permanent or reversible.
Protein post-translational modification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein post-translational modification signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.

Sequence alignment (pair).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of exactly two molecular sequences.

Sequence alignment (multiple).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of more than two molecular sequences.

Sequence alignment (hybrid).rdfs:comment: Hybrid sequence alignments include for example genomic DNA to EST, cDNA or mRNA.
Sequence alignment (hybrid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of multiple molecular sequences of different types.

Sequence alignment (nucleic acid pair).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of exactly two nucleotide sequences.

Sequence alignment (protein pair).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of exactly two protein sequences.

Hybrid sequence alignment (pair).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of exactly two molecular sequences of different types.

Multiple nucleotide sequence alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of more than two nucleotide sequences.

Multiple protein sequence alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of more than two protein sequences.

Alignment score or penalty.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for opening or extending a gap in an alignment.

Score end gaps control.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Whether end gaps are scored or not.

Aligned sequence order.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Controls the order of sequences in an output sequence alignment.

Gap opening penalty.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A penalty for opening a gap in an alignment.

Gap extension penalty.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A penalty for extending a gap in an alignment.

Gap separation penalty.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A penalty for gaps that are close together in an alignment.

Terminal gap penalty.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A penalty for gaps at the termini of an alignment, either from the N/C terminal of protein or 5'/3' terminal of nucleotide sequences.

Match reward score.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The score for a 'match' used in various sequence database search applications with simple scoring schemes.

Mismatch penalty score.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The score (penalty) for a 'mismatch' used in various alignment and sequence database search applications with simple scoring schemes.

Drop off score.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: This is the threshold drop in score at which extension of word alignment is halted.

Gap opening penalty (integer).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for opening a gap in an alignment.

Gap opening penalty (float).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for opening a gap in an alignment.

Gap extension penalty (integer).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for extending a gap in an alignment.

Gap extension penalty (float).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for extending a gap in an alignment.

Gap separation penalty (integer).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for gaps that are close together in an alignment.

Gap separation penalty (float).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for gaps that are close together in an alignment.

Terminal gap opening penalty.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A number defining the penalty for opening gaps at the termini of an alignment, either from the N/C terminal of protein or 5'/3' terminal of nucleotide sequences.

Terminal gap extension penalty.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A number defining the penalty for extending gaps at the termini of an alignment, either from the N/C terminal of protein or 5'/3' terminal of nucleotide sequences.

Sequence identity.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Sequence identity is the number (%) of matches (identical characters) in positions from an alignment of two molecular sequences.

Sequence similarity.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Sequence similarity is the similarity (expressed as a percentage) of two molecular sequences calculated from their alignment, a scoring matrix for scoring characters substitutions and penalties for gap insertion and extension.

Sequence alignment metadata (quality rep.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on molecular sequence alignment quality (estimated accuracy).

Sequence alignment report (site conserva.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation. Use this concept for calculated substitution rates, relative site variability, data on sites with biased properties, highly conserved or very poorly conserved sites, regions, blocks etc.
Sequence alignment report (site conserva.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on character conservation in a molecular sequence alignment.

Sequence alignment report (site correlat.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on correlations between sites in a molecular sequence alignment, typically to identify possible covarying positions and predict contacts or structural constraints in protein structures.

Sequence-profile alignment (Domainatrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of molecular sequences to a Domainatrix signature (representing a sequence alignment).

Sequence-profile alignment (HMM).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of molecular sequence(s) to a hidden Markov model(s).

Sequence-profile alignment (fingerprint).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of molecular sequences to a protein fingerprint from the PRINTS database.

Phylogenetic continuous quantitative dat.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Continuous quantitative data that may be read during phylogenetic tree calculation.
