Phylogenetic discrete data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Character data with discrete states that may be read during phylogenetic tree calculation.

Phylogenetic character cliques.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: One or more cliques of mutually compatible characters that are generated, for example from analysis of discrete character data, and are used to generate a phylogeny.

Phylogenetic invariants.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Phylogenetic invariants data for testing alternative tree topologies.

Phylogenetic report.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used  for example for reports on confidence, shape or stratigraphic (age) data derived from phylogenetic tree analysis.
Phylogenetic report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report of data concerning or derived from a phylogenetic tree, or from comparing two or more phylogenetic trees.

DNA substitution model.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A model of DNA substitution that explains a DNA sequence alignment, derived from phylogenetic tree analysis.

Phylogenetic tree report (tree shape).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data about the shape of a phylogenetic tree.

Phylogenetic tree report (tree evaluatio.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on the confidence of a phylogenetic tree.

Phylogenetic tree distances.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Distances, such as Branch Score distance, between two or more phylogenetic trees.

Phylogenetic tree report (tree stratigra.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Molecular clock and stratigraphic (age) data derived from phylogenetic tree analysis.

Phylogenetic character contrasts.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Independent contrasts for characters used in a phylogenetic tree, or covariances, regressions and correlations between characters for those contrasts.

Comparison matrix (integers).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Matrix of integer numbers for sequence comparison.

Comparison matrix (floats).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Matrix of floating point numbers for sequence comparison.

Comparison matrix (nucleotide).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for nucleotide comparison.

Comparison matrix (amino acid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for amino acid comparison.

Nucleotide comparison matrix (integers).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Matrix of integer numbers for nucleotide comparison.

Nucleotide comparison matrix (floats).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Matrix of floating point numbers for nucleotide comparison.

Amino acid comparison matrix (integers).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Matrix of integer numbers for amino acid comparison.

Amino acid comparison matrix (floats).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Matrix of floating point numbers for amino acid comparison.

Protein features report (membrane region.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning trans- or intra-membrane regions of a protein, typically describing physicochemical properties of the secondary structure elements.

Nucleic acid structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning nucleic acid (secondary or tertiary) structure, such as whole structures, structural features and associated annotation.

Protein structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein tertiary (3D) structure.

Protein-ligand complex.rdfs:comment: This includes interactions of proteins with atoms, ions and small molecules or macromolecules such as nucleic acids or other polypeptides.  For stable inter-polypeptide interactions use 'Protein complex' instead.
Protein-ligand complex.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The structure of a protein in complex with a ligand, typically a small molecule such as an enzyme substrate or cofactor, but possibly another macromolecule.

Carbohydrate structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a carbohydrate (3D) structure.

Small molecule structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for the (3D) structure of a small molecule, such as any common chemical compound.

DNA structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a DNA tertiary (3D) structure.

RNA structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning RNA secondary or tertiary structure and alignments.

tRNA structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a tRNA tertiary (3D) structure, including tmRNA, snoRNAs etc.

Protein chain.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for the tertiary (3D) structure of a polypeptide chain.

Protein domain.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for the tertiary (3D) structure of a protein domain.

Protein structure (all atoms).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein tertiary (3D) structure (all atoms).

C-alpha trace.rdfs:comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
C-alpha trace.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein tertiary (3D) structure (typically C-alpha atoms only).

Protein chain (all atoms).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a polypeptide chain tertiary (3D) structure (all atoms).

Protein chain (C-alpha atoms).rdfs:comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
Protein chain (C-alpha atoms).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a polypeptide chain tertiary (3D) structure (typically C-alpha atoms only).

Protein domain (all atoms).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein domain tertiary (3D) structure (all atoms).

Protein domain (C-alpha atoms).rdfs:comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
Protein domain (C-alpha atoms).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein domain tertiary (3D) structure (typically C-alpha atoms only).

Structure alignment (pair).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two molecular tertiary (3D) structures.

Structure alignment (multiple).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of more than two molecular tertiary (3D) structures.

Structure alignment (nucleic acid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of nucleic acid tertiary (3D) structures.

Structure alignment (protein pair).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures.

Multiple protein tertiary structure alig.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of more than two protein tertiary (3D) structures.

Structure alignment (protein all atoms).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of protein tertiary (3D) structures (all atoms considered).

Structure alignment (protein C-alpha ato.rdfs:comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be considered.
Structure alignment (protein C-alpha ato.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of protein tertiary (3D) structures (typically C-alpha atoms only considered).

Pairwise protein tertiary structure alig.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures (all atoms considered).

Pairwise protein tertiary structure alig.rdfs:comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
Pairwise protein tertiary structure alig.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures (typically C-alpha atoms only considered).

Multiple protein tertiary structure alig.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures (all atoms considered).

Multiple protein tertiary structure alig.rdfs:comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
Multiple protein tertiary structure alig.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures (typically C-alpha atoms only considered).

Structure alignment (nucleic acid pair).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two nucleic acid tertiary (3D) structures.

Multiple nucleic acid tertiary structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of more than two nucleic acid tertiary (3D) structures.

Structural transformation matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Matrix to transform (rotate/translate) 3D coordinates, typically the transformation necessary to superimpose two molecular structures.

DaliLite hit table.rdfs:comment: The significant and top-scoring hits for regions of the compared structures is shown. Data such as Z-Scores, number of aligned residues, root-mean-square deviation (RMSD) of atoms and sequence identity are given.
DaliLite hit table.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: DaliLite hit table of protein chain tertiary structure alignment data.

Molecular similarity score.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A score reflecting structural similarities of two molecules.

Root-mean-square deviation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Root-mean-square deviation (RMSD) is calculated to measure the average distance between superimposed macromolecular coordinates.

Tanimoto similarity score.rdfs:comment: A ligand fingerprint is derived from ligand structural data from a Protein DataBank file. It reflects the elements or groups present or absent, covalent bonds and bond orders and the bonded environment in terms of SATIS codes and BLEEP atom types.
Tanimoto similarity score.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A measure of the similarity between two ligand fingerprints.

3D-1D scoring matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A matrix of 3D-1D scores reflecting the probability of amino acids to occur in different tertiary structural environments.

Amino acid index.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A table of 20 numerical values which quantify a property (e.g. physicochemical or biochemical) of the common amino acids.

Amino acid index (chemical classes).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Chemical classification (small, aliphatic, aromatic, polar, charged etc) of amino acids.

Amino acid index (hydropathy).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Hydrophobic, hydrophilic or charge properties of amino acids.

Amino acid index (White-Wimley data).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Experimental free energy values for the water-interface and water-octanol transitions for the amino acids.

Amino acid index (van der Waals radii).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Van der Waals radii of atoms for different amino acid residues.

Enzyme report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific enzyme.

Restriction enzyme report.rdfs:comment: This might include name of enzyme, organism, isoschizomers, methylation, source, suppliers, literature references, or data on restriction enzyme patterns such as name of enzyme, recognition site, length of pattern, number of cuts made by enzyme, details of blunt or sticky end cut etc.
Restriction enzyme report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific restriction enzyme such as enzyme reference data.

Peptide molecular weights.rdfs:comment: The report might include associated data such as frequency of peptide fragment molecular weights.
Peptide molecular weights.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: List of molecular weight(s) of one or more proteins or peptides, for example cut by proteolytic enzymes or reagents.

Peptide hydrophobic moment.rdfs:comment: Hydrophobic moment is a peptides hydrophobicity measured for different angles of rotation.
Peptide hydrophobic moment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report on the hydrophobic moment of a polypeptide sequence.

Protein aliphatic index.rdfs:comment: The aliphatic index is the relative protein volume occupied by aliphatic side chains.
Protein aliphatic index.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The aliphatic index of a protein.

Protein sequence hydropathy plot.rdfs:comment: Hydrophobic moment is a peptides hydrophobicity measured for different angles of rotation.
Protein sequence hydropathy plot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein sequence with annotation on hydrophobic or hydrophilic / charged regions, hydrophobicity plot etc.

Protein charge plot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A plot of the mean charge of the amino acids within a window of specified length as the window is moved along a protein sequence.

Protein solubility.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The solubility or atomic solvation energy of a protein sequence or structure.

Protein crystallizability.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on the crystallizability of a protein sequence.

Protein globularity.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on the stability, intrinsic disorder or globularity of a protein sequence.

Protein titration curve.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The titration curve of a protein.

Protein isoelectric point.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The isoelectric point of one proteins.

Protein pKa value.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The pKa value of a protein.

Protein hydrogen exchange rate.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The hydrogen exchange rate of a protein.

Protein extinction coefficient.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The extinction coefficient of a protein.

Protein optical density.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The optical density of a protein.

Protein subcellular localization.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on protein subcellular localization (nuclear, cytoplasmic, mitochondrial, chloroplast, plastid, membrane etc) or destination (exported / extracellular proteins).

Peptide immunogenicity data.rdfs:comment: This includes data on peptide ligands that elicit an immune response (immunogens), allergic cross-reactivity, predicted antigenicity (Hopp and Woods plot) etc. These data are useful in the development of peptide-specific antibodies or multi-epitope vaccines. Methods might use sequence data (for example motifs) and / or structural data.
Peptide immunogenicity data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An report on allergenicity / immunogenicity of peptides and proteins.

MHC peptide immunogenicity report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on the immunogenicity of MHC class I or class II binding peptides.

Protein structure report.rdfs:comment: This includes for example reports on the surface properties (shape, hydropathy, electrostatic patches etc) of a protein structure, protein flexibility or motion, and protein architecture (spatial arrangement of secondary structure).
Protein structure report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotation on or structural information derived from one or more specific protein 3D structure(s) or structural domains.

Protein structural quality report.rdfs:comment: Model validation might involve checks for atomic packing, steric clashes, agreement with electron density maps etc.
Protein structural quality report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report on the quality of a protein three-dimensional model.

Protein residue interactions.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The processing and analysis of inter-atomic or inter-residue interactions in protein (3D) structures.

Protein flexibility or motion report.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
Protein flexibility or motion report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Informative report on flexibility or motion of a protein structure.

Protein solvent accessibility.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation. This concept covers definitions of the protein surface, interior and interfaces, accessible and buried residues, surface accessible pockets, interior inaccessible cavities etc.
Protein solvent accessibility.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on the solvent accessible or buried surface area of a protein structure.

Protein surface report.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
Protein surface report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on the surface properties (shape, hydropathy, electrostatic patches etc) of a protein structure.

Ramachandran plot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Phi/psi angle data or a Ramachandran plot of a protein structure.

Protein dipole moment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on the net charge distribution (dipole moment) of a protein structure.

Protein distance matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A matrix of distances between amino acid residues (for example the C-alpha atoms) in a protein structure.

Protein contact map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An amino acid residue contact map for a protein structure.

Protein residue 3D cluster.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report on clusters of contacting residues in protein structures such as a key structural residue network.

Protein hydrogen bonds.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Patterns of hydrogen bonding in protein structures.

Protein non-canonical interactions.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Non-canonical atomic interactions in protein structures.

CATH node.rdfs:comment: The report (for example http://www.cathdb.info/cathnode/1.10.10.10) includes CATH code (of the node and upper levels in the hierarchy), classification text (of appropriate levels in hierarchy), list of child nodes, representative domain and other relevant data and links.
CATH node.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a node from the CATH database.

SCOP node.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a node from the SCOP database.

EMBASSY domain classification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An EMBASSY domain classification file (DCF) of classification and other data for domains from SCOP or CATH, in EMBL-like format.

CATH class.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'class' node from the CATH database.

CATH architecture.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'architecture' node from the CATH database.

CATH topology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'topology' node from the CATH database.

CATH homologous superfamily.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'homologous superfamily' node from the CATH database.

CATH structurally similar group.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'structurally similar group' node from the CATH database.

CATH functional category.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'functional category' node from the CATH database.

Protein fold recognition report.rdfs:comment: Methods use some type of mapping between sequence and fold, for example secondary structure prediction and alignment, profile comparison, sequence properties, homologous sequence search, kernel machines etc. Domains and folds might be taken from SCOP or CATH.
Protein fold recognition report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on known protein structural domains or folds that are recognized (identified) in protein sequence(s).

Protein-protein interaction report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein-protein interaction(s), including interactions between protein domains.

Protein-ligand interaction report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on protein-ligand (small molecule) interaction(s).

Nucleic acid melting profile.rdfs:comment: A melting (stability) profile calculated the free energy required to unwind and separate the nucleic acid strands, plotted for sliding windows over a sequence.
Nucleic acid melting profile.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on the dissociation characteristics of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or a DNA/RNA hybrid) during heating.

Nucleic acid enthalpy.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Enthalpy of hybridized or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).

Nucleic acid entropy.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entropy of hybridized or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).

Nucleic acid melting temperature.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A temperature concerning nucleic acid denaturation, typically the temperature at which the two strands of a hybridized or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA) molecule separate.

Nucleic acid stitch profile.rdfs:comment: A stitch profile diagram shows partly melted DNA conformations (with probabilities) at a range of temperatures. For example, a stitch profile might show possible loop openings with their location, size, probability and fluctuations at a given temperature.
Nucleic acid stitch profile.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Stitch profile of hybridized or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).

DNA base pair stacking energies data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: DNA base pair stacking energies data.

DNA base pair twist angle data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: DNA base pair twist angle data.

DNA base trimer roll angles data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: DNA base trimer roll angles data.

Vienna RNA parameters.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: RNA parameters used by the Vienna package.

Vienna RNA structure constraints.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Structure constraints used by the Vienna package.

Vienna RNA concentration data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: RNA concentration data used by the Vienna package.

Vienna RNA calculated energy.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: RNA calculated energy data generated by the Vienna package.

Base pairing probability matrix dotplot.rdfs:comment: Such as generated by the Vienna package.
Base pairing probability matrix dotplot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Dotplot of RNA base pairing probability matrix.

Nucleic acid folding report.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
Nucleic acid folding report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on an analysis of RNA/DNA folding, minimum folding energies for DNA or RNA sequences, energy landscape of RNA mutants etc.

Codon usage table.rdfs:comment: A codon usage table might include the codon usage table name, optional comments and a table with columns for codons and corresponding codon usage data. A genetic code can be extracted from or represented by a codon usage table.
Codon usage table.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Table of codon usage data calculated from one or more nucleic acid sequences.

Genetic code.rdfs:comment: A genetic code need not include detailed codon usage information.
Genetic code.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A genetic code for an organism.

Codon adaptation index.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A simple measure of synonymous codon usage bias often used to predict gene expression levels.

Codon usage bias plot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A plot of the synonymous codon usage calculated for windows over a nucleotide sequence.

Nc statistic.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The effective number of codons used in a gene sequence.  This reflects how far codon usage of a gene departs from equal usage of synonymous codons.

Codon usage fraction difference.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The differences in codon usage fractions between two codon usage tables.

Pharmacogenomic test report.rdfs:comment: The report might correlate gene expression or single-nucleotide polymorphisms with drug efficacy or toxicity.
Pharmacogenomic test report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on the influence of genotype on drug response.

Disease report.rdfs:comment: For example, an informative report on a specific tumor including nature and origin of the sample, anatomic site, organ or tissue, tumor type, including morphology and/or histologic type, and so on.
Disease report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific disease.

Linkage disequilibrium (report).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on linkage disequilibrium; the non-random association of alleles or polymorphisms at two or more loci (not necessarily on the same chromosome).

Heat map.rdfs:comment: A heat map is a table where rows and columns correspond to different genes and contexts (for example, cells or samples) and the cell color represents the level of expression of a gene that context.
Heat map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A graphical 2D tabular representation of gene expression data, typically derived from a DNA microarray experiment.

Affymetrix probe sets library file.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Affymetrix library file of information about which probes belong to which probe set.

Affymetrix probe sets information librar.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Affymetrix library file of information about the probe sets such as the gene name with which the probe set is associated.

Molecular weights standard fingerprint.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Standard protonated molecular masses from trypsin (modified porcine trypsin, Promega) and keratin peptides, used in EMBOSS.

Metabolic pathway report.rdfs:comment: This includes carbohydrate, energy, lipid, nucleotide, amino acid, glycan, PK/NRP, cofactor/vitamin, secondary metabolite, xenobiotics etc.
Metabolic pathway report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report typically including a map (diagram) of a metabolic pathway.

Genetic information processing pathway r.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning genetic information processing pathways.

Environmental information processing pat.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning environmental information processing pathways.

Signal transduction pathway report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report typically including a map (diagram) of a signal transduction pathway.

Disease pathway or network report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning disease pathways, typically of human disease.

Drug structure relationship map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report typically including a map (diagram) of drug structure relationships.

Protein interaction networks.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning networks of protein interactions.

MIRIAM datatype.rdfs:comment: A MIRIAM entry describes a MIRIAM data type including the official name, synonyms, root URI, identifier pattern (regular expression applied to a unique identifier of the data type) and documentation. Each data type can be associated with several resources. Each resource is a physical location of a service (typically a database) providing information on the elements of a data type. Several resources may exist for each data type, provided the same (mirrors) or different information. MIRIAM provides a stable and persistent reference to its data types.
MIRIAM datatype.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An entry (data type) from the Minimal Information Requested in the Annotation of Biochemical Models (MIRIAM) database of data resources.

E-value.rdfs:comment: An expectation value (E-Value) is the expected number of observations which are at least as extreme as observations expected to occur by random chance. The E-value describes the number of hits with a given score or better that are expected to occur at random when searching a database of a particular size. It decreases exponentially with the score (S) of a hit. A low E value indicates a more significant score.
E-value.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the lower or upper limit of an expectation value (E-value).

Z-value.rdfs:comment: A z-value might be specified as a threshold for reporting hits from database searches.
Z-value.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The z-value is the number of standard deviations a data value is above or below a mean value.

P-value.rdfs:comment: A z-value might be specified as a threshold for reporting hits from database searches.
P-value.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The P-value is the probability of obtaining by random chance a result that is at least as extreme as an observed result, assuming a NULL hypothesis is true.

Database version information.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a database (or ontology) version, for example name, version number and release date.

Tool version information.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on an application version, for example name, version number and release date.

CATH version information.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a version of the CATH database.

Swiss-Prot to PDB mapping.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Cross-mapping of Swiss-Prot codes to PDB identifiers.

Sequence database cross-references.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Cross-references from a sequence record to other databases.

Job status.rdfs:comment: Values for EBI services are 'DONE' (job has finished and the results can then be retrieved), 'ERROR' (the job failed or no results where found), 'NOT_FOUND' (the job id is no longer available; job results might be deleted, 'PENDING' (the job is in a queue waiting processing), 'RUNNING' (the job is currently being processed).
Job status.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Metadata on the status of a submitted job.

Job ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The (typically numeric) unique identifier of a submitted job.

Job type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of job, for example interactive or non-interactive.

Tool log.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report of tool-specific metadata on some analysis or process performed, for example a log of diagnostic or error messages.

DaliLite log file.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: DaliLite log file describing all the steps taken by a DaliLite alignment of two protein structures.

Username.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A username on a computer system.

Password.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A password on a computer system.

Email address.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A valid email address of an end-user.

Number of iterations.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Number of iterations of an algorithm.

Number of output entities.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Number of entities (for example database hits, sequences, alignments etc) to write to an output file.

Hit sort order.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Controls the order of hits (reported matches) in an output file from a database search.

Drug report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific drug.

Phylogenetic tree image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An image (for viewing or printing) of a phylogenetic tree including (typically) a plot of rooted or unrooted phylogenies, cladograms, circular trees or phenograms and associated information.

RNA secondary structure image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Image of RNA secondary structure, knots, pseudoknots etc.

Structure image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Image of one or more molecular tertiary (3D) structures.

Sequence alignment image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Image of two or more aligned molecular sequences possibly annotated with alignment features.

Chemical structure image.rdfs:comment: The molecular identifier and formula are typically included.
Chemical structure image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An image of the structure of a small chemical compound.

Fate map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A fate map is a plan of early stage of an embryo such as a blastula, showing areas that are significance to development.

Microarray spots image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An image of spots from a microarray experiment.

BioPax term.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term from the BioPax ontology.

GO.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term definition from The Gene Ontology (GO).

MeSH.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term from the MeSH vocabulary.

HGNC.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term from the HGNC controlled vocabulary.

NCBI taxonomy vocabulary.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term from the NCBI taxonomy vocabulary.

Plant ontology term.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term from the Plant Ontology (PO).

UMLS.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term from the UMLS vocabulary.

FMA.rdfs:comment: Classifies anatomical entities according to their shared characteristics (genus) and distinguishing characteristics (differentia). Specifies the part-whole and spatial relationships of the entities, morphological transformation of the entities during prenatal development and the postnatal life cycle and principles, rules and definitions according to which classes and relationships in the other three components of FMA are represented.
FMA.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term from Foundational Model of Anatomy.

EMAP.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term from the EMAP mouse ontology.

ChEBI.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term from the ChEBI ontology.

MGED.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term from the MGED ontology.

myGrid.rdfs:comment: The ontology is provided as two components, the service ontology and the domain ontology. The domain ontology acts provides concepts for core bioinformatics data types and their relations. The service ontology describes the physical and operational features of web services.
myGrid.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term from the myGrid ontology.

GO (biological process).rdfs:comment: Data Type is an enumerated string.
GO (biological process).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term definition for a biological process from the Gene Ontology (GO).

GO (molecular function).rdfs:comment: Data Type is an enumerated string.
GO (molecular function).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term definition for a molecular function from the Gene Ontology (GO).

GO (cellular component).rdfs:comment: Data Type is an enumerated string.
GO (cellular component).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term definition for a cellular component from the Gene Ontology (GO).

Ontology relation type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A relation type defined in an ontology.

Ontology concept definition.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The definition of a concept from an ontology.

Ontology concept comment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A comment on a concept from an ontology.

Ontology concept reference.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Reference for a concept from an ontology.

doc2loc document information.rdfs:comment: The doc2loc output includes the url, format, type and availability code of a document for every service provider.
doc2loc document information.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a published article provided by the doc2loc program.

PDB residue number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A residue identifier (a string) from a PDB file.

Atomic coordinate.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Cartesian coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).

Atomic x coordinate.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Cartesian x coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).

Atomic y coordinate.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Cartesian y coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).

Atomic z coordinate.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Cartesian z coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).

PDB atom name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier (a string) of a specific atom from a PDB file for a molecular structure.

Protein atom.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
Protein atom.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on a single atom from a protein structure.

Protein residue.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
Protein residue.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on a single amino acid residue position in a protein structure.

PDB residue name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Three-letter amino acid residue names as used in PDB files.

PDB model number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a model structure from a PDB file.

CATH domain report.rdfs:comment: The report (for example http://www.cathdb.info/domain/1cukA01) includes CATH codes for levels in the hierarchy for the domain, level descriptions and relevant data and links.
CATH domain report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Summary of domain classification information for a CATH domain.

CATH representative domain sequences (AT.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: FASTA sequence database (based on ATOM records in PDB) for CATH domains (clustered at different levels of sequence identity).

CATH representative domain sequences (CO.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: FASTA sequence database (based on COMBS sequence data) for CATH domains (clustered at different levels of sequence identity).

CATH domain sequences (ATOM).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: FASTA sequence database for all CATH domains (based on PDB ATOM records).

CATH domain sequences (COMBS).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: FASTA sequence database for all CATH domains (based on COMBS sequence data).

Sequence version.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on an molecular sequence version.

Score.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A numerical value, that is some type of scored value arising for example from a prediction method.

Protein report (function).rdfs:comment: For properties that can be mapped to a sequence, use 'Sequence report' instead.
Protein report (function).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report on general functional properties of specific protein(s).

Gene name (ASPGD).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of a gene from Aspergillus Genome Database.

Gene name (CGD).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of a gene from Candida Genome Database.

Gene name (dictyBase).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of a gene from dictyBase database.

Gene name (EcoGene primary).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Primary name of a gene from EcoGene Database.

Gene name (MaizeGDB).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of a gene from MaizeGDB (maize genes) database.

Gene name (SGD).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of a gene from Saccharomyces Genome Database.

Gene name (TGD).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of a gene from Tetrahymena Genome Database.

Gene name (CGSC).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Symbol of a gene from E.coli Genetic Stock Center.

Gene name (HGNC).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Symbol of a gene approved by the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee.

Gene name (MGD).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Symbol of a gene from the Mouse Genome Database.

Gene name (Bacillus subtilis).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Symbol of a gene from Bacillus subtilis Genome Sequence Project.

Gene ID (PlasmoDB).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from PlasmoDB Plasmodium Genome Resource.

Gene ID (EcoGene).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from EcoGene Database.

Gene ID (GeneDB Glossina morsitans).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Glossina morsitans GeneDB database.

Gene ID (GeneDB Leishmania major).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Leishmania major GeneDB database.

Gene ID (GeneDB Plasmodium falciparum).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Plasmodium falciparum GeneDB database.

Gene ID (GeneDB Schizosaccharomyces pomb.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Schizosaccharomyces pombe GeneDB database.

Gene ID (GeneDB Trypanosoma brucei).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Trypanosoma brucei GeneDB database.

Gene ID (Virginia microbial).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Virginia Bioinformatics Institute microbial database.

Gene ID (SGN).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Sol Genomics Network.

Gene ID (WormBase).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Gene identifier used by WormBase database.

Gene synonym.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Any name (other than the recommended one) for a gene.

ORF name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of an open reading frame attributed by a sequencing project.

Sequence assembly component.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A component of a larger sequence assembly.

Chromosome annotation (aberration).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on a chromosome aberration such as abnormalities in chromosome structure.

Clone ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a clone (cloned molecular sequence) from a database.

PDB insertion code.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An insertion code (part of the residue number) for an amino acid residue from a PDB file.

Atomic occupancy.rdfs:comment: The sum of the occupancies of all the atom types at a site should not normally significantly exceed 1.0.
Atomic occupancy.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The fraction of an atom type present at a site in a molecular structure.

Isotropic B factor.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Isotropic B factor (atomic displacement parameter) for an atom from a PDB file.

Deletion map.rdfs:comment: A cytogenetic map is built from a set of mutant cell lines with sub-chromosomal deletions and a reference wild-type line ('genome deletion panel'). The panel is used to map markers onto the genome by comparing mutant to wild-type banding patterns. Markers are linked (occur in the same deleted region) if they share the same banding pattern (presence or absence) as the deletion panel.
Deletion map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A cytogenetic map showing chromosome banding patterns in mutant cell lines relative to the wild type.

QTL map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A genetic map which shows the approximate location of quantitative trait loci (QTL) between two or more markers.

Haplotype map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A map of haplotypes in a genome or other sequence, describing common patterns of genetic variation.

Map set data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data describing a set of multiple genetic or physical maps, typically sharing a common set of features which are mapped.

Map feature.rdfs:comment: Mappable features may be based on Gramene's notion of map features; see http://www.gramene.org/db/cmap/feature_type_info.
Map feature.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A feature which may mapped (positioned) on a genetic or other type of map.

Map type.rdfs:comment: Map types may be based on Gramene's notion of a map type; see http://www.gramene.org/db/cmap/map_type_info.
Map type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A designation of the type of map (genetic map, physical map, sequence map etc) or map set.

Protein fold name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a protein fold.

Taxon.rdfs:comment: For a complete list of taxonomic ranks see https://www.phenoscape.org/wiki/Taxonomic_Rank_Vocabulary.
Taxon.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a group of organisms belonging to the same taxonomic rank.

Organism identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a (group of) organisms.

Genus name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a genus of organism.

Taxonomic classification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Classifiication of molecular sequences by assignment to some taxonomic hierarchy.

iHOP organism ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier for an organism used in the iHOP database.

Genbank common name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Common name for an organism as used in the GenBank database.

NCBI taxon.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a taxon from the NCBI taxonomy database.

Misspelling.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A common misspelling of a word.

Acronym.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An abbreviation of a phrase or word.

Misnomer.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A term which is likely to be misleading of its meaning.

Author ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on the authors of a published work.

DragonDB author identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier representing an author in the DragonDB database.

Annotated URI.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A URI along with annotation describing the data found at the address.

UniProt keywords.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A controlled vocabulary for words and phrases that can appear in the keywords field (KW line) of entries from the UniProt database.

Gene ID (GeneFarm).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from the GeneFarm database.

Blattner number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The blattner identifier for a gene.

Gene ID (MIPS Maize).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier for genetic elements in MIPS Maize database.

Gene ID (MIPS Medicago).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier for genetic elements in MIPS Medicago database.

Gene name (DragonDB).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of an Antirrhinum Gene from the DragonDB database.

Gene name (Arabidopsis).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier for an Arabidopsis gene, which is an acronym or abbreviation of the gene name.

iHOP symbol.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a protein or gene used in the iHOP database.

Gene name (GeneFarm).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of a gene from the GeneFarm database.

Locus ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique name or other identifier of a genetic locus, typically conforming to a scheme that names loci (such as predicted genes) depending on their position in a molecular sequence, for example a completely sequenced genome or chromosome.

Locus ID (AGI).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Locus identifier for Arabidopsis Genome Initiative (TAIR, TIGR and MIPS databases)

Locus ID (ASPGD).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from ASPGD (Aspergillus Genome Database).

Locus ID (MGG).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from Magnaporthe grisea Database at the Broad Institute.

Locus ID (CGD).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from CGD (Candida Genome Database).

Locus ID (CMR).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Locus identifier for Comprehensive Microbial Resource at the J. Craig Venter Institute.

NCBI locus tag.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from NCBI database.

Locus ID (SGD).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from SGD (Saccharomyces Genome Database).

Locus ID (MMP).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of loci from Maize Mapping Project.

Locus ID (DictyBase).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of locus from DictyBase (Dictyostelium discoideum).

Locus ID (EntrezGene).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a locus from EntrezGene database.

Locus ID (MaizeGDB).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of locus from MaizeGDB (Maize genome database).

Quantitative trait locus.rdfs:comment: A QTL sometimes but does not necessarily correspond to a gene.
Quantitative trait locus.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A stretch of DNA that is closely linked to the genes underlying a quantitative trait (a phenotype that varies in degree and depends upon the interactions between multiple genes and their environment).

Gene ID (KOME).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from the KOME database.

Locus ID (Tropgene).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a locus from the Tropgene database.

Alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the alignment (equivalence between sites) of molecular sequences, structures or profiles (representing a sequence or structure alignment).

Atomic property.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data for an atom (in a molecular structure).

UniProt keyword.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A word or phrase that can appear in the keywords field (KW line) of entries from the UniProt database.

Ordered locus name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A name for a genetic locus conforming to a scheme that names loci (such as predicted genes) depending on their position in a molecular sequence, for example a completely sequenced genome or chromosome.

Sequence coordinates.rdfs:comment: This includes positions in genomes based on a reference sequence. A position may be specified for any mappable object, i.e. anything that may have positional information such as a physical position in a chromosome. Data might include sequence region name, strand, coordinate system name, assembly name, start position and end position.
Sequence coordinates.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A position in a map (for example a genetic map), either a single position (point) or a region / interval.

Amino acid property.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning the intrinsic physical (e.g. structural) or chemical properties of one, more or all amino acids.

Annotation.rdfs:comment: This is a broad concept and is used a placeholder for other, more specific concepts.
Annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotate an entity (typically a biological or biomedical database entity) with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

Map data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Map data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning a map of molecular sequence(s).

Vienna RNA structural data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data used by the Vienna RNA analysis package.

Sequence mask parameter.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data used to replace (mask) characters in a molecular sequence.

Enzyme kinetics data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Enzyme kinetics data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning chemical reaction(s) catalysed by enzyme(s).

Michaelis Menten plot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A plot giving an approximation of the kinetics of an enzyme-catalysed reaction, assuming simple kinetics (i.e. no intermediate or product inhibition, allostericity or cooperativity). It plots initial reaction rate to the substrate concentration (S) from which the maximum rate (vmax) is apparent.

Hanes Woolf plot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A plot based on the Michaelis Menten equation of enzyme kinetics plotting the ratio of the initial substrate concentration (S) against the reaction velocity (v).

Experimental data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
Experimental data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Raw data from or annotation on laboratory experiments.

Evidence.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Typically a statement about some data or results, including evidence or the source of a statement, which may include computational prediction, laboratory experiment, literature reference etc.

Sequence record lite.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A molecular sequence and minimal metadata, typically an identifier of the sequence and/or a comment.

Sequence.rdfs:comment: This concept is a placeholder of concepts for primary sequence data including raw sequences and sequence records.  It should not normally be used for derivatives such as sequence alignments, motifs or profiles.
Sequence.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: One or more molecular sequences, possibly with associated annotation.

Nucleic acid sequence record (lite).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A nucleic acid sequence and minimal metadata, typically an identifier of the sequence and/or a comment.

Protein sequence record (lite).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein sequence and minimal metadata, typically an identifier of the sequence and/or a comment.

Report.rdfs:comment: You can use this term by default for any textual report, in case you can't find another, more specific term. Reports may be generated automatically or collated by hand and can include metadata on the origin, source, history, ownership or location of some thing.
Report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information including annotation on a biological entity or phenomena, computer-generated reports of analysis of primary data (e.g. sequence or structural), and metadata (data about primary data) or any other free (essentially unformatted) text, as distinct from the primary data itself.

Structural data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

Search parameter.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Some simple value controlling a search operation, typically a search of a database.

Database search results.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report of hits from searching a database of some type.

Secondary structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The secondary structure assignment (predicted or real) of a nucleic acid or protein.

Matrix.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

Alignment data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  This includes entities derived from sequences and structures such as motifs and profiles.
Alignment data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning an alignment of two or more molecular sequences, structures or derived data.

Nucleic acid report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative human-readable report about one or more specific nucleic acid molecules, derived from analysis of primary (sequence or structural) data.

Structure report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on general information, properties or features of one or more molecular tertiary (3D) structures.

Nucleic acid structure data.rdfs:comment: This includes reports on the stiffness, curvature, twist/roll data or other conformational parameters or properties.
Nucleic acid structure data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on nucleic acid structure-derived data, describing structural properties of a DNA molecule, or any other annotation or information about specific nucleic acid 3D structure(s).

Molecular property.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on the physical (e.g. structural) or chemical properties of molecules, or parts of a molecule.

DNA base structural data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Structural data for DNA base pairs or runs of bases, such as energy or angle data.

Database entry version information.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a database (or ontology) entry version, such as name (or other identifier) or parent database, unique identifier of entry, data, author and so on.

Accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A persistent (stable) and unique identifier, typically identifying an object (entry) from a database.

SNP.rdfs:comment: A SNP is a DNA sequence variation where a single nucleotide differs between members of a species or paired chromosomes in an individual.
SNP.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNP) and associated data, for example, the discovery and annotation of SNPs.

Data reference.rdfs:comment: A list of database accessions or identifiers are usually included.
Data reference.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Reference to a dataset (or a cross-reference between two datasets), typically one or more entries in a biological database or ontology.

Job identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a submitted job.

Name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A name of a thing, which need not necessarily uniquely identify it.

Type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of a thing, typically an enumerated string (a string with one of a limited set of values).

User ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a software end-user (typically a person).

KEGG organism code.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A three-letter code used in the KEGG databases to uniquely identify organisms.

Gene name (KEGG GENES).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of an entry (gene) from the KEGG GENES database.

BioCyc ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an object from one of the BioCyc databases.

Compound ID (BioCyc).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a compound from the BioCyc chemical compounds database.

Reaction ID (BioCyc).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological reaction from the BioCyc reactions database.

Enzyme ID (BioCyc).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an enzyme from the BioCyc enzymes database.

Reaction ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological reaction from a database.

Identifier (hybrid).rdfs:comment: This branch provides an alternative organisation of the concepts nested under 'Accession' and 'Name'. All concepts under here are already included under 'Accession' or 'Name'.
Identifier (hybrid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier that is re-used for data objects of fundamentally different types (typically served from a single database).

Codon usage table ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a codon usage table, for example a genetic code.

FlyBase primary identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Primary identifier of an object from the FlyBase database.

WormBase identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an object from the WormBase database.

WormBase wormpep ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Protein identifier used by WormBase database.

Nucleic acid features (codon).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a trinucleotide sequence that encodes an amino acid including the triplet sequence, the encoded amino acid or whether it is a start or stop codon.

Map identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a map of a molecular sequence.

Person identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a software end-user (typically a person).

Nucleic acid identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a nucleic acid molecule.

Translation frame specification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Frame for translation of DNA (3 forward and 3 reverse frames relative to a chromosome).

Genetic code identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a genetic code.

Genetic code name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Informal name for a genetic code, typically an organism name.

File format name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of a file format such as HTML, PNG, PDF, EMBL, GenBank and so on.

Sequence profile type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing a type of sequence profile such as frequency matrix, Gribskov profile, hidden Markov model etc.

Operating system name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of a computer operating system such as Linux, PC or Mac.

Mutation type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A type of point or block mutation, including insertion, deletion, change, duplication and moves.

Logical operator.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A logical operator such as OR, AND, XOR, and NOT.

Results sort order.rdfs:comment: Possible options including sorting by score, rank, by increasing P-value (probability, i.e. most statistically significant hits given first) and so on.
Results sort order.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A control of the order of data that is output, for example the order of sequences in an alignment.

Toggle.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A simple parameter that is a toggle (boolean value), typically a control for a modal tool.

Sequence width.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The width of an output sequence or alignment.

Gap penalty.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A penalty for introducing or extending a gap in an alignment.

Concentration.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The concentration of a chemical compound.

Window step size.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Size of the incremental 'step' a sequence window is moved over a sequence.

EMBOSS graph.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An image of a graph generated by the EMBOSS suite.

EMBOSS report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An application report generated by the EMBOSS suite.

Sequence offset.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An offset for a single-point sequence position.

Threshold.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A value that serves as a threshold for a tool (usually to control scoring or output).

Protein report (transcription factor).rdfs:comment: This might include conformational or physicochemical properties, as well as sequence information for transcription factor(s) binding sites.
Protein report (transcription factor).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a transcription factor protein.

Database category name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a category of biological or bioinformatics database.

Color.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Specification of one or more colors.

Rendering parameter.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A parameter that is used to control rendering (drawing) to a device or image.

Sequence name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Any arbitrary name of a molecular sequence.

Word composition.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Word composition data for a molecular sequence.

Fickett testcode plot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A plot of Fickett testcode statistic (identifying protein coding regions) in a nucleotide sequences.

Sequence similarity plot.rdfs:comment: Use this concept for calculated substitution rates, relative site variability, data on sites with biased properties, highly conserved or very poorly conserved sites, regions, blocks etc.
Sequence similarity plot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A plot of sequence similarities identified from word-matching or character comparison.

Helical wheel.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An image of peptide sequence sequence looking down the axis of the helix for highlighting amphipathicity and other properties.

Helical net.rdfs:comment: Useful for highlighting amphipathicity and other properties.
Helical net.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An image of peptide sequence sequence in a simple 3,4,3,4 repeating pattern that emulates at a simple level the arrangement of residues around an alpha helix.

Protein sequence properties plot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A plot of general physicochemical properties of a protein sequence.

Protein ionization curve.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A plot of pK versus pH for a protein.

Sequence composition plot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A plot of character or word composition / frequency of a molecular sequence.

Nucleic acid density plot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Density plot (of base composition) for a nucleotide sequence.

Sequence trace image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Image of a sequence trace (nucleotide sequence versus probabilities of each of the 4 bases).

Nucleic acid features (siRNA).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on siRNA duplexes in mRNA.

Sequence set (stream).rdfs:comment: This concept may be used for sequence sets that are expected to be read and processed a single sequence at a time.
Sequence set (stream).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A collection of multiple molecular sequences and (typically) associated metadata that is intended for sequential processing.

FlyBase secondary identifier.rdfs:comment: Secondary identifier are used to handle entries that were merged with or split from other entries in the database.
FlyBase secondary identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Secondary identifier of an object from the FlyBase database.

Cardinality.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The number of a certain thing.

Sequence checksum.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A fixed-size datum calculated (by using a hash function) for a molecular sequence, typically for purposes of error detection or indexing.

Protein features report (chemical modifi.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning chemical modification of a protein.

Error.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on an error generated by computer system or tool.

Database entry metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Basic information on any arbitrary database entry.

Sequence record full.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A molecular sequence and comprehensive metadata (such as a feature table), typically corresponding to a full entry from a molecular sequence database.

Plasmid identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a plasmid in a database.

Mutation ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a specific mutation catalogued in a database.

Mutation annotation (basic).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information describing the mutation itself, the organ site, tissue and type of lesion where the mutation has been identified, description of the patient origin and life-style.

Mutation annotation (prevalence).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on the prevalence of mutation(s), including data on samples and mutation prevalence (e.g. by tumour type)..

Mutation annotation (prognostic).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on mutation prognostic data, such as information on patient cohort, the study settings and the results of the study.

Mutation annotation (functional).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on the functional properties of mutant proteins including transcriptional activities, promotion of cell growth and tumorigenicity, dominant negative effects, capacity to induce apoptosis, cell-cycle arrest or checkpoints in human cells and so on.

Codon number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The number of a codon, for instance, at which a mutation is located.

Tumor annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific tumor including nature and origin of the sample, anatomic site, organ or tissue, tumor type, including morphology and/or histologic type, and so on.

Server metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Basic information about a server on the web, such as an SRS server.

Database field name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a field in a database.

Sequence cluster ID (SYSTERS).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a sequence cluster from the SYSTERS database.

Raw SCOP domain classification.rdfs:comment: These are the parsable data files provided by SCOP.
Raw SCOP domain classification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Raw SCOP domain classification data files.

Raw CATH domain classification.rdfs:comment: These are the parsable data files provided by CATH.
Raw CATH domain classification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Raw CATH domain classification data files.

Heterogen annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on the types of small molecules or 'heterogens' (non-protein groups) that are represented in PDB files.

Sequence set (bootstrapped).rdfs:comment: Bootstrapping is often performed in phylogenetic analysis.
Sequence set (bootstrapped).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A collection of sequences output from a bootstrapping (resampling) procedure.

Phylogenetic consensus tree.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A consensus phylogenetic tree derived from comparison of multiple trees.

Schema.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A data schema for organising or transforming data of some type.

Data resource definition name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a data type.

OBO file format name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of an OBO file format such as OBO-XML, plain and so on.

Gene ID (MIPS).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier for genetic elements in MIPS database.

Sequence identifier (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of protein sequence(s) or protein sequence database entries.

Sequence identifier (nucleic acid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of nucleotide sequence(s) or nucleotide sequence database entries.

EMBL accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An accession number of an entry from the EMBL sequence database.

UniProt ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a polypeptide in the UniProt database.

GenBank accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the GenBank sequence database.

Gramene secondary identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Secondary (internal) identifier of a Gramene database entry.

Sequence variation ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of an entry from a database of molecular sequence variation.

Gene ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique (and typically persistent) identifier of a gene in a database, that is (typically) different to the gene name/symbol.

Gene name (AceView).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of an entry (gene) from the AceView genes database.

Gene ID (ECK).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an E. coli K-12 gene from EcoGene Database.

Gene ID (HGNC).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier for a gene approved by the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee.

Gene name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a gene, (typically) assigned by a person and/or according to a naming scheme. It may contain white space characters and is typically more intuitive and readable than a gene symbol. It (typically) may be used to identify similar genes in different species and to derive a gene symbol.

Gene name (NCBI).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of an entry (gene) from the NCBI genes database.

SMILES string.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A specification of a chemical structure in SMILES format.

STRING ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the STRING database of protein-protein interactions.

Virus annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific virus.

Virus annotation (taxonomy).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on the taxonomy of a specific virus.

Reaction ID (SABIO-RK).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological reaction from the SABIO-RK reactions database.

Carbohydrate report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotation on or information derived from one or more specific carbohydrate 3D structure(s).

GI number.rdfs:comment: Nucleotide sequence GI number is shown in the VERSION field of the database record. Protein sequence GI number is shown in the CDS/db_xref field of a nucleotide database record, and the VERSION field of a protein database record.
GI number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A series of digits that are assigned consecutively to each sequence record processed by NCBI. The GI number bears no resemblance to the Accession number of the sequence record.

NCBI version.rdfs:comment: Nucleotide sequence version contains two letters followed by six digits, a dot, and a version number (or for older nucleotide sequence records, the format is one letter followed by five digits, a dot, and a version number). Protein sequence version contains three letters followed by five digits, a dot, and a version number.
NCBI version.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier assigned to sequence records processed by NCBI, made of the accession number of the database record followed by a dot and a version number.

Cell line name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.

Cell line name (exact).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.

Cell line name (truncated).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.

Cell line name (no punctuation).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.

Cell line name (assonant).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.

Enzyme ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique, persistent identifier of an enzyme.

REBASE enzyme number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an enzyme from the REBASE enzymes database.

DrugBank ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a drug from the DrugBank database.

GI number (protein).rdfs:comment: Nucleotide sequence GI number is shown in the VERSION field of the database record. Protein sequence GI number is shown in the CDS/db_xref field of a nucleotide database record, and the VERSION field of a protein database record.
GI number (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier assigned to NCBI protein sequence records.

Bit score.rdfs:comment: Bit scores are normalized with respect to the scoring system and therefore can be used to compare alignment scores from different searches.
Bit score.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A score derived from the alignment of two sequences, which is then normalized with respect to the scoring system.

Translation phase specification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Phase for translation of DNA (0, 1 or 2) relative to a fragment of the coding sequence.

Resource metadata.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Resource metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning or describing some core computational resource, as distinct from primary data.  This includes metadata on the origin, source, history, ownership or location of some thing.

Ontology identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Any arbitrary identifier of an ontology.

Ontology concept name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a concept in an ontology.

Genome build identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a build of a particular genome.

Pathway or network name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a biological pathway or network.

Pathway ID (KEGG).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the KEGG pathway database.

Pathway ID (NCI-Nature).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the NCI-Nature pathway database.

Pathway ID (ConsensusPathDB).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the ConsensusPathDB pathway database.

Sequence cluster ID (UniRef).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the UniRef database.

Sequence cluster ID (UniRef100).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the UniRef100 database.

Sequence cluster ID (UniRef90).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the UniRef90 database.

Sequence cluster ID (UniRef50).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the UniRef50 database.

Ontology data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Ontology data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning or derived from an ontology.

RNA family report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific RNA family or other group of classified RNA sequences.

RNA family identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an RNA family, typically an entry from a RNA sequence classification database.

RFAM accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Stable accession number of an entry (RNA family) from the RFAM database.

Protein signature type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing a type of protein family signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.

Domain-nucleic acid interaction report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on protein domain-DNA/RNA interaction(s).

Domain-domain interactions.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on protein domain-protein domain interaction(s).

Domain-domain interaction (indirect).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on indirect protein domain-protein domain interaction(s).

Sequence accession (hybrid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of a nucleotide or protein sequence database entry.

2D PAGE data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.

2D PAGE report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning two-dimensional gel electrophoresis experiments, gels or spots in a gel.

Pathway or network accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A persistent, unique identifier of a biological pathway or network (typically a database entry).

Secondary structure alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment of the (1D representations of) secondary structure of two or more molecules.

ASTD ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an object from the ASTD database.

ASTD ID (exon).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an exon from the ASTD database.

ASTD ID (intron).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an intron from the ASTD database.

ASTD ID (polya).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a polyA signal from the ASTD database.

ASTD ID (tss).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a transcription start site from the ASTD database.

2D PAGE spot report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on individual spot(s) from a two-dimensional (2D PAGE) gel.

Spot ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a spot from a two-dimensional (protein) gel.

Spot serial number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a spot from a two-dimensional (protein) gel in the SWISS-2DPAGE database.

Spot ID (HSC-2DPAGE).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a spot from a two-dimensional (protein) gel from a HSC-2DPAGE database.

Protein-motif interaction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on the interaction of a protein (or protein domain) with specific structural (3D) and/or sequence motifs.

Strain identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a strain of an organism variant, typically a plant, virus or bacterium.

CABRI accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of an item from the CABRI database.

Experiment report (genotyping).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report of genotype experiment including case control, population, and family studies. These might use array based methods and re-sequencing methods.

Genotype experiment ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of genotype experiment metadata.

EGA accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the EGA database.

IPI protein ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein entry catalogued in the International Protein Index (IPI) database.

RefSeq accession (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of a protein from the RefSeq database.

EPD ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (promoter) from the EPD database.

TAIR accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the TAIR database.

TAIR accession (At gene).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an Arabidopsis thaliana gene from the TAIR database.

UniSTS accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the UniSTS database.

UNITE accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the UNITE database.

UTR accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the UTR database.

UniParc accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of a UniParc (protein sequence) database entry.

mFLJ/mKIAA number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the Rouge or HUGE databases.

Fungi annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific fungus.

Fungi annotation (anamorph).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific fungus anamorph.

Gene features report (exon).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning exons in a nucleotide sequences.

Ensembl protein ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a protein from the Ensembl database.

Gene transcriptional features report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning transcription of DNA into RNA including the regulation of transcription.

Toxin annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific toxin.

Protein report (membrane protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a membrane protein.

Protein-drug interaction report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on tentative or known protein-drug interaction(s).

Phylogenetic data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Phylogenetic data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning phylogeny, typically of molecular sequences, including reports of information concerning or derived from a phylogenetic tree, or from comparing two or more phylogenetic trees.

Protein data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Protein data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning one or more protein molecules.

Nucleic acid data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Nucleic acid data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning one or more nucleic acid molecules.

Article data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation. It includes concepts that are best described as scientific text or closely concerned with or derived from text.
Article data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning, extracted from, or derived from the analysis of a scientific text (or texts) such as a full text article from a scientific journal.

Parameter.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Typically a simple numerical or string value that controls the operation of a tool.

Molecular data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Molecular data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning a specific type of molecule.

Molecule report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific molecule.

Organism report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific organism.

Experiment report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotation on a wet lab experiment, such as experimental conditions.

Sequence attribute.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An attribute of a molecular sequence, possibly in reference to some other sequence.

Sequence tag profile.rdfs:comment: SAGE, MPSS and SBS experiments are usually performed to study gene expression.  The sequence tags are typically subsequently annotated (after a database search) with the mRNA (and therefore gene) the tag was extracted from.
Sequence tag profile.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Output from a serial analysis of gene expression (SAGE), massively parallel signature sequencing (MPSS) or sequencing by synthesis (SBS) experiment.  In all cases this is a list of short sequence tags and the number of times it is observed.

Mass spectrometry data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning a mass spectrometry measurement.

Protein structure raw data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
Protein structure raw data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Raw data from experimental methods for determining protein structure.

Data index data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Data index data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning an index of data.

Amino acid name (single letter).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Single letter amino acid identifier, e.g. G.

Amino acid name (three letter).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Three letter amino acid identifier, e.g. GLY.

Amino acid name (full name).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Full name of an amino acid, e.g. Glycine.

ArachnoServer ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a toxin from the ArachnoServer database.
