Expressed gene list.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A simple summary of expressed genes.

BindingDB Monomer ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a monomer from the BindingDB database.

GO concept name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a concept from the GO ontology.

GO concept ID (biological process).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a 'biological process' concept from the the Gene Ontology.

GO concept ID (molecular function).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a 'molecular function' concept from the the Gene Ontology.

GO concept name (cellular component).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a concept for a cellular component from the GO ontology.

Northern blot image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An image arising from a Northern Blot experiment.

Blot ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a blot from a Northern Blot.

BlotBase blot ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a blot from a Northern Blot from the BlotBase database.

Hierarchy.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Raw data on a biological hierarchy, describing the hierarchy proper, hierarchy components and possibly associated annotation.

Hierarchy identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of biological hierarchies.

Brite hierarchy ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the Brite database of biological hierarchies.

Cancer type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A type (represented as a string) of cancer.

BRENDA organism ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier for an organism used in the BRENDA database.

UniGene taxon.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a taxon using the controlled vocabulary of the UniGene database.

UTRdb taxon.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a taxon using the controlled vocabulary of the UTRdb database.

Catalogue ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a catalogue of biological resources.

CABRI catalogue name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a catalogue of biological resources from the CABRI database.

Secondary structure alignment metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on protein secondary structure alignment-derived data or metadata.

Molecule interaction report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on the physical, chemical or other information concerning the interaction of two or more molecules (or parts of molecules).

Pathway or network.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Primary data about a specific biological pathway or network (the nodes and connections within the pathway or network).

Small molecule data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Small molecule data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning one or more small molecules.

Genotype and phenotype data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning a particular genotype, phenotype or a genotype / phenotype relation.

Gene expression data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  See also http://edamontology.org/data_0931
Gene expression data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Image or hybridisation data for a microarray, typically a study of gene expression.

Compound ID (KEGG).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a chemical compound from the KEGG database.

RFAM name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name (not necessarily stable) an entry (RNA family) from the RFAM database.

Reaction ID (KEGG).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological reaction from the KEGG reactions database.

Drug ID (KEGG).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a drug from the KEGG Drug database.

Ensembl ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl database.

ICD identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a disease from the International Classification of Diseases (ICD) database.

Sequence cluster ID (CluSTr).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a sequence cluster from the CluSTr database.

KEGG Glycan ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a glycan ligand from the KEGG GLYCAN database (a subset of KEGG LIGAND).

TCDB ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a family from the transport classification database (TCDB) of membrane transport proteins.

MINT ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the MINT database of protein-protein interactions.

DIP ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the DIP database of protein-protein interactions.

Signaling Gateway protein ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a protein listed in the UCSD-Nature Signaling Gateway Molecule Pages database.

Protein modification ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein modification catalogued in a database.

RESID ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein modification catalogued in the RESID database.

RGD ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the RGD database.

TAIR accession (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein sequence from the TAIR database.

Compound ID (HMDB).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a small molecule metabolite from the Human Metabolome Database (HMDB).

LIPID MAPS ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the LIPID MAPS database.

PeptideAtlas ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a peptide from the PeptideAtlas peptide databases.

Molecular interaction ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a report of molecular interactions from a database (typically).

BioGRID interaction ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of an interaction from the BioGRID database.

Enzyme ID (MEROPS).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a peptidase enzyme from the MEROPS database.

Mobile genetic element ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a mobile genetic element.

ACLAME ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a mobile genetic element from the Aclame database.

SGD ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the Saccharomyces genome database (SGD).

ISBN.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The International Standard Book Number (ISBN) is for identifying printed books.

Compound ID (3DMET).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a metabolite from the 3DMET database.

MatrixDB interaction ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of an interaction from the MatrixDB database.

cPath ID.rdfs:comment: These identifiers are unique within the cPath database, however, they are not stable between releases.
cPath ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier for pathways, reactions, complexes and small molecules from the cPath (Pathway Commons) database.

PubChem bioassay ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an assay from the PubChem database.

PubChem ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the PubChem database.

Reaction ID (MACie).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an enzyme reaction mechanism from the MACie database.

Gene ID (miRBase).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier for a gene from the miRBase database.

Gene ID (ZFIN).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier for a gene from the Zebrafish information network genome (ZFIN) database.

Reaction ID (Rhea).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an enzyme-catalysed reaction from the Rhea database.

Pathway ID (Unipathway).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological pathway from the Unipathway database.

Compound ID (ChEMBL).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a small molecular from the ChEMBL database.

LGICdb identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the Ligand-gated ion channel (LGICdb) database.

Reaction kinetics ID (SABIO-RK).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological reaction (kinetics entry) from the SABIO-RK reactions database.

PharmGKB ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the pharmacogenetics and pharmacogenomics knowledge base (PharmGKB).

Pathway ID (PharmGKB).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the pharmacogenetics and pharmacogenomics knowledge base (PharmGKB).

Disease ID (PharmGKB).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a disease from the pharmacogenetics and pharmacogenomics knowledge base (PharmGKB).

Drug ID (PharmGKB).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a drug from the pharmacogenetics and pharmacogenomics knowledge base (PharmGKB).

Drug ID (TTD).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a drug from the Therapeutic Target Database (TTD).

Target ID (TTD).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a target protein from the Therapeutic Target Database (TTD).

Cell type identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a type or group of cells.

NeuronDB ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a neuron from the NeuronDB database.

Enzyme ID (CAZy).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an enzyme from the CAZy enzymes database.

dbProbe ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an oligonucleotide probe from the dbProbe database.

DiProDB ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an dinucleotide property from the DiProDB database.

Protein features report (disordered stru.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning disordered structure in a protein.

Embryo report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotation on an embryo or concerning embryological development.

Ensembl transcript ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a gene transcript from the Ensembl database.

Inhibitor annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on one or more small molecules that are enzyme inhibitors.

Promoter ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a promoter of a gene that is catalogued in a database.

COGEME unisequence ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a unisequence from the COGEME database.

Protein family ID (GeneFarm).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry (family) from the TIGRFam database.

Family name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a family of organism.

Genus name (virus).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a genus of viruses.

Family name (virus).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a family of viruses.

Database name (SwissRegulon).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a SwissRegulon database.

Sequence feature ID (SwissRegulon).rdfs:comment: This can be name of a gene, the ID of a TFBS, or genomic coordinates in form "chr:start..end".

FIG ID.rdfs:comment: A FIG ID consists of four parts: a prefix, genome id, locus type and id number.

Gene ID (Xenbase).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of gene in the Xenbase database.

Gene ID (Genolist).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of gene in the Genolist database.

Gene name (Genolist).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of an entry (gene) from the Genolist genes database.

ABS ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (promoter) from the ABS database.

AraC-XylS ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a transcription factor from the AraC-XylS database.

Gene name (HUGO).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of an entry (gene) from the HUGO database.

Locus ID (PseudoCAP).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a locus from the PseudoCAP database.

Locus ID (UTR).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a locus from the UTR database.

MonosaccharideDB ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a monosaccharide from the MonosaccharideDB database.

Database name (CMD).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a subdivision of the Collagen Mutation Database (CMD) database.

Database name (Osteogenesis).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a subdivision of the Osteogenesis database.

Genome identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a particular genome.

GenomeReviews ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a particular genome.

GlycoMap ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the GlycosciencesDB database.

Carbohydrate conformational map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A conformational energy map of the glycosidic linkages in a carbohydrate molecule.

Gene features report (intron).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning introns in a nucleotide sequences.

Transcription factor name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a transcription factor.

TCID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a membrane transport proteins from the transport classification database (TCDB).

Pfam domain name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of a domain from the Pfam database.

Pfam clan ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of a Pfam clan.

Gene ID (VectorBase).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier for a gene from the VectorBase database.

UTRSite ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the UTRSite database of regulatory motifs in eukaryotic UTRs.

Sequence signature report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific or conserved pattern in a molecular sequence, such as its context in genes or proteins, its role, origin or method of construction, etc.

Locus annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a particular locus.

Protein name (UniProt).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Official name of a protein as used in the UniProt database.

Term ID list.rdfs:comment: The concepts are typically provided as a persistent identifier or some other link the source ontologies. Evidence of the validity of the annotation might be included.
Term ID list.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: One or more terms from one or more controlled vocabularies which are annotations on an entity.

HAMAP ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of a protein family from the HAMAP database.

Identifier with metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Basic information concerning an identifier of data (typically including the identifier itself).  For example, a gene symbol with information concerning its provenance.

HIT ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an RNA transcript from the H-InvDB database.

HIX ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of gene cluster in the H-InvDB database.

HPA antibody id.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a antibody from the HPA database.

IMGT/HLA ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a human major histocompatibility complex (HLA) or other protein from the IMGT/HLA database.

Gene ID (JCVI).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of gene assigned by the J. Craig Venter Institute (JCVI).

Kinase name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a kinase protein.

ConsensusPathDB entity ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a physical entity from the ConsensusPathDB database.

ConsensusPathDB entity name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of a physical entity from the ConsensusPathDB database.

CCAP strain number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The number of a strain of algae and protozoa from the CCAP database.

Stock number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of stock from a catalogue of biological resources.

Stock number (TAIR).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A stock number from The Arabidopsis information resource (TAIR).

REDIdb ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the RNA editing database (REDIdb).

SMART domain name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of a domain from the SMART database.

Protein family ID (PANTHER).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry (family) from the PANTHER database.

RNAVirusDB ID.rdfs:comment: Could list (or reference) other taxa here from https://www.phenoscape.org/wiki/Taxonomic_Rank_Vocabulary.
RNAVirusDB ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier for a virus from the RNAVirusDB database.

Virus ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An accession of annotation on a (group of) viruses (catalogued in a database).

NCBI Genome Project ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a genome project assigned by NCBI.

NCBI genome accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a whole genome assigned by the NCBI.

Sequence profile data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Sequence profile data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning models representing a (typically multiple) sequence alignment.

Protein ID (TopDB).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a membrane protein from the TopDB database.

Reference map name (SWISS-2DPAGE).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name of a reference map gel from the SWISS-2DPAGE database.

Protein ID (PeroxiBase).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a peroxidase protein from the PeroxiBase database.

SISYPHUS ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the SISYPHUS database of tertiary structure alignments.

ORF ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of an open reading frame (catalogued in a database).

ORF identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of an open reading frame.

Linucs ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the GlycosciencesDB database.

Protein ID (LGICdb).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a ligand-gated ion channel protein from the LGICdb database.

MaizeDB ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an EST sequence from the MaizeDB database.

Gene ID (MfunGD).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of gene in the MfunGD database.

Orpha number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a disease from the Orpha database.

Protein ID (EcID).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a protein from the EcID database.

Clone ID (RefSeq).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a cDNA molecule catalogued in the RefSeq database.

Protein ID (ConoServer).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a cone snail toxin protein from the ConoServer database.

GeneSNP ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a GeneSNP database entry.

Web portal.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A web site providing data (web pages) on a common theme to a HTTP client.

Gene ID (VBASE2).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier for a gene from the VBASE2 database.

DPVweb ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique identifier for a virus from the DPVweb database.

Pathway ID (BioSystems).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the BioSystems pathway database.

Abstract.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An abstract of a scientific article.

Lipid structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a lipid structure.

Drug structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for the (3D) structure of a drug.

Toxin structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for the (3D) structure of a toxin.

Position-specific scoring matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A simple matrix of numbers, where each value (or column of values) is derived derived from analysis of the corresponding position in a sequence alignment.

Distance matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A matrix of distances between molecular entities, where a value (distance) is (typically) derived from comparison of two entities and reflects their similarity.

Structural distance matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Distances (values representing similarity) between a group of molecular structures.

Ontology concept.rdfs:comment: This includes any fields from the concept definition such as concept name, definition, comments and so on.
Ontology concept.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A concept from a biological ontology.

Codon usage bias.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A numerical measure of differences in the frequency of occurrence of synonymous codons in DNA sequences.

Nucleic acid features report (VNTR).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning variable number of tandem repeat (VNTR) polymorphism in a DNA sequence.

Nucleic acid features report (microsatel.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning microsatellite polymorphism in a DNA sequence.

Nucleic acid features report (RFLP).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning restriction fragment length polymorphisms (RFLP) in a DNA sequence.

Radiation hybrid map.rdfs:comment: The radiation method can break very closely linked markers providing a more detailed map.  Most genetic markers and subsequences may be located to a defined map position and with a more precise estimates of distance than a linkage map.
Radiation hybrid map.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A map showing distance between genetic markers estimated by radiation-induced breaks in a chromosome.

ID list.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A simple list of data identifiers (such as database accessions), possibly with additional basic information on the addressed data.

Phylogenetic gene frequencies data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Gene frequencies data that may be read during phylogenetic tree calculation.

Sequence set (polymorphic).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A set of sub-sequences displaying some type of polymorphism, typically indicating the sequence in which they occur, their position and other metadata.

DRCAT resource.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An entry (resource) from the DRCAT bioinformatics resource catalogue.

Protein complex.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a multi-protein complex; two or more polypeptides chains in a stable, functional association with one another.

Protein structural motif.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein (3D) structural motif; any group of contiguous or non-contiguous amino acid residues but typically those forming a feature with a structural or functional role.

Lipid report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotation on or information derived from one or more specific lipid 3D structure(s).

Secondary structure image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Image of one or more molecular secondary structures.

Secondary structure report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on general information, properties or features of one or more molecular secondary structures.

DNA features.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: DNA sequence-specific feature annotation (not in a feature table).

RNA features report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Features concerning RNA or regions of DNA that encode an RNA molecule.

Plot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Biological data that has been plotted as a graph of some type.

Protein sequence record.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein sequence and associated metadata.

Nucleic acid sequence record.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A nucleic acid sequence and associated metadata.

Protein sequence record (full).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A protein sequence and comprehensive metadata (such as a feature table), typically corresponding to a full entry from a molecular sequence database.

Nucleic acid sequence record (full).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A nucleic acid sequence and comprehensive metadata (such as a feature table), typically corresponding to a full entry from a molecular sequence database.

Biological model accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of a mathematical model, typically an entry from a database.

Cell type name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a type or group of cells.

Cell type accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of a type or group of cells (catalogued in a database).

Compound accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of an entry from a database of chemicals.

Toxin accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of a toxin (catalogued in a database).

Monosaccharide accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of a monosaccharide (catalogued in a database).

Carbohydrate accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of an entry from a database of carbohydrates.

Molecule accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of a specific molecule (catalogued in a database).

Data resource definition accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of a data definition (catalogued in a database).

Genome accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An accession of a particular genome (in a database).

Map accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An accession of a map of a molecular sequence (deposited in a database).

Lipid accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of an entry from a database of lipids.

Peptide ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of a peptide deposited in a database.

Protein accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of a protein deposited in a database.

Organism accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An accession of annotation on a (group of) organisms (catalogued in a database).

Organism name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of an organism (or group of organisms).

Protein family accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of a protein family (that is deposited in a database).

Transcription factor accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession of an entry from a database of transcription factors or binding sites.

Strain accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a strain of an organism variant, typically a plant, virus or bacterium.

Virus identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An accession of annotation on a (group of) viruses (catalogued in a database).

Gramene identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a Gramene database entry.

DDBJ accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of an entry from the DDBJ sequence database.

ConsensusPathDB identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of an entity from the ConsensusPathDB database.

Sequence data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Sequence data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning, extracted from, or derived from the analysis of molecular sequence(s).

Codon usage.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

Article report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data derived from the analysis of a scientific text such as a full text article from a scientific journal.

Sequence report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report of information about molecular sequence(s), including basic information (metadata), and reports generated from molecular sequence analysis, including positional features and non-positional properties.

Protein secondary structure report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report about the properties or features of one or more protein secondary structures.

Hopp and Woods plot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A Hopp and Woods plot of predicted antigenicity of a peptide or protein.

Nucleic acid melting curve.rdfs:comment: Shows the proportion of nucleic acid which are double-stranded versus temperature.
Nucleic acid melting curve.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A melting curve of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA).

Nucleic acid probability profile.rdfs:comment: Shows the probability of a base pair not being melted (i.e. remaining as double-stranded DNA) at a specified temperature
Nucleic acid probability profile.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A probability profile of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA).

Nucleic acid temperature profile.rdfs:comment: Plots melting temperature versus base position.
Nucleic acid temperature profile.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A temperature profile of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA).

Gene regulatory network report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report typically including a map (diagram) of a gene regulatory network.

2D PAGE gel report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a two-dimensional (2D PAGE) gel.

Oligonucleotide probe sets annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: General annotation on a set of oligonucleotide probes, such as the gene name with which the probe set is associated and which probes belong to the set.

Microarray image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An image from a microarray experiment which (typically) allows a visualisation of probe hybridisation and gene-expression data.

Image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Biological or biomedical data that may be rendered, for example displayed on screen or plotted on a graph of some type.

Sequence image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Image of a molecular sequence, possibly with sequence features or properties shown.

Protein hydropathy data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on protein properties concerning hydropathy.

Secondary structure data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning molecular secondary structure data.

Protein sequence (raw).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A raw protein sequence (string of characters).

Protein sequence.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: One or more protein sequences, possibly with associated annotation.

Nucleic acid sequence.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: One or more nucleic acid sequences, possibly with associated annotation.

Reaction data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Reaction data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning a biochemical reaction, typically data and more general annotation on the kinetics of enzyme-catalysed reaction.

Protein classification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning primarily the classification of proteins (from sequence or structural data) into clusters, groups, families etc.

Sequence motif data.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
Sequence motif data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning specific or conserved pattern in molecular sequences.

Pathway or network data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning a specific biological pathway or network.

Pathway or network report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report concerning or derived from the analysis of a biological pathway or network, such as a map (diagram) or annotation.

Nucleic acid thermodynamic data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A thermodynamic or kinetic property of a nucleic acid molecule.

Nucleic acid classification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning classification of nucleic acid sequences and structures.

Classification report.rdfs:comment: This can include an entire classification, components such as classifiers, assignments of entities to a classification and so on.
Classification report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on a classification of molecular sequences, structures or other entities.

Protein features report (key folding sit.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning key residues involved in protein folding.

Protein torsion angle data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Torsion angle data for a protein structure.

Phylogenetic character weights.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Weights for sequence positions or characters in phylogenetic analysis where zero is defined as unweighted.

Annotation track.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotation of one particular positional feature on a biomolecular (typically genome) sequence, suitable for import and display in a genome browser.

UniProt accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Accession number of a UniProt (protein sequence) database entry.

NCBI genetic code ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a genetic code in the NCBI list of genetic codes.

Ontology concept identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a concept in an ontology of biological or bioinformatics concepts and relations.

GO concept name (biological process).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a concept for a biological process from the GO ontology.

GO concept name (molecular function).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The name of a concept for a molecular function from the GO ontology.

Taxonomy.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning organism classification, identification and naming.

Protein ID (EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ).rdfs:comment: This qualifier consists of a stable ID portion (3+5 format with 3 position letters and 5 numbers) plus a version number after the decimal point. When the protein sequence encoded by the CDS changes, only the version number of the /protein_id value is incremented; the stable part of the /protein_id remains unchanged and as a result will permanently be associated with a given protein; this qualifier is valid only on CDS features which translate into a valid protein.
Protein ID (EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: EMBL/GENBANK/DDBJ coding feature protein identifier, issued by International collaborators.

Core data.rdfs:comment: Core data entities typically have a format and may be identified by an accession number.
Core data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A type of data that (typically) corresponds to entries from the primary biological databases and which is (typically) the primary input or output of a tool, i.e. the data the tool processes or generates, as distinct from metadata and identifiers which describe and identify such core data, parameters that control the behaviour of tools, reports of derivative data generated by tools and annotation.

Sequence feature identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of molecular sequence feature(s).

Structure identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a molecular tertiary structure, typically an entry from a structure database.

Matrix identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of an array of numerical values, such as a comparison matrix.

Protein sequence composition.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report (typically a table) on character or word composition / frequency of protein sequence(s).

Nucleic acid sequence composition (repor.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report (typically a table) on character or word composition / frequency of nucleic acid sequence(s).

Protein domain classification node.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A node from a classification of protein structural domain(s).

CAS number.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique numerical identifier of chemicals in the scientific literature, as assigned by the Chemical Abstracts Service.

ATC code.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a drug conforming to the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) Classification System, a drug classification system controlled by the WHO Collaborating Centre for Drug Statistics Methodology (WHOCC).

UNII.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A unique, unambiguous, alphanumeric identifier of a chemical substance as catalogued by the Substance Registration System of the Food and Drug Administration (FDA).

Geotemporal metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Basic information concerning geographical location or time.

System metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Metadata concerning the software, hardware or other aspects of a computer system.

Sequence feature name.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A name of a sequence feature, e.g. the name of a feature to be displayed to an end-user.

Experimental measurement.rdfs:comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types. It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
Experimental measurement.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Raw data such as measurements or other results from laboratory experiments, as generated from laboratory hardware.

Raw microarray data.rdfs:comment: Such data as found in Affymetrix CEL or GPR files.
Raw microarray data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Raw data (typically MIAME-compliant) for hybridisations from a microarray experiment.

Processed microarray data.rdfs:comment: Such data as found in Affymetrix .CHP files or data from other software such as RMA or dChip.
Processed microarray data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data generated from processing and analysis of probe set data from a microarray experiment.

Gene expression matrix.rdfs:comment: This combines data from all hybridisations.
Gene expression matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The final processed (normalised) data for a set of hybridisations in a microarray experiment.

Sample annotation.rdfs:comment: This might include compound and dose in a dose response experiment.
Sample annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotation on a biological sample, for example experimental factors and their values.

Microarray metadata.rdfs:comment: This might include gene identifiers, genomic coordinates, probe oligonucleotide sequences etc.
Microarray metadata.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotation on the array itself used in a microarray experiment.

Microarray protocol annotation.rdfs:comment: This might describe e.g. the normalisation methods used to process the raw data.
Microarray protocol annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotation on laboratory and/or data processing protocols used in an microarray experiment.

Microarray hybridisation data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning the hybridisations measured during a microarray experiment.

Protein features report (topological dom.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning topological domains such as cytoplasmic regions in a protein.

Sequence features (compositionally-biase.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report of regions in a molecular sequence that are biased to certain characters.

Nucleic acid features (difference and ch.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on features in a nucleic acid sequence that indicate changes to or differences between sequences.

Nucleic acid features report (expression.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning regions within a nucleic acid sequence containing a signal that alters a biological function.

Nucleic acid features report (binding).rdfs:comment: This includes ribosome binding sites (Shine-Dalgarno sequence in prokaryotes).
Nucleic acid features report (binding).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning nucleic acids binding to some other molecule.

Nucleic acid repeats (report).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning repetitive elements within a nucleic acid sequence.

Nucleic acid features report (replicatio.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning DNA replication or recombination.

Nucleic acid structure report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on regions within a nucleic acid sequence which form secondary or tertiary (3D) structures.

Protein features report (repeats).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning short repetitive subsequences (repeat sequences) in a protein sequence.

Sequence motif matches (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report on the location of matches to profiles, motifs (conserved or functional patterns) or other signatures in one or more protein sequences.

Sequence motif matches (nucleic acid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report on the location of matches to profiles, motifs (conserved or functional patterns) or other signatures in one or more nucleic acid sequences.

Nucleic acid features (d-loop).rdfs:comment: A displacement loop is a region of mitochondrial DNA in which one of the strands is displaced by an RNA molecule.
Nucleic acid features (d-loop).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on displacement loops in a mitochondrial DNA sequence.

Nucleic acid features (stem loop).rdfs:comment: A stem loop is a hairpin structure; a double-helical structure formed when two complementary regions of a single strand of RNA or DNA molecule form base-pairs.
Nucleic acid features (stem loop).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on stem loops in a DNA sequence.

Gene transcript report.rdfs:comment: This includes 5'untranslated region (5'UTR), coding sequences (CDS), exons, intervening sequences (intron) and 3'untranslated regions (3'UTR).
Gene transcript report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on features of a messenger RNA (mRNA) molecules including precursor RNA, primary (unprocessed) transcript and fully processed molecules. This includes reports on a specific gene transcript, clone or EST.

Nucleic acid features report (signal or.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning coding sequences for a signal or transit peptide.

Non-coding RNA.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning features of non-coding or functional RNA molecules, including tRNA and rRNA.

Transcriptional features (report).rdfs:comment: This includes promoters, CAAT signals, TATA signals, -35 signals, -10 signals, GC signals, primer binding sites for initiation of transcription or reverse transcription, enhancer, attenuator, terminators and ribosome binding sites.
Transcriptional features (report).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Features concerning transcription of DNA into RNA including the regulation of transcription.

Nucleic acid features report (STS).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning sequence tagged sites (STS) in nucleic acid sequences.

Nucleic acid features (immunoglobulin ge.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report on predicted or actual immunoglobulin gene structure including constant, switch and variable regions and diversity, joining and variable segments.

SCOP class.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a 'class' node from the SCOP database.

SCOP fold.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a 'fold' node from the SCOP database.

SCOP superfamily.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a 'superfamily' node from the SCOP database.

SCOP family.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a 'family' node from the SCOP database.

SCOP protein.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a 'protein' node from the SCOP database.

SCOP species.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Information on a 'species' node from the SCOP database.

Gene family report.rdfs:comment: This includes reports on on gene homologues between species.
Gene family report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on a particular family of genes, typically a set of genes with similar sequence that originate from duplication of a common ancestor gene, or any other classification of nucleic acid sequences or structures that reflects gene structure.

Protein alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An alignment of protein sequences and/or structures.

NGS experiment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning sequencing experiment, including samples, sampling, preparation, sequencing, and analysis.

Sequence assembly report.rdfs:comment: This might include an overall quality assement of the assembly and summary statistics including counts, average length and number of bases for reads, matches and non-matches, contigs, reads in pairs etc.
Sequence assembly report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report about a DNA sequence assembly.

Genome index.rdfs:comment: Many sequence alignment tasks involving many or very large sequences rely on a precomputed index of the sequence to accelerate the alignment.
Genome index.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An index of a genome sequence.

GWAS report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report concerning genome-wide association study experiments.

Cytoband position.rdfs:comment: Information might include start and end position in a chromosome sequence, chromosome identifier, name of band and so on.
Cytoband position.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The position of a cytogenetic band in a genome.

Kinetic model.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Mathematical model of a network, that contains biochemical kinetics.

COSMIC ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a COSMIC database entry.

HGMD ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of a HGMD database entry.

Sequence feature type.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing a type of sequence feature such as gene, transcript, cds, exon, repeat, simple, misc, variation, somatic variation, structural variation, somatic structural variation, constrained or regulatory.

Gene homology (report).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report on gene homologues between species.

Ensembl gene tree ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a gene tree from the Ensembl database.

Gene tree.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A phylogenetic tree that is an estimate of the character's phylogeny.

Species tree.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A phylogenetic tree that reflects phylogeny of the taxa from which the characters (used in calculating the tree) were sampled.

Sample ID.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of an entry from a biosample database.

MGI accession.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identifier of an object from the MGI database.

Transition matrix.rdfs:comment: Consider for example an HMM with two states (AT-rich and GC-rich).  The transition matrix will hold the probabilities of switching from the AT-rich to the GC-rich state, and vica versa.
Transition matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A HMM transition matrix contains the probabilities of switching from one HMM state to another.

Emission matrix.rdfs:comment: Consider for example an HMM with two states (AT-rich and GC-rich).  The emission matrix holds the probabilities of choosing each of the four nucleotides (A, C, G and T) in the AT-rich state and in the GC-rich state.
Emission matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A HMM emission matrix holds the probabilities of choosing the four nucleotides (A, C, G and T) in each of the states of a HMM.

Format identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An identifier of a data format.

Raw image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Raw biological or biomedical image generated by some experimental technique.

Carbohydrate property.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data concerning the intrinsic physical (e.g. structural) or chemical properties of one, more or all carbohydrates.

Simulation experiment report.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning biological computational model experiments (simulation), for example the minimum information required in order to permit its correct interpretation and reproduction.

MRI image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An imaging technique that uses magnetic fields and radiowaves to form images, typically to investigate the anatomy and physiology of the human body.

Cell migration track image.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An image from a cell migration track assay.

Rate of association.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Rate of association of a protein with another protein or some other molecule.

Gene order.rdfs:comment: Such data are often used for genome rearrangement tools and phylogenetic tree labeling.
Gene order.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Multiple gene identifiers in a specific order.

Spectrum.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The spectrum of frequencies of electromagnetic radiation emitted from a molecule as a result of some spectroscopy experiment.

NMR spectrum.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Spectral information for a molecule from a nuclear magnetic resonance experiment.

Chemical structure sketch.rdfs:comment: Chemical structure sketches are used for presentational purposes but also as inputs to various analysis software.
Chemical structure sketch.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A sketch of a small molecule made with some specialised drawing package.

Nucleic acid signature.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific or conserved nucleic acid sequence pattern.

Sequence variations.rdfs:comment: Variations are stored along with a reference genome.
Sequence variations.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data on gene sequence variations resulting large-scale genotyping and DNA sequencing projects.

Bibliography.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A list of publications such as scientic papers or books.

Ontology mapping.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A mapping of supplied textual terms or phrases to ontology concepts (URIs).

SMILES.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Chemical structure specified in Simplified Molecular Input Line Entry System (SMILES) line notation.

InChI.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Chemical structure specified in IUPAC International Chemical Identifier (InChI) line notation.

mf.rdfs:comment: The general MF query format consists of a series of valid atomic symbols, with an optional number or range.
mf.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Chemical structure specified by Molecular Formula (MF), including a count of each element in a compound.

inchikey.rdfs:comment: An InChI identifier is not human-readable but is more suitable for web searches than an InChI chemical structure specification.
inchikey.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The InChIKey (hashed InChI) is a fixed length (25 character) condensed digital representation of an InChI chemical structure specification. It uniquely identifies a chemical compound.

smarts.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: SMILES ARbitrary Target Specification (SMARTS) format for chemical structure specification, which is a subset of the SMILES line notation.

unambiguous pure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.

nucleotide.rdfs:comment: Non-sequence characters may be used for example for gaps.
nucleotide.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.

protein.rdfs:comment: Non-sequence characters may be used for gaps and translation stop.
protein.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for a protein sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.

consensus.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for the consensus of two or more molecular sequences.

pure nucleotide.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.

unambiguous pure nucleotide.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters .

dna.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.

rna.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.

unambiguous pure dna.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.

pure dna.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.

unambiguous pure rna sequence.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.

pure rna.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.

unambiguous pure protein.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.

pure protein.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.

UniGene entry format.rdfs:comment: A UniGene entry includes a set of transcript sequences assigned to the same transcription locus (gene or expressed pseudogene), with information on protein similarities, gene expression, cDNA clone reagents, and genomic location.
UniGene entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an entry from UniGene.

COG sequence cluster format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the COG database of clusters of (related) protein sequences.

EMBL feature location.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format for sequence positions (feature location) as used in DDBJ/EMBL/GenBank database.

quicktandem.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report format for tandem repeats in a nucleotide sequence (format generated by the Sanger Centre quicktandem program).

Sanger inverted repeats.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report format for inverted repeats in a nucleotide sequence (format generated by the Sanger Centre inverted program).

EMBOSS repeat.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report format for tandem repeats in a sequence (an EMBOSS report format).

est2genome format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a report on exon-intron structure generated by EMBOSS est2genome.

restrict format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by EMBOSS restrict program.

restover format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by EMBOSS restover program.

REBASE restriction sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by REBASE database.

FASTA search results format.rdfs:comment: This includes (typically) score data, alignment data and a histogram (of observed and expected distribution of E values.)
FASTA search results format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using FASTA.

BLAST results.rdfs:comment: This includes score data, alignment data and summary table.
BLAST results.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of BLAST.

mspcrunch.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of MSPCrunch.

Smith-Waterman format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of Smith Waterman.

dhf.rdfs:comment: The hits are relatives to a SCOP or CATH family and are found from a search of a sequence database.
dhf.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of EMBASSY domain hits file (DHF) of hits (sequences) with domain classification information.

lhf.rdfs:comment: The hits are putative ligand-binding sequences and are found from a search of a sequence database.
lhf.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of EMBASSY ligand hits file (LHF) of database hits (sequences) with ligand classification information.

InterPro hits format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Results format for searches of the InterPro database.

InterPro protein view report format.rdfs:comment: The report includes a classification of regions in a query protein sequence which are assigned to a known InterPro protein family or group.
InterPro protein view report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of results of a search of the InterPro database showing matches of query protein sequence(s) to InterPro entries.

InterPro match table format.rdfs:comment: The table presents matches between query proteins (rows) and signature methods (columns) for this entry. Alternatively the sequence(s) might be from from the InterPro entry itself. The match position in the protein sequence and match status (true positive, false positive etc) are indicated.
InterPro match table format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of results of a search of the InterPro database showing matches between protein sequence(s) and signatures for an InterPro entry.

HMMER emission and transition.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a report from the HMMER package on the emission and transition counts of a hidden Markov model.

prosite-pattern.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a regular expression pattern from the Prosite database.

EMBOSS sequence pattern.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an EMBOSS sequence pattern.

meme-motif.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A motif in the format generated by the MEME program.

prosite-profile.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Sequence profile (sequence classifier) format used in the PROSITE database.

JASPAR format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A profile (sequence classifier) in the format used in the JASPAR database.

MEME background Markov model.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of the model of random sequences used by MEME.

HMMER format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a hidden Markov model representation used by the HMMER package.

HMMER-aln.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: FASTA-style format for multiple sequences aligned by HMMER package to an HMM.

DIALIGN format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of multiple sequences aligned by DIALIGN package.

daf.rdfs:comment: The format is clustal-like and includes annotation of domain family classification information.
daf.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: EMBASSY 'domain alignment file' (DAF) format, containing a sequence alignment of protein domains belonging to the same SCOP or CATH family.

Sequence-MEME profile alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format for alignment of molecular sequences to MEME profiles (position-dependent scoring matrices) as generated by the MAST tool from the MEME package.

HMMER profile alignment (sequences versu.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format used by the HMMER package for an alignment of a sequence against a hidden Markov model database.

HMMER profile alignment (HMM versus sequ.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format used by the HMMER package for of an alignment of a hidden Markov model against a sequence database.

Phylip distance matrix.rdfs:comment: Data Type must include the distance matrix, probably as pairs of sequence identifiers with a distance (integer or float).
Phylip distance matrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of PHYLIP phylogenetic distance matrix data.

ClustalW dendrogram.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Dendrogram (tree file) format generated by ClustalW.

Phylip tree raw.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Raw data file format used by Phylip from which a phylogenetic tree is directly generated or plotted.

Phylip continuous quantitative character.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: PHYLIP file format for continuous quantitative character data.

Phylip character frequencies format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: PHYLIP file format for phylogenetics character frequency data.

Phylip discrete states format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of PHYLIP discrete states data.

Phylip tree format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Phylogenetic tree data format used by the PHYLIP program.

TreeBASE format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the TreeBASE database of phylogenetic data.

TreeFam format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the TreeFam database of phylogenetic data.

Phylip tree distance format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format for distances, such as Branch Score distance, between two or more phylogenetic trees as used by the Phylip package.

dssp.rdfs:comment: The DSSP database is built using the DSSP application which defines secondary structure, geometrical features and solvent exposure of proteins, given atomic coordinates in PDB format.
dssp.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the DSSP database (Dictionary of Secondary Structure in Proteins).

hssp.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of the HSSP database (Homology-derived Secondary Structure in Proteins).

Dot-bracket format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of RNA secondary structure in dot-bracket notation, originally generated by the Vienna RNA package/server.

Vienna local RNA secondary structure for.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of local RNA secondary structure components with free energy values, generated by the Vienna RNA package/server.

PDB database entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an entry (or part of an entry) from the PDB database.

PDB.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of PDB database in PDB format.

mmCIF.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of PDB database in mmCIF format.

PDBML.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of PDB database in PDBML (XML) format.

Domainatrix 3D-1D scoring matrix format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a matrix of 3D-1D scores used by the EMBOSS Domainatrix applications.

aaindex.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Amino acid index format used by the AAindex database.

IntEnz enzyme report format.rdfs:comment: IntEnz is the master copy of the Enzyme Nomenclature, the recommendations of the NC-IUBMB on the Nomenclature and Classification of Enzyme-Catalysed Reactions.
IntEnz enzyme report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an entry from IntEnz (The Integrated Relational Enzyme Database).

BRENDA enzyme report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the BRENDA enzyme database.

KEGG REACTION enzyme report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the KEGG REACTION database of biochemical reactions.

KEGG ENZYME enzyme report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the KEGG ENZYME database.

REBASE proto enzyme report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the proto section of the REBASE enzyme database.

REBASE withrefm enzyme report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the withrefm section of the REBASE enzyme database.

Pcons report format.rdfs:comment: Pcons ranks protein models by assessing their quality based on the occurrence of recurring common three-dimensional structural patterns. Pcons returns a score reflecting the overall global quality and a score for each individual residue in the protein reflecting the local residue quality.
Pcons report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of output of the Pcons Model Quality Assessment Program (MQAP).

ProQ report format.rdfs:comment: ProQ is a neural network-based predictor that predicts the quality of a protein model based on the number of structural features.
ProQ report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of output of the ProQ protein model quality predictor.

SMART domain assignment report format.rdfs:comment: The SMART output file includes data on genetically mobile domains / analysis of domain architectures, including phyletic distributions, functional class, tertiary structures and functionally important residues.
SMART domain assignment report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of SMART domain assignment data.

BIND entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the BIND database of protein interaction.

IntAct entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the IntAct database of protein interaction.

InterPro entry format.rdfs:comment: This includes signature metadata, sequence references and a reference to the signature itself. There is normally a header (entry accession numbers and name), abstract, taxonomy information, example proteins etc. Each entry also includes a match list which give a number of different views of the signature matches for the sequences in each InterPro entry.
InterPro entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the InterPro database of protein signatures (sequence classifiers) and classified sequences.

InterPro entry abstract format.rdfs:comment: References are included and a functional inference is made where possible.
InterPro entry abstract format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the textual abstract of signatures in an InterPro entry and its protein matches.

Gene3D entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the Gene3D protein secondary database.

PIRSF entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the PIRSF protein secondary database.

PRINTS entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the PRINTS protein secondary database.

Panther Families and HMMs entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the Panther library of protein families and subfamilies.

Pfam entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the Pfam protein secondary database.

SMART entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the SMART protein secondary database.

Superfamily entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the Superfamily protein secondary database.

TIGRFam entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the TIGRFam protein secondary database.

ProDom entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the ProDom protein domain classification database.

FSSP entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the FSSP database.

findkm.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A report format for the kinetics of enzyme-catalysed reaction(s) in a format generated by EMBOSS findkm. This includes Michaelis Menten plot, Hanes Woolf plot, Michaelis Menten constant (Km) and maximum velocity (Vmax).

Ensembl gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of Ensembl genome database.

DictyBase gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of DictyBase genome database.

CGD gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of Candida Genome database.

DragonDB gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of DragonDB genome database.

EcoCyc gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of EcoCyc genome database.

FlyBase gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of FlyBase genome database.

Gramene gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of Gramene genome database.

KEGG GENES gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of KEGG GENES genome database.

MaizeGDB gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of the Maize genetics and genomics database (MaizeGDB).

MGD gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of the Mouse Genome Database (MGD).

RGD gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of the Rat Genome Database (RGD).

SGD gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of the Saccharomyces Genome Database (SGD).

GeneDB gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of the Sanger GeneDB genome database.

TAIR gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of The Arabidopsis Information Resource (TAIR) genome database.

WormBase gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of the WormBase genomes database.

ZFIN gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of the Zebrafish Information Network (ZFIN) genome database.

TIGR gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format of the TIGR genome database.

dbSNP polymorphism report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the dbSNP database.

OMIM entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the OMIM database of genotypes and phenotypes.

HGVbase entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a record from the HGVbase database of genotypes and phenotypes.

HIVDB entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a record from the HIVDB database of genotypes and phenotypes.

KEGG DISEASE entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the KEGG DISEASE database.

Primer3 primer.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report format on PCR primers and hybridization oligos as generated by Whitehead primer3 program.

ABI.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A format of raw sequence read data from an Applied Biosystems sequencing machine.

mira.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of MIRA sequence trace information file.

CAF.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Common Assembly Format (CAF). A sequence assembly format including contigs, base-call qualities, and other metadata.

exp.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Sequence assembly project file EXP format.

SCF.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Staden Chromatogram Files format (SCF) of base-called sequence reads, qualities, and other metadata.

PHD.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: PHD sequence trace format to store serialised chromatogram data (reads).

dat.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of Affymetrix data file of raw image data.

cel.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of Affymetrix data file of information about (raw) expression levels of the individual probes.

affymetrix.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of affymetrix gene cluster files (hc-genes.txt, hc-chips.txt) from hierarchical clustering.

ArrayExpress entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry format for the ArrayExpress microarrays database.

affymetrix-exp.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Affymetrix data file format for information about experimental conditions and protocols.

CHP.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of Affymetrix data file of information about (normalised) expression levels of the individual probes.

EMDB entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the Electron Microscopy DataBase (EMDB).

KEGG PATHWAY entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the KEGG PATHWAY database of pathway maps for molecular interactions and reaction networks.

MetaCyc entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the MetaCyc metabolic pathways database.

HumanCyc entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of a report from the HumanCyc metabolic pathways database.

INOH entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the INOH signal transduction pathways database.

PATIKA entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the PATIKA biological pathways database.

Reactome entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the reactome biological pathways database.

aMAZE entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the aMAZE biological pathways and molecular interactions database.

CPDB entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the CPDB database.

Panther Pathways entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the Panther Pathways database.

BioModel mathematical model format.rdfs:comment: Models are annotated and linked to relevant data resources, such as publications, databases of compounds and pathways, controlled vocabularies, etc.
BioModel mathematical model format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of mathematical models from the BioModel database.

KEGG LIGAND entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the KEGG LIGAND chemical database.

KEGG COMPOUND entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the KEGG COMPOUND database.

KEGG PLANT entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the KEGG PLANT database.

KEGG GLYCAN entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the KEGG GLYCAN database.

PubChem entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from PubChem.

ChemSpider entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from a database of chemical structures and property predictions.

ChEBI entry format.rdfs:comment: ChEBI includes an ontological classification defining relations between entities or classes of entities.
ChEBI entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from Chemical Entities of Biological Interest (ChEBI).

MSDchem ligand dictionary entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the MSDchem ligand dictionary.

HET group dictionary entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the HET group dictionary (HET groups from PDB files).

KEGG DRUG entry format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the KEGG DRUG database.

PubMed citation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of bibliographic reference as used by the PubMed database.

Medline Display Format.rdfs:comment: Bibliographic reference information including citation information is included
Medline Display Format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format for abstracts of scientific articles from the Medline database.

CiteXplore-core.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: CiteXplore 'core' citation format including title, journal, authors and abstract.

CiteXplore-all.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: CiteXplore 'all' citation format includes all known details such as Mesh terms and cross-references.

pmc.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Article format of the PubMed Central database.

Oscar3.rdfs:comment: Oscar 3 performs chemistry-specific parsing of chemical documents. It attempts to identify chemical names, ontology concepts and chemical data from a document.
Oscar3.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Text mining abstract format from the Oscar 3 application.

PDB atom record format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of an ATOM record (describing data for an individual atom) from a PDB file.

CATH chain report format.rdfs:comment: The report (for example http://www.cathdb.info/chain/1cukA) includes chain identifiers, domain identifiers and CATH codes for domains in a given protein chain.
CATH chain report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of CATH domain classification information for a polypeptide chain.

CATH PDB report format.rdfs:comment: The report (for example http://www.cathdb.info/pdb/1cuk) includes chain identifiers, domain identifiers and CATH codes for domains in a given PDB file.
CATH PDB report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of CATH domain classification information for a protein PDB file.

NCBI gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Entry (gene) format of the NCBI database.

GeneIlluminator gene report format.rdfs:comment: This includes a gene name and abbreviation of the name which may be in a name space indicating the gene status and relevant organisation.
GeneIlluminator gene report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Report format for biological functions associated with a gene name and its alternative names (synonyms, homonyms), as generated by the GeneIlluminator service.

BacMap gene card format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a report on the DNA and protein sequences for a given gene label from a bacterial chromosome maps from the BacMap database.

ColiCard report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a report on Escherichia coli genes, proteins and molecules from the CyberCell Database (CCDB).

PlasMapper TextMap.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Map of a plasmid (circular DNA) in PlasMapper TextMap format.

Atomic data format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for an individual atom.

Sequence record format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for a molecular sequence record.

Sequence feature annotation format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for molecular sequence feature information.

Alignment format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for molecular sequence alignment information.

dbid.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Fasta format variant with database name before ID.

FASTQ.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: FASTQ short read format ignoring quality scores.

FASTQ-sanger.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: FASTQ short read format with phred quality.

GCG.rdfs:comment: GCG SSF (single sequence file) file format.

GFF2-seq.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: GFF feature file format with sequence in the header.

GFF3-seq.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: GFF3 feature file format with sequence.

giFASTA format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: FASTA sequence format including NCBI-style GIs.

jackknifer.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Jackknifer interleaved and non-interleaved sequence format.

mega-seq.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Mega interleaved and non-interleaved sequence format.

MSF.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: GCG MSF (multiple sequence file) file format.

Pearson format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Plain old FASTA sequence format (unspecified format for IDs).

raw.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Raw sequence format with no non-sequence characters.

Stockholm format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Stockholm multiple sequence alignment format (used by Pfam and Rfam).

dasdna.rdfs:comment: The use of this format is deprecated.

debug-seq.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: EMBOSS debugging trace sequence format of full internal data content.

NCBI format.rdfs:comment: There are several variants of this.
NCBI format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: NCBI FASTA sequence format with NCBI-style IDs.

GFF2.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: General Feature Format (GFF) of sequence features.

GFF3.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generic Feature Format version 3 (GFF3) of sequence features.

debug-feat.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: EMBOSS debugging trace feature format of full internal data content.

debug.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: EMBOSS alignment format for debugging trace of full internal data content.

match.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment format for start and end of matches between sequence pairs.

meganon.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Mega non-interleaved format for (typically aligned) sequences.

pair.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: EMBOSS simple sequence pair alignment format.

scores format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alignment format for score values for pairs of sequences.

srs format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Simple multiple sequence (alignment) format for SRS.

srspair.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Simple sequence pair (alignment) format for SRS.

Phylogenetic tree format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for a phylogenetic tree.

Biological pathway or network format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for a biological pathway or network.

Sequence-profile alignment format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for a sequence-profile alignment.

Sequence-profile alignment (HMM) format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for a sequence-HMM profile alignment.

Amino acid index format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for an amino acid index.

Article format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for a full-text scientific article.

Text mining report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for an abstract (report) from text mining.

Enzyme kinetics report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for reports on enzyme kinetics.

Small molecule report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a report on a chemical compound.

Gene annotation format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a report on a particular locus, gene, gene system or groups of genes.

Tertiary structure format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for a molecular tertiary structure.

Biological model format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for a biological model.

Chemical formula format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Text format of a chemical formula.

Phylogenetic continuous quantitative cha.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of phylogenetic continuous quantitative character data.

Phylogenetic discrete states format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of phylogenetic discrete states data.

Electron microscopy model format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotation format for electron microscopy models.

Phylogenetic tree report (tree distances.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format for phylogenetic tree distance data.

Protein family report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format for reports on a protein family.

Sequence trace format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format for sequence trace data (i.e. including base call information).

Gene expression report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format for a report on gene expression.

Genotype and phenotype annotation format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a report on genotype / phenotype information.

Map format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a map of (typically one) molecular sequence annotated with features.

Nucleic acid features (primers) format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a report on PCR primers or hybridization oligos in a nucleic acid sequence.

Protein report format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a report of general information about a specific protein.

Protein report (enzyme) format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a report of general information about a specific enzyme.

3D-1D scoring matrix format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a matrix of 3D-1D scores (amino acid environment probabilities).

Protein structure report (quality evalua.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a report on the quality of a protein three-dimensional model.

Database hits (sequence) format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a report on sequence hits and associated data from searching a sequence database.

Sequence distance matrix format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a matrix of genetic distances between molecular sequences.

Hidden Markov model format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format of a hidden Markov model.

Dirichlet distribution format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format of a dirichlet distribution.

HMM emission and transition counts forma.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data format for the emission and transition counts of a hidden Markov model.

RNA secondary structure format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format for secondary structure (predicted or real) of an RNA molecule.

Protein secondary structure format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format for secondary structure (predicted or real) of a protein molecule.

Sequence range format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format used to specify range(s) of sequence positions.

pure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.

unpure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but possibly with non-sequence characters.

unambiguous sequence.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity characters.

ambiguous.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions and possible ambiguity characters.

Sequence features (repeats) format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format used for map of repeats in molecular (typically nucleotide) sequences.

Nucleic acid features (restriction sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format used for report on restriction enzyme recognition sites in nucleotide sequences.

Gene features (coding region) format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format used for report on coding regions in nucleotide sequences.

Sequence cluster format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format used for clusters of molecular sequences.

Sequence cluster format (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format used for clusters of protein sequences.

Sequence cluster format (nucleic acid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format used for clusters of nucleotide sequences.

Gene cluster format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Format used for clusters of genes.

EMBL-like (text).rdfs:comment: This concept may be used for the many non-standard EMBL-like text formats.
EMBL-like (text).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A text format resembling EMBL entry format.

FASTQ-like format (text).rdfs:comment: This concept may be used for non-standard FASTQ short read-like formats.
FASTQ-like format (text).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A text format resembling FASTQ short read format.
