Protein structure assignment (from NMR d.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Assign a protein tertiary structure (3D coordinates) from raw NMR spectroscopy data.

Phylogenetic tree generation (data centr.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Construct a phylogenetic tree from a specific type of data.

Phylogenetic tree generation (method cen.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Construct a phylogenetic tree using a specific method.

Phylogenetic tree generation (from molec.rdfs:comment: Methods typically compare multiple molecular sequence and estimate evolutionary distances and relationships to infer gene families or make functional predictions.
Phylogenetic tree generation (from molec.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Phylogenetic tree construction from molecular sequences.

Phylogenetic tree generation (from conti.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Phylogenetic tree construction from continuous quantitative character data.

Phylogenetic tree generation (from gene.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Phylogenetic tree construction from gene frequency data.

Phylogenetic tree construction (from pol.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Phylogenetic tree construction from polymorphism data including microsatellites, RFLP (restriction fragment length polymorphisms), RAPD (random-amplified polymorphic DNA) and AFLP (amplified fragment length polymorphisms) data.

Phylogenetic species tree construction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Construct a phylogenetic species tree, for example, from a genome-wide sequence comparison.

Phylogenetic tree generation (parsimony.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Construct a phylogenetic tree by computing a sequence alignment and searching for the tree with the fewest number of character-state changes from the alignment.

Phylogenetic tree generation (minimum di.rdfs:comment: This includes neighbor joining (NJ) clustering method.
Phylogenetic tree generation (minimum di.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Construct a phylogenetic tree by computing (or using precomputed) distances between sequences and searching for the tree with minimal discrepancies between pairwise distances.

Phylogenetic tree generation (maximum li.rdfs:comment: Maximum likelihood methods search for a tree that maximizes a likelihood function, i.e. that is most likely given the data and model. Bayesian analysis estimate the probability of tree for branch lengths and topology, typically using a Monte Carlo algorithm.
Phylogenetic tree generation (maximum li.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Construct a phylogenetic tree by relating sequence data to a hypothetical tree topology using a model of sequence evolution.

Phylogenetic tree generation (quartet me.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Construct a phylogenetic tree by computing four-taxon trees (4-trees) and searching for the phylogeny that matches most closely.

Phylogenetic tree generation (AI methods.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Construct a phylogenetic tree by using artificial-intelligence methods, for example genetic algorithms.

DNA substitution modelling.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify a plausible model of DNA substitution that explains a DNA sequence alignment.

Phylogenetic tree analysis (shape).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse the shape (topology) of a phylogenetic tree.

Phylogenetic tree bootstrapping.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Apply bootstrapping or other measures to estimate confidence of a phylogenetic tree.

Phylogenetic tree analysis (gene family.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict families of genes and gene function based on their position in a phylogenetic tree.

Phylogenetic tree analysis (natural sele.rdfs:comment: Stabilizing/purifying (directional) selection favors a single phenotype and tends to decrease genetic diversity as a population stabilizes on a particular trait, selecting out trait extremes or deleterious mutations. In contrast, balancing selection maintain genetic polymorphisms (or multiple alleles), whereas disruptive (or diversifying) selection favors individuals at both extremes of a trait.
Phylogenetic tree analysis (natural sele.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse a phylogenetic tree to identify allele frequency distribution and change that is subject to evolutionary pressures (natural selection, genetic drift, mutation and gene flow). Identify type of natural selection (such as stabilizing, balancing or disruptive).

Phylogenetic tree generation (consensus).rdfs:comment: Methods typically test for topological similarity between trees using for example a congruence index.
Phylogenetic tree generation (consensus).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare two or more phylogenetic trees to produce a consensus tree.

Phylogenetic sub/super tree detection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare two or more phylogenetic trees to detect subtrees or supertrees.

Phylogenetic tree distances calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare two or more phylogenetic trees to calculate distances between trees.

Phylogenetic tree annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotate a phylogenetic tree with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

Immunogenicity prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict and optimise peptide ligands that elicit an immunological response.

DNA vaccine design.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict or optimise DNA to elicit (via DNA vaccination) an immunological response.

Sequence formatting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Reformat (a file or other report of) molecular sequence(s).

Sequence alignment formatting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Reformat (a file or other report of) molecular sequence alignment(s).

Sequence visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise, format or render a molecular sequence, possibly with sequence features or properties shown.

Sequence alignment visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise, format or print a molecular sequence alignment.

Sequence cluster visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise, format or render sequence clusters.

Phylogenetic tree visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Render or visualise a phylogenetic tree.

RNA secondary structure visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise RNA secondary structure, knots, pseudoknots etc.

Protein secondary structure visualisatio.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Render and visualise protein secondary structure.

Structure visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise or render a molecular tertiary structure, for example a high-quality static picture or animation.

Protein interaction network visualisatio.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify and analyse networks of protein interactions.

Map drawing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Draw or visualise a DNA map.

Restriction map drawing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Draw or visualise restriction maps in DNA sequences.

DNA linear map rendering.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Draw a linear maps of DNA.

Plasmid map drawing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Draw a circular maps of DNA, for example a plasmid map.

Nucleic acid folding family identificati.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify folding families of related RNAs.

Nucleic acid folding energy calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compute energies of nucleic acid folding, e.g. minimum folding energies for DNA or RNA sequences or energy landscape of RNA mutants.

Annotation retrieval.rdfs:comment: Use this concepts for tools which retrieve pre-existing annotations, not for example prediction methods that might make annotations.
Annotation retrieval.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Retrieve existing annotation (or documentation), typically annotation on a database entity.

Protein function prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the prediction of functional properties of a protein.

Protein function comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare the functional properties of two or more proteins.

Sequence submission.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Submit a molecular sequence to a database.

Gene regulatory network analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse a known network of gene regulation.

Loading.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Prepare or load a user-specified data file so that it is available for use.

Sequence retrieval.rdfs:comment: This includes direct retrieval methods (e.g. the dbfetch program) but not those that perform calculations on the sequence.
Sequence retrieval.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Query a sequence data resource (typically a database) and retrieve sequences and / or annotation.

Structure retrieval.rdfs:comment: This includes direct retrieval methods but not those that perform calculations on the sequence or structure.
Structure retrieval.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Query a tertiary structure data resource (typically a database) and retrieve structures, structure-related data and annotation.

Surface rendering.rdfs:comment: A dot has three coordinates (x,y,z) and (typically) a color.
Surface rendering.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate the positions of dots that are homogeneously distributed over the surface of a molecule.

Protein atom surface calculation (access.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('accessible surface') for each atom in a structure.
Calculate the solvent accessibility ('accessible molecular surface') for each atom in a structure.

Protein residue surface calculation (acc.rdfs:comment: Solvent accessibility might be calculated for the backbone, sidechain and total (backbone plus sidechain).
Protein residue surface calculation (acc.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('accessible surface') for each residue in a structure.

Protein residue surface calculation (vac.rdfs:comment: Solvent accessibility might be calculated for the backbone, sidechain and total (backbone plus sidechain).
Protein residue surface calculation (vac.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('vacuum accessible surface') for each residue in a structure. This is the accessibility of the residue when taken out of the protein together with the backbone atoms of any residue it is covalently bound to.

Protein residue surface calculation (acc.rdfs:comment: Solvent accessibility might be calculated for the backbone, sidechain and total (backbone plus sidechain).
Protein residue surface calculation (acc.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('accessible molecular surface') for each residue in a structure.

Protein residue surface calculation (vac.rdfs:comment: Solvent accessibility might be calculated for the backbone, sidechain and total (backbone plus sidechain).
Protein residue surface calculation (vac.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('vacuum molecular surface') for each residue in a structure. This is the accessibility of the residue when taken out of the protein together with the backbone atoms of any residue it is covalently bound to.

Protein surface calculation (accessible.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('accessible molecular surface') for a structure as a whole.

Protein surface calculation (accessible).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('accessible surface') for a structure as a whole.

Backbone torsion angle calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate for each residue in a protein structure all its backbone torsion angles.

Full torsion angle calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate for each residue in a protein structure all its torsion angles.

Cysteine torsion angle calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate for each cysteine (bridge) all its torsion angles.

Tau angle calculation.rdfs:comment: Tau is the backbone angle N-Calpha-C (angle over the C-alpha).
Tau angle calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: For each amino acid in a protein structure calculate the backbone angle tau.

Cysteine bridge detection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Detect cysteine bridges (from coordinate data) in a protein structure.

Free cysteine detection.rdfs:comment: A free cysteine is neither involved in a cysteine bridge, nor functions as a ligand to a metal.
Free cysteine detection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Detect free cysteines in a protein structure.

Metal-bound cysteine detection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Detect cysteines that are bound to metal in a protein structure.

Residue contact calculation (residue-nuc.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate protein residue contacts with nucleic acids in a structure.

Residue contact calculation (residue-met.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate protein residue contacts with metal in a structure.

Residue contact calculation (residue-neg.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate ion contacts in a structure (all ions for all side chain atoms).

Residue bump detection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Detect 'bumps' between residues in a structure, i.e. those with pairs of atoms whose Van der Waals' radii interpenetrate more than a defined distance.

Residue symmetry contact calculation.rdfs:comment: A symmetry contact is a contact between two atoms in different asymmetric unit.
Residue symmetry contact calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate the number of symmetry contacts made by residues in a protein structure.

Residue contact calculation (residue-lig.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate contacts between residues and ligands in a protein structure.

Salt bridge calculation.rdfs:comment: Salt bridges are interactions between oppositely charged atoms in different residues. The output might include the inter-atomic distance.
Salt bridge calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate (and possibly score) salt bridges in a protein structure.

Rotamer likelihood prediction.rdfs:comment: Output typically includes, for each residue position, the likelihoods for the 20 amino acid types with estimated reliability of the 20 likelihoods.
Rotamer likelihood prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict rotamer likelihoods for all 20 amino acid types at each position in a protein structure.

Proline mutation value calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate for each position in a protein structure the chance that a proline, when introduced at this position, would increase the stability of the whole protein.

Residue packing validation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify poorly packed residues in protein structures.

Dihedral angle validation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify for each residue in a protein structure any improper dihedral (phi/psi) angles.

PDB file sequence retrieval.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Extract a molecular sequence from a PDB file.

HET group detection.rdfs:comment: A HET group usually corresponds to ligands, lipids, but might also (not consistently) include groups that are attached to amino acids. Each HET group is supposed to have a unique three letter code and a unique name which might be given in the output.
HET group detection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify HET groups in PDB files.

DSSP secondary structure assignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Determine for residue the DSSP determined secondary structure in three-state (HSC).

Structure formatting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Reformat (a file or other report of) tertiary structure data.

Protein cysteine and disulfide bond assi.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Assign cysteine bonding state and disulfide bond partners in protein structures.

Residue validation.rdfs:comment: The scoring function to identify poor quality residues may consider residues with bad atoms or atoms with high B-factor, residues in the N- or C-terminal position, adjacent to an unstructured residue, non-canonical residues, glycine and proline (or adjacent to these such residues).
Residue validation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify poor quality amino acid positions in protein structures.

Structure retrieval (water).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Query a tertiary structure database and retrieve water molecules.

siRNA duplex prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify or predict siRNA duplexes in RNA.

Listfile processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process an EMBOSS listfile (list of EMBOSS Uniform Sequence Addresses).

Sequence file editing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Perform basic (non-analytical) operations on a report or file of sequences (which might include features), such as file concatenation, removal or ordering of sequences, creation of subset or a new file of sequences.

Sequence alignment file processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Perform basic (non-analytical) operations on a sequence alignment file, such as copying or removal and ordering of sequences.

Small molecule data processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) physicochemical property data for small molecules.

Data retrieval (ontology annotation).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Search and retrieve documentation on a bioinformatics ontology.

Data retrieval (ontology concept).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Query an ontology and retrieve concepts or relations.

Representative sequence identification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify a representative sequence from a set of sequences, typically using scores from pair-wise alignment or other comparison of the sequences.

Structure file processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Perform basic (non-analytical) operations on a file of molecular tertiary structural data.

Data retrieval (sequence profile).rdfs:comment: This includes direct retrieval methods that retrieve a profile by, e.g. the profile name.
Data retrieval (sequence profile).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Query a profile data resource and retrieve one or more profile(s) and / or associated annotation.

Statistical calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Perform a statistical data operation of some type, e.g. calibration or validation.

3D-1D scoring matrix generation.rdfs:comment: A 3D-1D scoring matrix scores the probability of amino acids occurring in different structural environments.
3D-1D scoring matrix generation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate a 3D-1D scoring matrix from analysis of protein sequence and structural data.

Transmembrane protein visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise transmembrane proteins, typically the transmembrane regions within a sequence.

Demonstration.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An operation performing purely illustrative (pedagogical) purposes.

Data retrieval (pathway or network).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Query a biological pathways database and retrieve annotation on one or more pathways.

Data retrieval (identifier).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Query a database and retrieve one or more data identifiers.

Nucleic acid density plotting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate a density plot (of base composition) for a nucleotide sequence.

Sequence analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the archival, processing and analysis of molecular sequences (monomer composition of polymers) including molecular sequence data resources, sequence sites, alignments, motifs and profiles.

Sequence motif processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) molecular sequence motifs.

Protein interaction data processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) protein interaction data.

Protein structure analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein secondary or tertiary structural data and/or associated annotation.

Annotation processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) annotation of some type, typically annotation on an entry from a biological or biomedical database entity.

Utility operation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Basic (non-analytical) operations of some data, either a file or equivalent entity in memory.

Gene expression analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse gene expression and regulation data.

Structural profile processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) one or more structural (3D) profile(s) or template(s) of some type.

Data index processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) an index of (typically a file of) biological data.

Sequence profile processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) some type of sequence profile.

Protein function analysis.rdfs:comment: This is a broad concept and is used a placeholder for other, more specific concepts.
Protein function analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse protein function, typically by processing protein sequence and/or structural data, and generate an informative report.

Protein folding analysis.rdfs:comment: This is a broad concept and is used a placeholder for other, more specific concepts.
Protein folding analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse protein folding, typically by processing sequence and / or structural data, and write an informative report.

Protein secondary structure analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse known protein secondary structure data.

Physicochemical property data processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) data on the physicochemical property of a molecule.

Operation (typed).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) data of a specific type, for example applying analytical methods.

Database search.rdfs:comment: Typically the query is compared to each entry and high scoring matches (hits) are returned. For example, a BLAST search of a sequence database.
Database search.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Search a database (or other data resource) with a supplied query and retrieve entries (or parts of entries) that are similar to the query.

Data retrieval.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Retrieve an entry (or part of an entry) from a data resource that matches a supplied query. This might include some primary data and annotation. The query is a data identifier or other indexed term. For example, retrieve a sequence record with the specified accession number, or matching supplied keywords.

Prediction and recognition.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict, recognise, detect or identify some properties of a biomolecule.

Comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare two or more things to identify similarities.

Optimisation and refinement.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Refine or optimise some data model.

Modelling and simulation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Model or simulate some biological entity or system.

Data handling.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Perform basic operations on some data or a database.

Mapping.rdfs:comment: This includes resources that aim to identify, map or analyse genetic markers in DNA sequences, for example to produce a genetic (linkage) map of a chromosome or genome or to analyse genetic linkage and synteny. It also includes resources for physical (sequence) maps of a DNA sequence showing the physical distance (base pairs) between features or landmarks such as restriction sites, cloned DNA fragments, genes and other genetic markers.
Mapping.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the mapping of complete (typically nucleotide) sequences.

Design.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Design a biological entity (typically a molecular sequence or structure) with specific properties.

Microarray data processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) microarray data.

Codon usage table processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a codon usage table.

Data retrieval (codon usage table).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Retrieve a codon usage table and / or associated annotation.

Gene expression profile processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a gene expression profile.

Functional enrichment.rdfs:comment: The Gene Ontology (GO) is invariably used, the input is a set of Gene IDs and the output of the analysis is typically a ranked list of GO terms, each associated with a p-value.
Functional enrichment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse a set of genes (genes corresponding to an expression profile, or any other set) with respect to concepts from an ontology of gene functions.

Gene regulatory network prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict a network of gene regulation.

Pathway or network processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate, analyse or handle a biological pathway or network.

RNA secondary structure analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) RNA secondary structure data.

Structure processing (RNA).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) RNA tertiary structure data.

Phylogenetic tree processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a phylogenetic tree.

Protein secondary structure processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) protein secondary structure data.

Protein interaction network processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a network of protein interactions.

Sequence processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) one or more molecular sequences and associated annotation.

Sequence processing (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a protein sequence and associated annotation.

Sequence processing (nucleic acid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a nucleotide sequence and associated annotation.

Sequence comparison.rdfs:comment: The comparison might be on the basis of sequence, physico-chemical or some other properties of the sequences.
Sequence comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the comparison of two or more molecular sequences, for example sequence alignment and clustering.

Sequence cluster processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a sequence cluster.

Feature table processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a sequence feature table.

Gene prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Detect, predict and identify genes or components of genes in DNA sequences.

GPCR classification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Classify G-protein coupled receptors (GPCRs) into families and subfamilies.

GPCR coupling selectivity prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict G-protein coupled receptor (GPCR) coupling selectivity.

Structure processing (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a protein tertiary structure.

Protein atom surface calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility for each atom in a structure.

Protein residue surface calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility for each residue in a structure.

Protein surface calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility of a structure as a whole.

Sequence alignment processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a molecular sequence alignment.

Protein-protein interaction prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify or predict protein-protein interactions, interfaces, binding sites etc.

Structure processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a molecular tertiary structure.

Map annotation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Annotate a DNA map of some type with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

Data retrieval (phylogenetic tree).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Retrieve a phylogenetic tree from a data resource.

Data retrieval (protein interaction anno.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Retrieve information on a protein interaction.

Data retrieval (protein family annotatio.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Retrieve information on a protein family.

Data retrieval (RNA family annotation).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Retrieve information on an RNA family.

Data retrieval (gene annotation).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Retrieve information on a specific gene.

Data retrieval (genotype and phenotype a.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Retrieve information on a specific genotype or phenotype.

Protein architecture comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare the architecture of two or more protein structures.

Protein architecture recognition.rdfs:comment: Includes methods that try to suggest the most likely biological unit for a given protein X-ray crystal structure based on crystal symmetry and scoring of putative protein-protein interfaces.
Protein architecture recognition.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify the architecture of a protein structure.

Molecular dynamics simulation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Simulate molecular (typically protein) conformation using a computational model of physical forces and computer simulation.

Nucleic acid sequence analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the archival, processing and analysis of nucleotide sequences and and sequence-based entities such as alignments, motifs and profiles.

Protein sequence analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning archival, processing and analysis of protein sequences and sequence-based entities such as alignments, motifs and profiles.

Structure analysis.rdfs:comment: This includes related concepts such as structural properties, alignments and structural motifs.
Structure analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the curation, processing and analysis of the structure of biological molecules, typically proteins and nucleic acids and other macromolecules.

Nucleic acid structure analysis.rdfs:comment: Includes secondary and tertiary nucleic acid structural data, nucleic acid thermodynamic, thermal and conformational properties including DNA or DNA/RNA denaturation (melting) etc.
Nucleic acid structure analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the archival, curation, processing and analysis of nucleic acid structural information, such as whole structures, structural features and alignments, and associated annotation.

Secondary structure processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a molecular secondary structure.

Structure comparison.rdfs:comment: This might involve comparison of secondary or tertiary (3D) structural information.
Structure comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the comparison of two or more molecular structures, for example structure alignment and clustering.

Helical wheel drawing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Render a helical wheel representation of protein secondary structure.

Topology diagram drawing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Render a topology diagram of protein secondary structure.

Protein structure comparison.rdfs:comment: Use this concept for methods that are exclusively for protein structure.
Protein structure comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the comparison of two or more protein structures.

Protein subcellular localization predict.rdfs:comment: The prediction might include subcellular localization (nuclear, cytoplasmic, mitochondrial, chloroplast, plastid, membrane etc) or export (extracellular proteins) of a protein.
Protein subcellular localization predict.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict the subcellular localization of a protein sequence.

Residue contact calculation (residue-res.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate contacts between residues in a protein structure.

Hydrogen bond calculation (inter-residue.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify potential hydrogen bonds between amino acid residues.

Protein interaction prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict the interactions of proteins with other molecules.

Codon usage data processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) codon usage data.

Gene expression data analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) gene expression (typically microarray) data, including analysis of one or more gene expression profiles, typically to interpret them in functional terms.

Gene regulatory network processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a network of gene regulation.

Pathway or network analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse a known biological pathway or network.

Sequencing-based expression profile data.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse SAGE, MPSS or SBS experimental data, typically to identify or quantify mRNA transcripts.

Splicing model analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse, characterize and model alternative splicing events from comparing multiple nucleic acid sequences.

Nucleic acid analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) nucleic acid sequence or structural data.

Protein analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) protein sequence or structural data.

Sequence data processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) molecular sequence data.

Structural data processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) molecular structural data.

Protein sequence alignment analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse a protein sequence alignment, typically to detect features or make predictions.

Nucleic acid sequence alignment analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse a protein sequence alignment, typically to detect features or make predictions.

Nucleic acid sequence comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare two or more nucleic acid sequences.

Protein sequence comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare two or more protein sequences.

DNA back-translation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Back-translate a protein sequence into DNA.

Sequence editing (nucleic acid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Edit or change a nucleic acid sequence, either randomly or specifically.

Sequence editing (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Edit or change a protein sequence, either randomly or specifically.

Sequence generation (nucleic acid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate a nucleic acid sequence by some means.

Sequence generation (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate a protein sequence by some means.

Nucleic acid sequence visualisation.rdfs:comment: Various nucleic acid sequence analysis methods might generate a sequence rendering but are not (for brevity) listed under here.
Nucleic acid sequence visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise, format or render a nucleic acid sequence.

Protein sequence visualisation.rdfs:comment: Various protein sequence analysis methods might generate a sequence rendering but are not (for brevity) listed under here.
Protein sequence visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise, format or render a protein sequence.

Nucleic acid structure comparison.rdfs:comment: Use this concept for methods that are exclusively for nucleic acid structures.
Nucleic acid structure comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the comparison two or more nucleic acid (typically RNA) secondary or tertiary structures.

Structure processing (nucleic acid).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) nucleic acid tertiary structure data.

DNA mapping.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate a map of a DNA sequence annotated with positional or non-positional features of some type.

Map data processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a DNA map of some type.

Protein hydropathy calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse the hydrophobic, hydrophilic or charge properties of a protein (from analysis of sequence or structural information).

Protein binding site prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify or predict catalytic residues, active sites or other ligand-binding sites in protein sequences or structures.

Sequence tagged site (STS) mapping.rdfs:comment: An STS is a short subsequence of known sequence and location that occurs only once in the chromosome or genome that is being mapped. Sources of STSs include 1. expressed sequence tags (ESTs), simple sequence length polymorphisms (SSLPs), and random genomic sequences from cloned genomic DNA or database sequences.
Sequence tagged site (STS) mapping.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate a physical DNA map (sequence map) from analysis of sequence tagged sites (STS).

Protein fragment weight comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate the molecular weight of a protein (or fragments) and compare it another protein or reference data.

Protein property comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare the physicochemical properties of two or more proteins (or reference data).

Secondary structure comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare two or more molecular secondary structures.

Hopp and Woods plotting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate a Hopp and Woods plot of antigenicity of a protein.

Microarray cluster textual view generati.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise gene clusters with gene names.

Microarray wave graph plotting.rdfs:comment: This view can be rendered as a pie graph.  The distance matrix is sorted by cluster number and typically represented as a diagonal matrix with distance values displayed in different color shades.
Microarray wave graph plotting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise clustered gene expression data as a set of waves, where each wave corresponds to a gene across samples on the X-axis.

Microarray dendrograph plotting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate a dendrograph of raw, preprocessed or clustered microarray data.

Microarray proximity map plotting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate a plot of distances (distance matrix) between genes.

Microarray tree or dendrogram rendering.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise clustered gene expression data using a gene tree, array tree and color coded band of gene expression.

Microarray principal component plotting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate a line graph drawn as sum of principal components (Eigen value) and individual expression values.

Microarray scatter plot plotting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate a scatter plot of microarray data, typically after principal component analysis.

Whole microarray graph plotting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise gene expression data where each band (or line graph) corresponds to a sample.

Microarray tree-map rendering.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise gene expression data after hierarchical clustering for representing hierarchical relationships.

Microarray Box-Whisker plot plotting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise raw and pre-processed gene expression data, via a plot showing over- and under-expression along with mean, upper and lower quartiles.

Physical mapping.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate a physical (sequence) map of a DNA sequence showing the physical distance (base pairs) between features or landmarks such as restriction sites, cloned DNA fragments, genes and other genetic markers.

Analysis.rdfs:comment: For non-analytical operations, see the 'Processing' branch.
Analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Apply analytical methods to existing data of a specific type.

Alignment analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process or analyse an alignment of molecular sequences or structures.

Article analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse a body of scientific text (typically a full text article from a scientific journal.)

Molecular interaction analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse the interactions of two or more molecules (or parts of molecules) that are known to interact.

Protein interaction analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse known protein-protein, protein-DNA/RNA or protein-ligand interactions.

Residue contact calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate contacts between residues and some other group in a protein structure.

Alignment processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) an alignment of two or more molecular sequences, structures or derived data.

Structure alignment processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a molecular tertiary (3D) structure alignment.

Codon usage bias plotting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate a codon usage bias plot.

Codon usage fraction calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate the differences in codon usage fractions between two sequences, sets of sequences, codon usage tables etc.

Classification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic focused on identifying, grouping, or naming things in a structured way according to some schema based on observable relationships.

Molecular interaction data processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) molecular interaction data.

Sequence classification.rdfs:comment: Methods including sequence motifs, profile and other diagnostic elements which (typically) represent conserved patterns (of residues or properties) in molecular sequences.
Sequence classification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the classification of molecular sequences based on some measure of their similarity.

Structure classification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Assign molecular structure(s) to a group or category.

Protein comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare two or more proteins (or some aspect) to identify similarities.

Nucleic acid comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare two or more nucleic acids to identify similarities.

Prediction and recognition (protein).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict, recognise, detect or identify some properties of proteins.

Prediction and recognition (nucleic acid.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict, recognise, detect or identify some properties of nucleic acids.

Structure editing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Edit, convert or otherwise change a  molecular tertiary structure, either randomly or specifically.

Sequence alignment editing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Edit, convert or otherwise change a molecular sequence alignment, either randomly or specifically.

Pathway or network visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Render (visualise) a biological pathway or network.

Protein function prediction (from sequen.rdfs:comment: For functional properties that are positional, use 'Protein site detection' instead.
Protein function prediction (from sequen.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict general (non-positional) functional properties of a protein from analysing its sequence.

Protein sequence feature detection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict, recognise and identify functional or other key sites within protein sequences, typically by scanning for known motifs, patterns and regular expressions.

Protein property calculation (from seque.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate (or predict) physical or chemical properties of a protein, including any non-positional properties of the molecular sequence, from processing a protein sequence.

Protein feature prediction (from structu.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict, recognise and identify positional features in proteins from analysing protein structure.

Protein feature detection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the detection, identification and analysis of positional protein sequence features, such as functional sites.

Database search (by sequence).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Screen a molecular sequence(s) against a database (of some type) to identify similarities between the sequence and database entries.

Protein interaction network prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict a network of protein interactions.

Nucleic acid design.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic for the design of nucleic acid sequences with specific conformations.

Editing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Edit a data entity, either randomly or specifically.

Sequence assembly validation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Evaluate a DNA sequence assembly, typically for purposes of quality control.

Genome alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Align two or more (tpyically huge) molecular sequences that represent genomes.

Localized reassembly.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Reconstruction of a sequence assembly in a localised area.

Sequence assembly visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Render and visualise a DNA sequence assembly.

Base-calling.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify base (nucleobase) sequence from a fluorescence 'trace' data generated by an automated DNA sequencer.

Bisulfite mapping.rdfs:comment: Bisulfite mapping follows high-throughput sequencing of DNA which has undergone bisulfite treatment followed by PCR amplification; unmethylated cytosines are specifically converted to thymine, allowing the methylation status of cytosine in the DNA to be detected.
Bisulfite mapping.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The mapping of methylation sites in a DNA (genome) sequence.

Sequence contamination filtering.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify and filter a (typically large) sequence data set to remove sequences from contaminants in the sample that was sequenced.

Trim ends.rdfs:comment: For example trim polyA tails, introns and primer sequence flanking the sequence of amplified exons, or other unwanted sequence.
Trim ends.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Trim sequences (typically from an automated DNA sequencer) to remove misleading ends.

Trim vector.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Trim sequences (typically from an automated DNA sequencer) to remove sequence-specific end regions, typically contamination from vector sequences.

Trim to reference.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Trim sequences (typically from an automated DNA sequencer) to remove the sequence ends that extend beyond an assembled reference sequence.

Sequence trimming.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Cut (remove) the end from a molecular sequence.

Genome feature comparison.rdfs:comment: Genomic elements that might be compared include genes, indels, single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs), retrotransposons, tandem repeats and so on.
Genome feature comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare the features of two genome sequences.

Sequencing error detection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Detect errors in DNA sequences generated from sequencing projects).

Genotyping.rdfs:comment: Methods might consider cytogenetic analyses, copy number polymorphism (and calculate copy number calls for copy-number variation(CNV) regions), single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP), , rare copy number variation (CNV) identification, loss of heterozygosity data and so on.
Genotyping.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse DNA sequence data to identify differences between the genetic composition (genotype) of an individual compared to other individual's or a reference sequence.

Genetic variation analysis.rdfs:comment: Genetic variation annotation provides contextual interpretation of coding SNP consequences in transcripts. It allows comparisons to be made between variation data in different populations or strains for the same transcript.
Genetic variation analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse a genetic variation, for example to annotate its location, alleles, classification, and effects on individual transcripts predicted for a gene model.

Read mapping.rdfs:comment: The purpose of read mapping is to identify the location of sequenced fragments within a reference genome and assumes that there is, in fact, at least local similarity between the fragment and reference sequences.
Read mapping.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Align short oligonucleotide sequences (reads) to a larger (genomic) sequence.

Split read mapping.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A varient of oligonucleotide mapping where a read is mapped to two separate locations because of possible structural variation.

DNA barcoding.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse DNA sequences in order to identify a DNA barcode; short fragment(s) of DNA that are useful to diagnose the taxa of biological organisms.

SNP calling.rdfs:comment: Operations usually score confidence in the prediction or some other statistical measure of evidence.
SNP calling.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify single nucleotide change in base positions in sequencing data that differ from a reference genome and which might, especially by reference to population frequency or functional data, indicate a polymorphism.

Mutation detection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Detect mutations in multiple DNA sequences, for example, from the alignment and comparison of the fluorescent traces produced by DNA sequencing hardware.

Chromatogram visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise, format or render an image of a Chromatogram.

Methylation analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Determine cytosine methylation states in nucleic acid sequences.

Methylation calling.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Determine cytosine methylation status of specific positions in a nucleic acid sequences.

Methylation level analysis (global).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Measure the overall level of methyl cytosines in a genome from analysis of experimental data, typically from chromatographic methods and methyl accepting capacity assay.

Methylation level analysis (gene-specifi.rdfs:comment: Many different techniques are available for this.
Methylation level analysis (gene-specifi.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Measure the level of methyl cytosines in specific genes.

Genome visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise, format or render a nucleic acid sequence that is part of (and in context of) a complete genome sequence.

Genome comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare the sequence or features of two or more genomes, for example, to find matching regions.

Genome indexing.rdfs:comment: Many sequence alignment tasks involving many or very large sequences rely on a precomputed index of the sequence to accelerate the alignment.
Genome indexing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate an index of a genome sequence.

Genome indexing (Burrows-Wheeler).rdfs:comment: The Burrows-Wheeler Transform (BWT) is a permutation of the genome based on a suffix array algorithm.
Genome indexing (Burrows-Wheeler).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate an index of a genome sequence using the Burrows-Wheeler algorithm.

Genome indexing (suffix arrays).rdfs:comment: A suffix array consists of the lexicographically sorted list of suffixes of a genome.
Genome indexing (suffix arrays).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate an index of a genome sequence using a suffix arrays algorithm.

Spectral analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse a spectrum from a mass spectrometry (or other) experiment.

Peak detection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify peaks in a spectrum from a mass spectrometry, NMR, or some other spectrum-generating experiment.

Scaffolding.rdfs:comment: Scaffold may be positioned along a chromosome physical map to create a "golden path".
Scaffolding.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Link together a non-contiguous series of genomic sequences into a scaffold, consisting of sequences separated by gaps of known length.  The sequences that are linked are typically typically contigs; contiguous sequences corresponding to read overlaps.

Scaffold gap completion.rdfs:comment: Different techniques are used to generate gap sequences to connect contigs, depending on the size of the gap. For small (5-20kb) gaps, PCR amplification and sequencing is used.  For large (>20kb) gaps, fragments are cloned (e.g. in BAC (Bacterial artificial chromosomes) vectors) and then sequenced.
Scaffold gap completion.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Fill the gaps in a sequence assembly (scaffold) by merging in additional sequences.

Sequencing quality control.rdfs:comment: Analyse raw sequence data from a sequencing pipeline and identify problems.

Read pre-processing.rdfs:comment: This is a broad concept and is used a placeholder for other, more specific concepts.  For example process paired end reads to trim low quality ends remove short sequences, identify sequence inserts, detect chimeric reads, or remove low quality sequnces including vector, adaptor, low complexity and contaminant sequences. Sequences might come from genomic DNA library, EST libraries, SSH library and so on.
Read pre-processing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Pre-process sequence reads to ensure (or improve) quality and reliability.

Species frequency estimation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Estimate the frequencies of different species from analysis of the molecular sequences, typically of DNA recovered from environmental samples.

Peak calling.rdfs:comment: Chip-sequencing combines chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP) with massively parallel DNA sequencing to generate a set of reads, which are aligned to a genome sequence.  The enriched areas contain the binding sites of DNA-associated proteins.  For example, a transcription factor binding site. ChIP-on-chip in contrast combines chromatin immunoprecipitation ('ChIP') with microarray ('chip').
Peak calling.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify putative protein-binding regions in a genome sequence from analysis of Chip-sequencing data or ChIP-on-chip data.

Differential expression analysis.rdfs:comment: Differential expression analysis is used, for example, to identify which genes are up-regulated (increased expression) or down-regulated (decreased expression) between a group treated with a drug and a control groups.
Differential expression analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify (typically from analysis of microarray or RNA-seq data) genes whose expression levels are significantly different between two sample groups.

Gene set testing.rdfs:comment: Gene sets can be defined beforehand by biological function, chromosome locations and so on.
Gene set testing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse gene expression patterns (typically from DNA microarray datasets) to identify sets of genes that are associated with a specific trait, condition, clinical outcome etc.

Variant classification.rdfs:comment: Variants are typically classified by their position (intronic, exonic, etc.) in a gene transcript and (for variants in coding exons) by their effect on the protein sequence (synonymous, non-synonymous, frameshifting, etc.)
Variant classification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Classify variants based on their potential effect on genes, especially functional effects on the expressed proteins.

Variant prioritization.rdfs:comment: Variant prioritization can be used for example to produce a list of variants responsible for 'knocking out' genes in specific genomes. Methods amino acid substitution, aggregative approaches, probabilistic approach, inheritance and unified likelihood-frameworks.
Variant prioritization.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify biologically interesting variants by prioritizing individual variants, for example, homozygous variants absent in control genomes.

Variant calling.rdfs:comment: Methods often utilise a database of aligned reads.
Variant calling.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify and map genomic alterations, including single nucleotide polymorphisms, short indels and structural variants, in a genome sequence.

Structural variation discovery.rdfs:comment: Methods might involve analysis of whole-genome array comparative genome hybridization or single-nucleotide polymorphism arrays, paired-end mapping of sequencing data, or from analysis of short reads from new sequencing technologies.
Structural variation discovery.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Detect large regions in a genome subject to copy-number variation, or other structural variations in genome(s).

Exome analysis.rdfs:comment: Exome sequencing is considered a cheap alternative to whole genome sequencing.
Exome analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Anaylse sequencing data from experiments aiming to selectively sequence the coding regions of the genome.

Read depth analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse mapping density (read depth) of (typically) short reads from sequencing platforms, for example, to detect deletions and duplications.

Gene expression QTL analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Combine classical quantitative trait loci (QTL) analysis with gene expression profiling, for example, to describe describe cis- and trans-controlling elements for the expression of phenotype associated genes.

Copy number estimation.rdfs:comment: Methods typically implement some statistical model for hypothesis testing, and methods estimate total copy number, i.e. do not distinguish the two inherited chromosomes quantities (specific copy number).
Copy number estimation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Estimate the number of copies of loci of particular gene(s) in DNA sequences typically from gene-expression profiling technology based on microarray hybridization-based experiments. For example, estimate copy number (or marker dosage) of a dominant marker in samples from polyploid plant cells or tissues, or chromosomal gains and losses in tumors.

Primer removal.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Remove forward and/or reverse primers from nucleic acid sequences (typically PCR products).

Transcriptome assembly.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Infer a transcriptome sequence by analysis of short sequence reads.

Transcriptome assembly (de novo).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Infer a transcriptome sequence without the aid of a reference genome, i.e. by comparing short sequences (reads) to each other.

Transcriptome assembly (mapping).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Infer a transcriptome sequence by mapping short reads to a reference genome.

Sequence coordinate conversion.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Convert one set of sequence coordinates to another, e.g. convert coordinates of one assembly to another, cDNA to genomic, CDS to genomic, protein translation to genomic etc.

Document similarity calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Calculate similarity between 2 or more documents.

Document clustering.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Cluster (group) documents on the basis of their calculated similarity.

Named entity recognition.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Recognise named entities (text tokens) within documents.

ID mapping.rdfs:comment: The mapping can be achieved by comparing identifier values or some other means, e.g. exact matches to a provided sequence.
ID mapping.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Map data identifiers to one another for example to establish a link between two biological databases for the purposes of data integration.

Anonymisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Process data in such a way that makes it hard to trace to the person which the data concerns.

ID retrieval.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Search for and retrieve a data identifier of some kind, e.g. a database entry accession.

Sequence checksum generation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate a checksum of a molecular sequence.

Bibliography generation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Construct a bibliography from the scientific literature.

Protein quaternary structure prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict the structure of a multi-subunit protein and particularly how the subunits fit together.

Protein surface analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse the surface properties of proteins.

Ontology comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare two or more ontologies, e.g. identify differences.

Format detection.rdfs:comment: 'Format recognition' is not a bioinformatics-specific operation, but of great relevance in bioinformatics. Should be removed from EDAM if/when captured satisfactorily in a suitable domain-generic ontology.
Format detection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Recognition of which format the given data is in.

Splitting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Split a file containing multiple data items into many files, each containing one item

Generation.rdfs:comment: For non-analytical operations, see the 'Processing' branch.

Nucleic acid sequence feature detection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict, recognise and identify functional or other key sites within nucleic acid sequences, typically by scanning for known motifs, patterns and regular expressions.

Deposition.rdfs:comment: For non-analytical operations, see the 'Processing' branch.
Deposition.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Deposit some data in a database.

Clustering.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Group together some data entities on the basis of similarities such that entities in the same group (cluster) are more similar to each other than to those in other groups (clusters).

Aggregation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Combine multiple files or data items into a single file or object.

Article comparison.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare two or more scientific articles.

Calculation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Mathemetical determination of the value of something, typically a properly of a  molecule.

Pathway or network prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict a molecular pathway or network.

Genome assembly.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The process of assembling many short DNA sequences together such thay they represent the original chromosomes from which the DNA originated.

Plotting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate a graph, or other visual representation, of data, showing the relationship between two or more variables.

Image analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The analysis of a image (typically a digital image) of some type in order to extract information from it.

Diffraction data analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analysis of data from a diffraction experiment.

Cell migration analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analysis of cell migration images in order to study cell migration, typically in order to study the processes that play a role in the disease progression.

Diffraction data reduction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Processing of diffraction data into a corrected, ordered, and simplified form.

Neurite measurement.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Measurement of neurites; projections (axons or dendrites) from the cell body of a neuron, from analysis of neuron images.

Diffraction data integration.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The evaluation of diffraction intensities and integration of diffraction maxima from a diffraction experiment.

Phasing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Phase a macromolecular crystal structure, for example by using molecular replacement or experimental phasing methods.

Molecular replacement.rdfs:comment: The technique solves the phase problem, i.e. retrieve information concern phases of the structure.
Molecular replacement.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A technique used to construct an atomic model of an unknown structure from diffraction data, based upon an atomic model of a known structure, either a related protein or the same protein from a different crystal form.

Rigid body refinement.rdfs:comment: Rigid body refinement usually follows molecular replacement in the assignment of a structure from diffraction data.
Rigid body refinement.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A method used to refine a structure by moving the whole molecule or parts of it as a rigid unit, rather than moving individual atoms.

Single particle analysis.rdfs:comment: Single particle analysis is used to improve the information that can be obtained by relatively low resolution techniques, , e.g. an image of a protein or virus from transmission electron microscopy (TEM).
Single particle analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: An image processing technique that combines and analyze multiple images of a particulate sample, in order to produce an image with clearer features that are more easily interpreted.

Single particle alignment and classifica.rdfs:comment: A micrograph can include particles in multiple different orientations and/or conformations.  Particles are compared and organised into sets based on their similarity.  Typically iterations of classification and alignment and are performed to optimise the final image; average images produced by classification are used as a reference image for subsequent alignment of the whole image set.
Single particle alignment and classifica.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compare (align and classify) multiple particle images from a micrograph in order to produce a representative image of the particle.

Functional clustering.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Clustering of molecular sequences on the basis of their function, typically using information from an ontology of gene function, or some other measure of functional phenotype.

Virulence prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The prediction of the degree of pathogenicity of a microorganism from analysis of molecular sequences.

Gene expression correlation analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse the correlation patterns among genes across across a variety of experiments, microarray samples etc.

RNA structure covariance model generatio.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Compute the covariance model for (a family of) RNA secondary structures.

RNA secondary structure prediction (shap.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Predict RNA secondary structure by analysis, e.g. probabilistic analysis, of the shape of RNA folds.

Nucleic acid alignment folding predictio.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Prediction of nucleic-acid folding using sequence alignments as a source of data.

k-mer counting.rdfs:comment: k-mer counting is used in genome and transcriptome assembly, metagenomic sequencing, and for error correction of sequence reads.
k-mer counting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Count k-mers (substrings of length k) in DNA sequence data.

Phylogenetic tree reconstruction.rdfs:comment: Note that this is somewhat different from simply analysing an existing tree or constructing a completely new one.
Phylogenetic tree reconstruction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Reconstructing the inner node labels of a phylogenetic tree from its leafes.

Probabilistic data generation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate some data from a choosen probibalistic model, possibly to evaluate algorithms.

Probabilistic sequence generation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Generate sequences from some probabilistic model, e.g. a model that simulates evolution.

Antimicrobial resistance prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify or predict causes for antibiotic resistance from molecular sequence analysis.

Enrichment.rdfs:comment: A relevant ontology will be used. The input is typically a set of identifiers or other data, and the output of the analysis is typically a ranked list of ontology terms, each associated with a p-value.
Enrichment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse a dataset with respect to concepts from an ontology.

Chemical class enrichment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Analyse a dataset with respect to concepts from an ontology of chemical structure.

Incident curve plotting.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Plot an incident curve such as a survival curve, death curve, mortality curve.

Variant pattern analysis.rdfs:comment: Methods often utilise a database of aligned reads.
Variant pattern analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Identify and map patterns of genomic variations.

Mathematical modelling.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Model some biological system using mathematical techniques including  dynamical systems, statistical models, differential equations, and game theoretic models.

Topic.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A category denoting a rather broad domain or field of interest, of study, application, work, data, or technology. Topics have no clearly defined borders between each other.

Nucleic acids.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the processing and analysis of nucleic acid sequence, structural and other data.

Proteins.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning archival, processing and analysis of protein data, typically molecular sequence and structural data.

Metabolites.rdfs:comment: This concept excludes macromolecules such as proteins and nucleic acids.
Metabolites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the structures of reactants or products of metabolism, for example small molecules such as including vitamins, polyols, nucleotides and amino acids.

Phylogeny.rdfs:comment: This includes diverse phylogenetic methods, including phylogenetic tree construction, typically from molecular sequence or morphological data, methods that simulate DNA sequence evolution, a phylogenetic tree or the underlying data, or which estimate or use molecular clock and stratigraphic (age) data, methods for studying gene evolution etc.
Phylogeny.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of evolutionary relationships amongst organisms.

Functional genomics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of gene or protein functions and their interactions in totality in a given organism, tissue, cell etc.

Ontology and terminology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the conceptualisation, categorisation and nomenclature (naming) of entities or phenomena within biology or bioinformatics. This includes formal ontologies, controlled vocabularies, structured glossary, symbols and terminology or other related resource.

Data search, query and retrieval.rdfs:comment: This includes, for example, search, query and retrieval of molecular sequences and associated data.
Data search, query and retrieval.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the search and query of data sources (typically biological databases or ontologies) in order to retrieve entries or other information.

Bioinformatics.rdfs:comment: This includes data  processing in general, including basic handling of files and databases, datatypes, workflows and annotation.
Bioinformatics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the archival, curation, processing and analysis of complex biological data.

Data visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic for the rendering (drawing on a computer screen) or visualisation of molecular sequences, structures or other biomolecular data.

Nucleic acid thermodynamics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of the thermodynamic properties of a nucleic acid.

RNA.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning RNA sequences and structures.

Nucleic acid restriction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic for the study of restriction enzymes, their cleavage sites and the restriction of nucleic acids.

Genetic codes and codon usage.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of codon usage in nucleotide sequence(s), genetic codes and so on.

Protein expression.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the translation of mRNA into protein and subsequent protein processing in the cell.

Gene finding.rdfs:comment: This includes the study of promoters, coding regions, splice sites, etc. Methods for gene prediction might be ab initio, based on phylogenetic comparisons, use motifs, sequence features, support vector machine, alignment etc.
Gene finding.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic that aims to identify, predict, model or analyse genes or gene structure in DNA sequences.

Transcription.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the transcription of DNA into mRNA.

Promoters.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning whole promoters or promoter elements (transcription start sites, RNA polymerase binding site, transcription factor binding sites, promoter enhancers etc) in a DNA sequence.

Nucleic acid folding.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the folding (in 3D space) of nucleic acid molecules.

Gene structure.rdfs:comment: This includes the study of promoters, coding regions etc.
Gene structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning gene structure, regions which make an RNA product and features such as promoters, coding regions, gene fusion, splice sites etc.

Proteomics.rdfs:comment: Proteomics includes any methods (especially high-throughput) that separate, characterize and identify expressed proteins such as mass spectrometry, two-dimensional gel electrophoresis and protein microarrays, as well as in-silico methods that perform proteolytic or mass calculations on a protein sequence and other analyses of protein expression data, for example in different cells or tissues.
Proteomics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein and peptide identification, especially in the study of whole proteomes of organisms.

Structural genomics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the elucidation of the three dimensional structure for all (available) proteins in a given organism.

Protein properties.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of the physical and biochemical properties of peptides and proteins, for example the hydrophobic, hydrophilic and charge properties of a protein.

Protein interactions.rdfs:comment: This includes experimental (e.g. yeast two-hybrid) and computational analysis techniques.
Protein interactions.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein-protein, protein-DNA/RNA and protein-ligand interactions, including analysis of known interactions and prediction of putative interactions.

Protein folding, stability and design.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein stability, folding (in 3D space) and protein sequence-structure-function relationships.  This includes for example study of inter-atomic or inter-residue interactions in protein (3D) structures, the effect of mutation, and the design of proteins with specific properties, typically by designing changes (via site-directed mutagenesis) to an existing protein.

Two-dimensional gel electrophoresis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning two-dimensional gel electrophoresis image and related data.

Mass spectrometry.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning an analytical chemistry technique that measures the mass-to-charge ratio and abundance of irons in the gas phase.

Protein hydropathy.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic for the study of the hydrophobic, hydrophilic and charge properties of a protein.

Protein targeting and localization.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of how proteins are transported within and without the cell, including signal peptides, protein subcellular localization and export.

Protein cleavage sites and proteolysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning enzyme or chemical cleavage sites and proteolytic or mass calculations on a protein sequence.

Protein-protein interactions.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein-protein interaction(s), including interactions between protein domains.

Protein design.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the design of proteins with specific properties, typically by designing changes (via site-directed mutagenesis) to an existing protein.

Carbohydrates.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning carbohydrates, typically including structural information.

Lipids.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning lipids and their structures.

Small molecules.rdfs:comment: Small molecules include organic molecules, metal-organic compounds, small polypeptides, small polysaccharides and oligonucleotides.  Structural data is usually included.
Small molecules.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning small molecules of biological significance, typically archival, curation, processing and analysis of structural information.

Sequence composition, complexity and rep.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the archival, processing and analysis of the basic character composition of molecular sequences, for example character or word frequency, ambiguity, complexity, particularly regions of low complexity, and repeats or the repetitive nature of molecular sequences.

Sequence motifs.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning conserved patterns (motifs) in molecular sequences, that (typically) describe functional or other key sites.

Sequence sites, features and motifs.oboInOwl:hasDefinition:
Topic concerning the archival, detection, prediction and analysis of
positional features such as functional and other key sites, in molecular sequences and the conserved patterns (motifs, profiles etc.) that may be used to describe them.

Structural (3D) profiles.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The processing, analysis or use of some type of structural (3D) profile or template; a computational entity (typically a numerical matrix) that is derived from and represents a structure or structure alignment.

Homology modelling.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the modelling of the three-dimensional structure of a protein using known sequence and structural data.

Molecular dynamics.rdfs:comment: This includes resources concerning flexibility and motion in protein and other molecular structures.
Molecular dynamics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the simulation of molecular (typically protein) conformation using a computational model of physical forces and computer simulation.

Protein tertiary structure prediction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the prediction of tertiary structure of protein sequences.

Threading.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the alignment of molecular sequences to structures, structural (3D) profiles or templates (representing a structure or structure alignment).

Sequence profiles and HMMs.rdfs:comment: Sequence profiles include position-specific scoring matrix (position weight matrix), hidden Markov models etc.
Sequence profiles and HMMs.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning sequence profiles; typically a positional, numerical matrix representing a sequence alignment.

Phylogeny reconstruction.rdfs:comment: Currently too specific for the topic sub-ontology (but might be unobsoleted).
Phylogeny reconstruction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the reconstruction of a phylogeny (evolutionary relatedness amongst organisms), for example, by building a phylogenetic tree.

Phylogenomics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the integrated study of evolutionary relationships and whole genome data, for example, in the analysis of species trees, horizontal gene transfer and evolutionary reconstruction.

Genetic variation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning stable, naturally occuring mutations in a nucleotide sequence including alleles, naturally occurring mutations such as single base nucleotide substitutions, deletions and insertions, RFLPs and other polymorphisms.

Microarrays.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning microarrays, for example, to process microarray data or design probes and experiments.

Pharmacology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of drugs and their effects or responses in living systems.

rdfs:comment: This includes the study of codon usage in nucleotide sequence(s), genetic codes and so on.
Gene expression levels are analysed by identifying, quantifying or comparing mRNA transcripts, for example using microarrays, RNA-seq, northern blots, gene-indexed expression profiles etc.
Gene expression.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the analysis of levels and patterns of synthesis of gene products (proteins and functional RNA) including interpretation in functional terms of gene expression data.

Gene regulation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning primarily the regulation of gene expression.

Pharmacogenomics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the influence of genotype on drug response, for example by correlating gene expression or single-nucleotide polymorphisms with drug efficacy or toxicity.

Medicinal chemistry.rdfs:comment: This includes methods that search compound collections, generate or analyse drug 3D conformations, identify drug targets with structural docking etc.
Medicinal chemistry.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the design and chemical synthesis of bioactive molecules, for example drugs or potential drug compounds, for medicinal purposes.

Fish.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning fish, e.g. information on a specific fish genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Flies.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning flies, e.g. information on a specific fly genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Mice or rats.rdfs:comment: The resource may be specific to a group of mice / rats or all mice / rats.
Mice or rats.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning mice or rats, e.g. information on a specific genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Worms.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning worms, e.g. information on a specific worm genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Literature analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: The processing and analysis of the bioinformatics literature and bibliographic data, such as literature search and query.

Data mining.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the discovery of patterns in large data sets and the extraction and trasnsformation of those patterns into a useful format.

Data deposition, annotation and curation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the organisation and maintenance of a collection of biological database entries (or other such entities) including the annotation of entries, typically with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

File management.rdfs:comment: This includes editing, reformatting, conversion, transformation, validation, debugging, indexing and so on.
File management.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning basic manipulations of files or reports of generic biological data.

NMR.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning an analytical technique that exploits the magenetic properties of certain atomic nuclei to provide information on the structure, dynamics, reaction state and chemical environment of molecules.

Sequence motif or profile.rdfs:comment: This includes comparison, discovery, recognition etc. of sequence motifs.
Sequence motif or profile.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning sequence motifs, or sequence profiles derived from an alignment of molecular sequences of a particular type.

Protein modifications.rdfs:comment: EDAM does not describe all possible protein modifications. For fine-grained annotation of protein modification use the Gene Ontology (children of concept GO:0006464) and/or the Protein Modifications ontology (children of concept MOD:00000)
