Protein modifications.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein chemical modifications, e.g. post-translational modifications.

Molecular interactions, pathways and net.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning molecular interactions, biological pathways, networks and other models.

Informatics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A database concerning biological data management and modelling, including datatypes, workflows and models. A sub-discipline of bioinformatics; the application of information technology to a specialised biological area.

Literature data resources.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Data resources for the biological or biomedical literature, either a primary source of literature or some derivative.

Laboratory information management.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning laboratory management and resources, for example, catalogues of biological resources for use in the lab including cell lines, viruses, plasmids, phages, DNA probes and primers and so on.

Cell and tissue culture.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning general cell culture or data on a specific cell lines.

Ecology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the ecological and environmental sciences and especially the application of information technology (ecoinformatics).

Electron microscopy.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of matter by studying the interference pattern from firing electrons at a sample, to analyse structures at resolutions higher than can be achieved using light.

Cell cycle.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the cell cycle including key genes and proteins.

Peptides and amino acids.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the physicochemical, biochemical or structural properties of amino acids or peptides.

Organelles.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning a specific organelle, or organelles in general, typically the genes and proteins (or genome and proteome).

Ribosomes.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning ribosomes, typically of ribosome-related genes and proteins.

Drugs and target structures.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the structures of drugs, drug target, their interactions and binding affinities.

Organisms.rdfs:comment: This may include information on the genome (including molecular sequences and map, genes and annotation), proteome, as well as more general information about an organism.
Organisms.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning a specific organism, or group of organisms, used to study a particular aspect of biology.

Genomics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning whole genomes of one or more organisms, or genomes in general, such as meta-information on genomes, genome projects, gene names etc.

Gene families.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning particular gene(s), gene family or other gene group or system and their encoded proteins.

Genotype and phenotype.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of genetic constitution of a living entity, such as an individual, and organism, a cell and so on, typically with respect to a particular observable phenotypic traits, or resources concerning such traits, which might be an aspect of biochemistry, physiology, morphology, anatomy, development and so on.

Gene expression and microarray.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning gene expression e.g. microarray data, northern blots, gene-indexed expression profiles etc.

Sequence design.rdfs:comment: This includes the design of primers for PCR and DNA amplification or the design of molecular probes.
Sequence design.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning molecular probes (e.g. a peptide probe or DNA microarray probe) or primers (e.g. for PCR).

Pathology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning diseases, including diseases in general and the genes, gene variations and proteins involved in one or more specific diseases.

Specific protein resources.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning a particular protein, protein family or other group of proteins.

Repeat sequences.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the repetitive nature of molecular sequences.

Low complexity sequences.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the (character) complexity of molecular sequences, particularly regions of low complexity.

Proteome.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning a specific proteome including protein sequences and annotation.

DNA.rdfs:comment: The DNA sequences might be coding or non-coding sequences.
DNA.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning DNA sequences and structure, including processes such as methylation and replication.

Coding RNA.rdfs:comment: This includes expressed sequence tag (EST) or complementary DNA (cDNA) sequences.
Coding RNA.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein-coding regions including coding sequences (CDS), exons, translation initiation sites and open reading frames

Functional, regulatory and non-coding RN.rdfs:comment: Non-coding RNA includes  piwi-interacting RNA (piRNA), small nuclear RNA (snRNA) and small nucleolar RNA (snoRNA).  Regulatory RNA includes microRNA (miRNA) - short single stranded RNA molecules that regulate gene expression, and small interfering RNA (siRNA).
Functional, regulatory and non-coding RN.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning non-coding or functional RNA sequences, including regulatory RNA sequences, ribosomal RNA (rRNA) and transfer RNA (tRNA).

rRNA.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning one or more ribosomal RNA (rRNA) sequences.

tRNA.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning one or more transfer RNA (tRNA) sequences.

Protein secondary structure.rdfs:comment: The location and size of the secondary structure elements and intervening loop regions is typically given.  The report can include disulphide bonds and post-translationally formed peptide bonds (crosslinks).
Protein secondary structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning secondary structure (predicted or real) of a protein.

Protein families.rdfs:comment: A protein families database might include the classifier (e.g. a sequence profile) used to build the classification.
Protein families.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning primarily the classification of proteins (from sequence or structural data) into clusters, groups, families etc., curation of a particular protein or protein family, or any other proteins that have been classified as members of a common group.

Protein domains and folds.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein tertiary structural domains and folds.

Protein sequence alignment.rdfs:comment: A sequence profile typically represents a sequence alignment.

Nucleic acid sites and features.oboInOwl:hasDefinition:
Topic concerning the archival, detection, prediction and analysis of
positional features such as functional sites in nucleotide sequences.

Protein sites and features.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the detection, identification and analysis of positional features in proteins, such as functional sites.

Transcription factors and regulatory sit.rdfs:comment: Transcription factor proteins either promote (as an activator) or block (as a repressor) the binding to DNA of RNA polymerase.  Regulatory sites including transcription factor binding site as well as promoters, enhancers, silencers and boundary elements / insulators.
Transcription factors and regulatory sit.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning proteins that bind to DNA and control transcription of DNA to mRNA (transcription factors) and also transcriptional regulatory sites, elements and regions (such as promoters, enhancers, silencers and boundary elements / insulators) in nucleotide sequences.

Phosphorylation sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein phosphorylation and phosphorylation sites in protein sequences.

Workflows.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning biological or biomedical analytical workflows or pipelines.

Data types and objects.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning structuring data into basic types and (computational) objects.

Mitochondria.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning mitochondria, typically of mitochondrial genes and proteins.

Plants.rdfs:comment: The resource may be specific to a plant, a group of plants or all plants.
Plants.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning plants, e.g. information on a specific plant genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Viruses.rdfs:comment: The resource may be specific to a virus, a group of viruses or all viruses.
Viruses.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning viruses, e.g. sequence and structural data, interactions of viral proteins, or a viral genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Fungi.rdfs:comment: The resource may be specific to a fungus, a group of fungi or all fungi.
Fungi.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning fungi and molds, e.g. information on a specific fungal genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Pathogens.rdfs:comment: The resource may be specific to a pathogen, a group of pathogens or all pathogens.
Pathogens.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning pathogens, e.g. information on a specific vertebrate genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Genetic mapping and linkage.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Informatics resources that aim to identify, map or analyse genetic markers in DNA sequences, for example to produce a genetic (linkage) map of a chromosome or genome or to analyse genetic linkage and synteny.

Comparative genomics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study (typically comparison) of the sequence, structure or function of multiple genomes.

Human disease.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning human diseases, typically describing the genes, mutations and proteins implicated in disease.

Immunology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the application of information technology to immunology such as immunological processes, immunological genes, proteins and peptide ligands, antigens and so on.

Membrane and lipoproteins.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning lipoproteins (protein-lipid assemblies), and proteins or region of a protein that spans or are associated with a membrane.

Enzymes.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning proteins that catalyze chemical reaction, the kinetics of enzyme-catalysed reactions, enzyme nomenclature etc.

Primers.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning PCR primers and hybridization oligos in a nucleic acid sequence.

PolyA signal or sites.rdfs:comment: A polyA signal is required for endonuclease cleavage of an RNA transcript that is followed by polyadenylation. A polyA site is a site on an RNA transcript to which adenine residues will be added during post-transcriptional polyadenylation.
PolyA signal or sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning regions or sites in a eukaryotic and eukaryotic viral RNA sequence which directs endonuclease cleavage or polyadenylation of an RNA transcript.

CpG island and isochores.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning CpG rich regions (isochores) in a nucleotide sequence.

Restriction sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning restriction enzyme recognition sites (restriction sites) in a nucleic acid sequence.

Splice sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning splice sites in a nucleotide sequence or alternative RNA splicing events.

Matrix/scaffold attachment sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning matrix/scaffold attachment regions (MARs/SARs) in a DNA sequence.

Operon.rdfs:comment: The report for a query sequence or gene might include the predicted operon leader and trailer gene, gene composition of the operon and associated information, as well as information on the query.
Operon.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning operons (operators, promoters and genes) from a bacterial genome.

Structural biology.rdfs:comment: This includes experimental methods for biomolecular structure determination, such as X-ray crystallography, nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopy, microscopy etc., including the assignment or modelling of molecular structure from such data.
Structural biology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the molecular structure of biological molecules, particularly macromolecules such as proteins and nucleic acids.

Protein membrane regions.rdfs:comment: This might include the location and size of the membrane spanning segments and intervening loop regions, transmembrane region IN/OUT orientation relative to the membrane, plus the following data for each amino acid: A Z-coordinate (the distance to the membrane center), the free energy of membrane insertion (calculated in a sliding window over the sequence) and a reliability score. The z-coordinate implies information about re-entrant helices, interfacial helices, the tilt of a transmembrane helix and loop lengths.
Protein membrane regions.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning trans- or intra-membrane regions of a protein, typically describing physicochemical properties of the secondary structure elements.

Function analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of gene and protein function including the prediction of functional properties of a protein.

Prokaryotes and archae.rdfs:comment: The resource may be specific to a prokaryote, a group of prokaryotes or all prokaryotes.
Prokaryotes and archae.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning specific bacteria or archaea, e.g. information on a specific prokaryote genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Structure determination.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning experimental methods for biomolecular structure determination, such as X-ray crystallography, nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopy, microscopy etc., including the assignment or modelling of molecular structure from such data.

Cell biology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning cells, such as key genes and proteins involved in the cell cycle.

Phylogeny visualisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Visualise a phylogeny, for example, render a phylogenetic tree.

Cheminformatics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the application of information technology to chemistry in biological research environment.

Systems biology.rdfs:comment: This includes databases of models and methods to construct or analyse a model.
Systems biology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the holistic modelling and analysis of complex biological systems and the interactions therein.

Statistics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the application of statistical methods to biological problems.

Molecular modelling.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the construction, analysis, evaluation, refinement etc. of models of a molecules properties or behaviour.

Exons.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning exons in a nucleotide sequences.

Gene transcription features.rdfs:comment: This includes promoters, CAAT signals, TATA signals, -35 signals, -10 signals, GC signals, primer binding sites for initiation of transcription or reverse transcription, enhancer, attenuator, terminators and ribosome binding sites.
Gene transcription features.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning transcription of DNA into RNA including the regulation of transcription.

Oncology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of cancer, for example, genes and proteins implicated in cancer.

Toxins and targets.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning structural and associated data for toxic chemical substances.

Introns.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning introns in a nucleotide sequences.

Tool topic.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A topic concerning primarily bioinformatics software tools, typically the broad function or purpose of a tool.

Study topic.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A general area of bioinformatics study, typically the broad scope or category of content of a bioinformatics journal or conference proceeding.

Nomenclature.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning biological nomenclature (naming), symbols and terminology.

Disease genes and proteins.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the genes, gene variations and proteins involved in one or more specific diseases.

Humans.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the human genome, including molecular sequences, genes, annotation, maps and viewers, the human proteome or human beings in general.

Gene resources.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Informatics resource (typically a database) primarily focussed on genes.

Yeast.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning yeast, e.g. information on a specific yeast genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Eukaryotes.rdfs:comment: The resource may be specific to a eukaryote, a group of eukaryotes or all eukaryotes.
Eukaryotes.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning eukaryotes or data concerning eukaryotes, e.g. information on a specific eukaryote genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Invertebrates.rdfs:comment: The resource may be specific to an invertebrate, a group of invertebrates or all invertebrates.
Invertebrates.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning invertebrates, e.g. information on a specific invertebrate genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Vertebrates.rdfs:comment: The resource may be specific to a vertebrate, a group of vertebrates or all vertebrates.
Vertebrates.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning vertebrates, e.g. information on a specific vertebrate genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Unicellular eukaryotes.rdfs:comment: The resource may be specific to a unicellular eukaryote, a group of unicellular eukaryotes or all unicellular eukaryotes.
Unicellular eukaryotes.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning unicellular eukaryotes, e.g. information on a unicellular eukaryote genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Protein structure alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein secondary or tertiary structure alignments.

X-ray diffraction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of matter and their structure by means of the diffraction of X-rays, typically the diffraction pattern caused by the regularly spaced atoms of a crystalline sample.

Ontologies, nomenclature and classificat.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning conceptualisation, categorisation and naming of entities or phenomena within biology or bioinformatics.

Immunoproteins, genes and antigens.rdfs:comment: This includes T cell receptors (TR), major histocompatibility complex (MHC), immunoglobulin superfamily (IgSF) / antibodies, major histocompatibility complex superfamily (MhcSF), etc."
Immunoproteins, genes and antigens.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning immunity-related genes, proteins and their ligands.

Molecules.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning specific molecules, including large molecules built from repeating subunits (macromolecules) and small molecules of biological significance.

Toxicology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning toxins and the adverse effects of these chemical substances on living organisms.

High-throughput sequencing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning parallelized sequencing processes that are capable of sequencing many thousands of sequences simultaneously.

Structural clustering.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the comparison and grouping together of molecular structures on the basis of similarity; generate, process or analyse structural clusters.

Disease (specific).oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Informatics resources dedicated to one or more specific diseases (not diseases in general).

VNTR.rdfs:comment: VNTRs occur in non-coding regions of DNA and consists sub-sequence that is repeated a multiple (and varied) number of times.
VNTR.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning variable number of tandem repeat (VNTR) polymorphism in a DNA sequence.

Microsatellites.rdfs:comment: A microsatellite polymorphism is a very short subsequence that is repeated a variable number of times between individuals. These repeats consist of the nucleotides cytosine and adenosine.
Microsatellites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning microsatellite polymorphism in a DNA sequence.

RFLP.rdfs:comment: An RFLP is defined by the presence or absence of a specific restriction site of a bacterial restriction enzyme.
RFLP.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning restriction fragment length polymorphisms (RFLP) in a DNA sequence.

Primer or probe design.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the design of primers for PCR and DNA amplification or the design of molecular probes.

Structure databases.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning molecular secondary or tertiary (3D) structural data resources, typically of proteins and nucleic acids.

Sequence databases.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning molecular sequence data resources, including sequence sites, alignments, motifs and profiles.

Nucleic acid sequences.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning nucleotide sequences and associated concepts such as sequence sites, alignments, motifs and profiles.

Protein sequences.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein sequences and associated concepts such as sequence sites, alignments, motifs and profiles.

Molecular biology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the molecular basis of biological activity, particularly the macromolecules (e.g. proteins and nucleic acids) that are essential to life.

Mammals.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning mammals, e.g. information on a specific mammal genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Biodiversity.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the degree of variation of life forms within a given ecosystem, biome or an entire planet.

Sequence clusters and classification.rdfs:comment: This includes the results of sequence clustering, ortholog identification, assignment to families, annotation etc.
Sequence clusters and classification.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the comparison, grouping together and classification of macromolecules on the basis of sequence similarity.

Genetics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of genes, genetic variation and heredity in living organisms.

Quantitative genetics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the genes and genetic mechanisms such as Mendelian inheritance that underly continuous phenotypic traits (such as height or weight).

Population genetics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the distribution of allele frequencies in a population of organisms and its change subject to evolutionary processes including natural selection, genetic drift, mutation and gene flow.

Regulatory RNA.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning regulatory RNA sequences including microRNA (miRNA) and small interfering RNA (siRNA).

Documentation and help.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the documentation of resources such as tools, services and databases and how to get help.

Genetic organisation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the structural and functional organisation of genes and other genetic elements.

Medical informatics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the application of information technology to health, disease and biomedicine.

Developmental biology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning how organisms grow and develop.

Embryology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the development of organisms between the one-cell stage (typically the zygote) and the end of the embryonic stage.

Anatomy.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the form and function of the structures of living organisms.

Literature and reference.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the scientific literature, reference information and documentation.

Biology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning a particular biological science, especially observable traits such as aspects of biochemistry, physiology, morphology, anatomy, development and so on.

Data management.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the general handling of data stored in digital archives such as databanks, databases proper, web portals and other data resources.

Biological system modelling.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic for modelling biological systems in mathematical terms.

Data acquisition.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the acquisition of biological data.

Genes and proteins resources.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning specific genes and/or their encoded proteins or a family or other grouping of related genes and proteins.

Protein topological domains.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning topological domains such as cytoplasmic regions in a protein.

Protein variants.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein sequence variants produced e.g. from alternative splicing, alternative promoter usage, alternative initiation and ribosomal frameshifting.

Expression signals.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning regions within a nucleic acid sequence containing a signal that alters a biological function.

DNA binding sites.rdfs:comment: This includes ribosome binding sites (Shine-Dalgarno sequence in prokaryotes).
DNA binding sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning nucleic acids binding to some other molecule.

Nucleic acid repeats.rdfs:comment: This includes long terminal repeats (LTRs); sequences (typically retroviral) directly repeated at  both ends of a defined sequence and other types of repeating unit.
Nucleic acid repeats.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning repetitive elements within a nucleic acid sequence.

DNA replication and recombination.rdfs:comment: This includes binding sites for initiation of replication (origin of replication), regions where transfer is initiated during the conjugation or mobilization (origin of transfer), starting sites for DNA duplication (origin of replication) and regions which are eliminated through any of kind of recombination.
DNA replication and recombination.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning DNA replication or recombination.

Signal or transit peptide.rdfs:comment: A signal peptide coding sequence encodes an N-terminal domain of a secreted protein, which is involved in attaching the polypeptide to a membrane leader sequence. A transit peptide coding sequence encodes an N-terminal domain of a nuclear-encoded organellar protein; which is involved in import of the protein into the organelle.
Signal or transit peptide.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning coding sequences for a signal or transit peptide.

Sequence tagged sites.rdfs:comment: Sequence tagged sites are short DNA sequences that are unique within a genome and serve as a mapping landmark, detectable by PCR they allow a genome to be mapped via an ordering of STSs.
Sequence tagged sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning sequence tagged sites (STS) in nucleic acid sequences.

Sequencing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the determination of complete (typically nucleotide) sequences, including those of genomes (full genome sequencing, de novo sequencing and resequencing), amplicons and transcriptomes.

ChIP-seq.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the analysis of protein-DNA interactions where chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP) is used in combination with massively parallel DNA sequencing to identify the binding sites of DNA-associated proteins.

RNA-Seq.rdfs:comment: This includes small RNA profiling (small RNA-Seq), for example to find novel small RNAs, characterize mutations and analyze expression of small RNAs.
RNA-Seq.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A topic concerning high-throughput sequencing of cDNA to measure the RNA content (transcriptome) of a sample, for example, to investigate how different alleles of a gene are expressed, detect post-transcriptional mutations or identify gene fusions.

DNA methylation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning DNA methylation including bisulfite sequencing, methylation sites and analysis, for example of patterns and profiles of DNA methylation in a population, tissue etc.

Metabolomics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the systematic study of metabolites, the chemical processes they are involved, and the chemical fingerprints of specific cellular processes in a whole cell, tissue, organ or organism.

Epigenomics.rdfs:comment: Epigenetics concerns the heritable changes in gene expression owing to mechanisms other than DNA sequence variation.
Epigenomics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of the epigenetic modifications of a whole cell, tissue, organism etc.

Metagenomics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of genetic material recovered from environmental samples, and associated environmental data.

Structural variation.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning variation in chromosome structure including microscopic and submicroscopic types of variation such as deletions, duplications, copy-number variants, insertions, inversions and translocations.

DNA packaging.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning DNA-histone complexes (chromatin), organisation of chromatin into nucleosomes and packaging into higher-order structures.

DNA-Seq.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A topic concerning high-throughput sequencing of randomly fragmented genomic DNA, for example, to investigate whole-genome sequencing and resequencing, SNP discovery, identification of copy number variations and chromosomal rearrangements.

RNA-Seq alignment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the alignment of sequences of (typically millions) of short reads to a reference genome.  This is a specialised topic within sequence alignment, especially because of complications arising from RNA splicing.

ChIP-on-chip.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning experimental techniques that combine chromatin immunoprecipitation ('ChIP') with microarray ('chip'). ChIP-on-chip is used for high-throughput study protein-DNA interactions.

Data security.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the protection of data, for example, patient health data.

Sample collections.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning biological samples and specimens.

Biochemistry.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning chemical substances and physico-chemical processes and that occur within living organisms.

Phylogenetics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of evolutionary relationships amongst organisms from analysis of genetic information (typically gene or protein sequences).

Epigenetics.rdfs:comment: This includes sub-topics such as histone modification and DNA methylation.

Biotechnology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the exploitation of biological process, structure and function for industrial purposes, for example the genetic manipulation of microorganisms for the antibody production.

Phenomics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning phenomes, or the study of the change in phenotype (the physical and biochemical traits of organisms) in response to genetic and environmental factors.

Evolutionary biology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the evolutionary processes, from the genetic to environmental scale, that produced life in all its diversity.

Physiology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the functions of living organisms and their constituent parts.

Microbiology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the biology of microorganisms.

oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the biology of parasites.
Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the anatomy, functions and disorders of the nervous system.

Medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning research in support of healing by diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease.

Neurobiology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of the nervous system and brain; its anatomy, physiology and function.

Biophysics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of physics to study biological system.

Computational biology.rdfs:comment: This includes the modeling and treatment of biological processes and systems in mathematical terms (theoretical biology).
Computational biology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the development and application of theory, analytical methods, mathematical models and computational simulation of biological systems.

Transcriptomics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the analysis of transcriptomes, or a set of all the RNA molecules in a specific cell, tissue etc.

Chemistry.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the composition and properties of matter, reactions, and the use of reactions to create new substances.

Mathematics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the is the study of numbers (quantity) and other topics including structure, space, and change.

Computer science.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the theory and practical use of computer systems.

Physics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of matter, space and time, and related concepts such as energy and force.

RNA splicing.rdfs:comment: This includes the study of splice sites, splicing patterns, splice alternatives or variants, isoforms, etc.
RNA splicing.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning RNA splicing; post-transcription RNA modification involving the removal of introns and joining of exons.

Molecular genetics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the structure and function of genes at a molecular level.

Respiratory medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of respiratory system.

Metabolic disease.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of metabolic diseases.

Infectious disease.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis and management of transmissable disease with clinically evident illness resulting from infection with pathogenic biological agents (viruses, bacteria, fungi, protozoa, parasites and prions).

Rare diseases.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of rare diseases.

Neurology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the anatomy, functions and disorders of the nervous system.

Cardiology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the diseases and abnormalities of the heart and circulatory system.

Drug discovery.rdfs:comment: This includes methods that search compound collections, generate or analyse drug 3D conformations, identify drug targets with structural docking etc.
Drug discovery.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the discovery and design of drugs or potential drug compounds.

Biobank.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning repositories of biological samples, typically human, for basic biological and clinical research.

Mouse clinic.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning laboratory study of mice, for example, phenotyping, and mutagenesis of mouse cell lines.

Microbial collection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning collections of microbial cells including bacteria, yeasts and moulds.

Cell culture collection.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning collections of cells grown under laboratory conditions, specifically, cells from multi-cellular eukaryotes and especially animal cells.

Clone library.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning collections of DNA, including both collections of cloned molecules, and populations of micro-organisms that store and propagate cloned DNA.

Translational medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning 'translating' the output of basic and biomedical research into better diagnostic tools, medicines, medical procedures, policies and advice.

Compound libraries and screening.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning collections of chemicals, typically for use in high-throughput screening experiments.

Sequence search.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the search and retrieval from a database on the basis of molecular sequence similarity.

Biomarkers.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning objective indicators of biological state often used to assess health, and determinate treatment.

Laboratory techniques.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the procedures used to conduct an experiment.

Data analysis.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the process of systematically applying statistical and / or logical techniques to describe and illustrate, condense and recap, and evaluate data.

Data integration.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the combination of data from different sources to provide users with a unified view of these data.

Biomaterials.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning any matter, surface or construct that interacts with a biological system.

Chemical biology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of synthetic chemistry to study and manipulate biological systems.

Analytical chemistry.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of the separation, identification, and quantification of the chemical components of natural and artificial materials.

Synthetic chemistry.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of chemistry to create new compounds.

Computer programming.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the process that leads from an original formulation of a computing problem to executable programs.

Drug development.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the process of bringing a new drug to market once a lead compounds has been identified through drug discovery.

Drug formulation and delivery.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the process of formulating abd administering a pharmaceutical compound to achieve a therapeutic effect.

Pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of how a drug interacts with the body.

Medicine research and development.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the discovery, development and approval of medicines.

Safety sciences.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the safety (or lack) of drugs and other medical interventions.

Pharmacovigilence.rdfs:comment: Pharmacovigilence concerns safety once a drug has gone to market.
Pharmacovigilence.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the detection, assesment, understanding and prevention of adverse effects of medicines.

Preclinical and clinical studies.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the testing of new medicines, vaccines or procedures on animals (preclinical) and humans (clinical) prior to their approval by regulatory authorities.

Imaging.rdfs:comment: This includes diffraction experiments that are based upon the interference of waves, typically electromagnetic waves such as  X-rays or visible light, by some object being studied, typical in order to produce an image of the object or determine its structure.
Imaging.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the visual representation of an object.

Biological imaging.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of imaging techniques to understand biology.

Medical imaging.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of imaging techniques for clinical purposes for medical research.

Light microscopy.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of optical instruments to magnify the image of an object.

Laboratory animal science.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of animals and alternatives in experimental research.

Marine biology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of organisms in the ocean or brackish waters.

Molecular medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the identification of molecular and genetic causes of disease and the development of interventions to correct them.

Nutritional science.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of the effects of food components on the metabolism, health, performance and disease resistance of humans and animals.  It also includes the study of human behaviours related to food choices.

Omics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the collective characterisation and quantification of pools of biological molecules that translate into the structure, function, and dynamics of an organism or organisms.

Quality affairs.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the processes that need to be in place to ensure the quality of products for human or animal use.

Regulatory affairs.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the protection of public health by controlling the safety and efficacy of products in areas including pharmaceuticals, veterinary medicine, medical devices, pesticides, agrochemicals, cosmetics, and complementary medicines.

Regnerative medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning biomedical approaches to clinical interventions that involve the use of stem cells.

Systems medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning an interdisciplinary field of study that looks at the dynamic systems of the human body as part of an integrted whole, incoporating biochemical, physiological, and environmental interactions that sustain life.

Bioengineering.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the application of biological concepts and methods to the analytical and synthetic methodologies of engineering.

Geriatric medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine dealing with the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of disease in older people, and the problems specific to aging.

Allergy, clinical immunology and immunot.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning health issues related to the immune system and their prevention, diagnosis and mangement.

Pain medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning with the prevention of pain and the evaluation, treatment and rehabilitation of persons in pain.

Critical care medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the multidisciplinary that cares for patients with acute, life-threatening illness or injury.

Dermatology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with prevention, diagnosis and treatment of disorders of the skin, scalp, hair and nails.

Dentistry.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study, diagnosis, prevention and treatments of disorders of the oral cavity, maxillofacial area and adjacent structures.

Ear, nose and throat medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of disorders of the ear, nose and throat.

Endocrinology and metabolism.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine dealing with diseases of endocrine organs, hormone systems, their target organs, and disorders of the pathways of glucose and lipid metabolism.

Haematology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the blood, blood-forming organs and blood diseases.

Gastroenterology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with disorders of the oesophagus, stomach, duodenum, jejenum, ileum, large intestine, sigmoid colon and rectum.

Gender medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of the biological and physiological differences between males and females and how they effect differences in disease presentation and management.

Gynaecology and obstetrics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the health of the female reproductive system, pregnancy and birth.

Hepatic and biliary medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the liver, gallbladder, bile ducts and bile.

Infectious tropical disease.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the infectious diseases of the tropics.

Trauma medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that treats body wounds or shock produced by sudden physical injury, as from violence or accident.

Medical toxicology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the diagnosis, management and prevention of poisoning and other adverse health effects caused by medications, occupational and environmental toxins, and biological agents.

Musculoskeletal medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of disorders of the muscle, bone and connective tissue.  It incorporates aspects of orthopaedics, rheumatology, rehabilitation medicine and pain medicine.

Opthalmology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with disorders of the eye, including eyelid, optic nerve/visual pathways and occular muscles.

Paediatrics.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the medical care of infants, children and adolescents.

Psychiatry.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the mangement of mental illness, emotional disturbance and abnormal behaviour.

Reproductive health.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the health of the reproductive processes, functions and systems at all stages of life.

Surgery.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of operative, manual and instrumental techniques on a patient to investigate and/or treat a pathological condition or help improve bodily function or appearance.

Urology and nephrology.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branches of medicine and physiology focussing on the function and disorders of the urinary system in males and females, the reproductive system in males, and the kidney.

Complementary medicine.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning medical therapies that fall beyond the scope of conventional medicine but may be used alongside it in the treatment of disease and ill health.

MRI.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning techniques that uses magnetic fields and radiowaves to form images, typically to investigate the anatomy and physiology of the human body.

Neutron diffraction.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of matter by studying the diffraction pattern from firing neutrons at a sample, typically to determine atomic and/or magnetic structure.

Tomography.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning imaging in sections (sectioning), through the use of a wave-generating device (tomograph) that generates an image (a tomogram).

Machine learning.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: A topic concerning the application of artificial intelligence methods to algorithms, in order to create methods that can learn from data in order to generate an ouput, rather than relying on explicitly encoded information only.

Biological databases.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning databases of biological information including the results of scientific experiments, the application of high-throughput technology, computational analysis and the the scientific literature.

Animals.rdfs:comment: The resource may be specific to a plant, a group of plants or all plants.
Animals.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning animals, e.g. information on a specific animal genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

Protein sites, features and motifs.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the biologiy, archival, detection, prediction and analysis of positional features such as functional and other key sites, in protein sequences and the conserved patterns (motifs, profiles etc.) that may be used to describe them.

Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning the biologiy, archival, detection, prediction and analysis of positional features such as functional and other key sites, in nucleic acid sequences and the conserved patterns (motifs, profiles etc.) that may be used to describe them.

Gene transcript features.rdfs:comment: This includes 5'untranslated region (5'UTR), coding sequences (CDS), exons, intervening sequences (intron) and 3'untranslated regions (3'UTR).
Gene transcript features.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning features of a messenger RNA (mRNA) molecules including precursor RNA, primary (unprocessed) transcript and fully processed molecules.

Genotyping experiment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning genotype experiment including case control, population, and family studies. These might use array based methods and re-sequencing methods.

GWAS study.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning genome-wide association study experiments.

Microarray experiment.rdfs:comment: This might specify which raw data file relates to which sample and information on hybridisations, e.g. which are technical and which are biological replicates.
Microarray experiment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning microarray experiments including conditions, protocol, sample:data relationships etc.

PCR experiment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning PCR experiments, e.g. quantitative real-time PCR.

2D PAGE experiment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning two-dimensional gel electrophoresis experiments, gels or spots in a gel.

Simulation experiment.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning biological computational model experiments (simulation), for example the minimum information required in order to permit its correct interpretation and reproduction.

Disease pathways.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning disease pathways, typically of human disease.

Environmental information processing pat.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning environmental information processing pathways.

Genetic information processing pathways.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning genetic information processing pathways.

Protein super-secondary structure.rdfs:comment: Super-secondary structures include leucine zippers, coiled coils, Helix-Turn-Helix etc.
Protein super-secondary structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning super-secondary structure of protein sequence(s).

Protein active sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning catalytic residues (active site) of an enzyme.

Protein binding sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning ligand-binding (non-catalytic) residues of a protein, such as sites that bind metal, prosthetic groups or lipids.

Protein-nucleic acid binding sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning RNA and DNA-binding proteins and binding sites in protein sequences.

Protein cleavage sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning cleavage sites (for a proteolytic enzyme or agent) in a protein sequence.

Protein chemical modifications.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning chemical modification of a protein.

Protein disordered structure.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning disordered structure in a protein.

Protein domains.rdfs:comment: The report will typically include a graphic of the location of domains in a sequence, with associated data such as lists of related sequences, literature references, etc.
Protein domains.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning structural domains or 3D folds in a protein or polypeptide chain.

Protein key folding sites.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning key residues involved in protein folding.

Protein post-translational modifications.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning post-translation modifications in a protein sequence, typically describing the specific sites involved.

Protein sequence repeats.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning short repetitive subsequences (repeat sequences) in a protein sequence.

Protein signal peptides.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: Topic concerning signal peptides or signal peptide cleavage sites in protein sequences.

data processing task.rdfs:comment: A data processing task is an information processing objective that specifies the objective that a data processing algorithm execution process needs to achieve when executed on a dataset to produce as output a new dataset.

data mining algorithm.rdfs:comment: A data mining algorithm is an algorithm that has as its objective a data mining task and outputs as a result a generalization specified by a generalization specification.

probability distribution estimation task.rdfs:comment:
Estimating the (Joint) Probability Distribution. A set of data (of type
T) is often assumed to be a sample taken from a population according to a
probability distribution. A probability distribution/density function assigns a
non-negative probability/density to each object of type T. Probably the most
general data mining task (Hand et al. 2001) is the task of estimating the (joint)
probability distribution D over type T from a set of data items or a sample
drawn from that distribution.
As mentioned above, in the most typical case we would have T = Tuple(T1,
. . ., Tk), where each of T1, . . ., Tk is Boolean, Discrete(S) or Real. We talk about
the joint probability distribution to emphasize the difference to the marginal
distributions of each of the variables of type T1, . . ., Tk: the joint distribution
captures the interactions among the variables.
Representing multi-variate distributions is a non-trivial task. Two approaches
are commonly used in data mining. In the density-based clustering paradigm,
mixtures of multi-variate Gaussian distributions are typically considered (Hand
et al. 2001). Probabilistic graphical models, most notably Bayesian networks,
represent graphically the (in)dependencies between the variables: Learning their
structure and parameters is an important approach to the problem of estimating
the joint probability distribution.

pattern discovery task.rdfs:comment:
the task of pattern discovery is to find all local patterns from a given
pattern language that satisfy the required conditions. A prototypical instantiation
of this task is the task of finding frequent itemsets (sets of items, such as
{bread, butter}), which are often found together in a transaction (e.g., a market
basket) (Aggrawal et al 1993). The condition that a pattern (itemset) has to
satisfy in this case is to appear in (hold true for) a sufficiently high proportion
(called support and denoted by s) of the transactions in the input dataset.
With the increasing interest in mining complex data, mining frequent patterns
is also considered for structured data. We can thus talk about mining frequent
subsequences or mining frequent subgraphs in sequence or graph data. We can
consider as frequency the multiple occurrences of a pattern in a single data
structure (e.g., sequence or graph) or the single occurrences of a pattern in
multiple data structures.

data mining task.rdfs:comment: A data mining task is an objective specification that specifies the objective that a data mining algorithm needs to achieve when executed on a dataset to produce as output a generalization.

predictive modeling task.rdfs:comment:
Learning a (Probabilistic) Predictive Model. In this task, we are given
a dataset that consists of examples of the form (d, c), where each d is of type
Td and each c is of type Tc. We will refer to d as the description and c as the
class or target. To learn a predictive model means to find a mapping from the
description to the target, m :: Td → Tc, that fits the data closely. This means
that the observed target values and the target values predicted by the model,
i.e., c and ˆc = m(d), have to match closely.

clustering task.rdfs:comment:
Clustering. Clustering in general is concerned with grouping objects into classes
of similar objects (Kaufman and Rousseeuw 1990). Given a set of examples (object
descriptions), the task of clustering is to partition these examples into subsets,
called clusters.

data processing algorithm.rdfs:comment: A data processing algorithm is an algorithm that has as its objective a data processing task and has data items both as input and output.

ensemble algorithm.rdfs:comment:
Ensemble algorithms are algorithms that generate an ensemble when executed on a dataset. The ensemble algorithms include a specification of  single generalization algorithms which are executed in oreder to produce the single generalizations that compose the ensemble.

Examples of ensemble algorithms include bagging, boosting, stacking, random forests, random subspaces,bagging of random subspaces etc.

For example, bagging of decision trees algorithm includes the specification of a bagging algorithm and having a decision tree algorithm for generating the base models composing the ensemble.

single generalization algorithm.rdfs:comment: single generalization algorithms are data mining algorithms that given a dataset on input produce a generalization at the output.

data visualization task.rdfs:comment: data visualization task is information processing objective achieved by a data visualization algorithm execution process.

BioConductor Software.rdfs:comment: This is a defined class which will be populated if a piece of software identifies itself as having the value 'Bioconductor' for the 'is published by' property. (Allyson Lister)

CDF binary format.rdfs:comment: It is unclear whether, originally, this format was intended to be the ASCII or binary version of the CDF format. As such, this class has been renamed as the binary format, and a new class created (CDF ASCII format) to make both options available.

CEL binary format.rdfs:comment: It is unclear whether, originally, this format was intended to be the ASCII or binary version of the CEL format. As such, this class has been renamed as the binary format, and a new class created (CEL ASCII format) to make both options available. (22/05/2013)

CHP binary format.rdfs:comment: As this is a child of Binary format, it is assumed that this class is intended to represent the binary form of this format. As described in the definition sources, there are other formats for CHP available.

affyImGUI.rdfs:comment: Removed the links to specified data inputs, as this software is a GUI wrapper for another package, and it is this package which takes the inputs. (Allyson Lister 22/05/2013)

rdfs:comment: Data in RDF format can be serialised into XML, textual, or binary format.
Merged with now-obsolete EDAM class 'RDF' http://edamontology.org/format_2376 by Allyson Lister.

WKn.rdfs:comment: Please note that this is a collective class for all versions of the WKn format, and the specific version required should be created as necessary and placed as a child of this class.

rdfs:comment: In some ways, purchase cost is similar to the already-extant usage clause hierarchy, which includes restricted and unrestricted usage. However, a usage limitation is not necessarily due to whether or not something costs money: even if the usage is academic only, it could still be either free or non-free. A license could have multiple usage clauses, e.g. academic only when free, and unrestricted if a fee is paid. Purchase cost was created which, together with a usage clause, defines both limitations and cost.

Free.rdfs:comment: This class refers only to the cost of the software, not to the definition of "free software" as provided by the GNU Project and which is commonly used to describe software that respects users' freedom and community (http://www.gnu.org/philosophy/free-sw.html).

Not Free.rdfs:comment: This class refers only to the cost of the software, not to the definition of "free software" as provided by the GNU Project and which is commonly used to describe software that respects users' freedom and community (http://www.gnu.org/philosophy/free-sw.html).

file rendering.rdfs:comment: Renders a file in such a way that its contents can be understood by users.

Obsolete concept (EDAM).rdfs:comment: Needed for conversion to the OBO format.

has format.rdfs:comment: Subject A can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated) that is (or is in a role of) 'Data', or an input, output, input or output argument of an 'Operation'. Object B can either be a concept that is a 'Format', or in unexpected cases an entity outside of an ontology that is a 'Format' or is in the role of a 'Format'. In EDAM, 'has_format' is not explicitly defined between EDAM concepts, only the inverse 'is_format_of'.
has format.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 'A has_format B' defines for the subject A, that it has the object B as its data format.

has function.rdfs:comment: Subject A can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated). Object B can either be a concept that is (or is in a role of) a function, or an entity outside of an ontology that is (or is in a role of) a function specification. In the scope of EDAM, 'has_function' serves only for relating annotated entities outside of EDAM with 'Operation' concepts.
has function.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 'A has_function B' defines for the subject A, that it has the object B as its function.

has identifier.rdfs:comment: Subject A can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated). Object B can either be a concept that is an 'Identifier', or an entity outside of an ontology that is an 'Identifier' or is in the role of an 'Identifier'. In EDAM, 'has_identifier' is not explicitly defined between EDAM concepts, only the inverse 'is_identifier_of'.
has identifier.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 'A has_identifier B' defines for the subject A, that it has the object B as its identifier.

has input.rdfs:comment: Subject A can either be concept that is or has an 'Operation' function, or an entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated) that has an 'Operation' function or is an 'Operation'. Object B can be any concept or entity. In EDAM, only 'has_input' is explicitly defined between EDAM concepts ('Operation' 'has_input' 'Data'). The inverse, 'is_input_of', is not explicitly defined.
has input.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 'A has_input B' defines for the subject A, that it has the object B as a necessary or actual input or input argument.

has output.rdfs:comment: Subject A can either be concept that is or has an 'Operation' function, or an entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated) that has an 'Operation' function or is an 'Operation'. Object B can be any concept or entity. In EDAM, only 'has_output' is explicitly defined between EDAM concepts ('Operation' 'has_output' 'Data'). The inverse, 'is_output_of', is not explicitly defined.
has output.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 'A has_output B' defines for the subject A, that it has the object B as a necessary or actual output or output argument.

has topic.rdfs:comment: Subject A can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated). Object B can either be a concept that is a 'Topic', or in unexpected cases an entity outside of an ontology that is a 'Topic' or is in the role of a 'Topic'. In EDAM, only 'has_topic' is explicitly defined between EDAM concepts ('Operation' or 'Data' 'has_topic' 'Topic'). The inverse, 'is_topic_of', is not explicitly defined.
has topic.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 'A has_topic B' defines for the subject A, that it has the object B as its topic (A is in the scope of a topic B).

is format of.rdfs:comment: Subject A can either be a concept that is a 'Format', or in unexpected cases an entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated) that is a 'Format' or is in the role of a 'Format'. Object B can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology that is (or is in a role of) 'Data', or  an input, output, input or output argument of an 'Operation'. In EDAM, only 'is_format_of' is explicitly defined between EDAM concepts ('Format' 'is_format_of' 'Data'). The inverse, 'has_format', is not explicitly defined.
is format of.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 'A is_format_of B' defines for the subject A, that it is a data format of the object B.

is function of.rdfs:comment: Subject A can either be concept that is (or is in a role of) a function, or an entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated) that is (or is in a role of) a function specification. Object B can be any concept or entity. Within EDAM itself, 'is_function_of' is not used.
is function of.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 'A is_function_of B' defines for the subject A, that it is a function of the object B.

is identifier of.rdfs:comment: Subject A can either be a concept that is an 'Identifier', or an entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated) that is an 'Identifier' or is in the role of an 'Identifier'. Object B can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology. In EDAM, only 'is_identifier_of' is explicitly defined between EDAM concepts (only 'Identifier' 'is_identifier_of' 'Data'). The inverse, 'has_identifier', is not explicitly defined.
is identifier of.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 'A is_identifier_of B' defines for the subject A, that it is an identifier of the object B.

is input of.rdfs:comment: Subject A can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated). Object B can either be a concept that is or has an 'Operation' function, or an entity outside of an ontology that has an 'Operation' function or is an 'Operation'. In EDAM, 'is_input_of' is not explicitly defined between EDAM concepts, only the inverse 'has_input'.
is input of.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 'A is_input_of B' defines for the subject A, that it as a necessary or actual input or input argument of the object B.

is output of.rdfs:comment: Subject A can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated). Object B can either be a concept that is or has an 'Operation' function, or an entity outside of an ontology that has an 'Operation' function or is an 'Operation'. In EDAM, 'is_output_of' is not explicitly defined between EDAM concepts, only the inverse 'has_output'.
is output of.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 'A is_output_of B' defines for the subject A, that it as a necessary or actual output or output argument of the object B.

is topic of.rdfs:comment: Subject A can either be a concept that is a 'Topic', or in unexpected cases an entity outside of an ontology (or an ontology concept in a role of an entity being semantically annotated) that is a 'Topic' or is in the role of a 'Topic'. Object B can be any concept or entity outside of an ontology. In EDAM, 'is_topic_of' is not explicitly defined between EDAM concepts, only the inverse 'has_topic'.
is topic of.oboInOwl:hasDefinition: 'A is_topic_of B' defines for the subject A, that it is a topic of the object B (a topic A is the scope of B).

preceded by.rdfs:comment: Please note that, as stated on one of the RO documentation pages (https://code.google.com/p/obo-relations/wiki/ROAndBFO), some of the relations RO makes use are either uncontroversial (non-temporalized) parts of BFO2, or will be incorporated in the future. In the case of BFO_0000063, it is not currently in BFO2, but may be in the future. The RO ontologists assume this is the transitive form. For a full definition, refer to the inverse of this property, BFO_0000060. (Allyson Lister)

followed by.rdfs:comment: Please note that, as stated on one of the RO documentation pages (https://code.google.com/p/obo-relations/wiki/ROAndBFO), some of the relations RO makes use are either uncontroversial (non-temporalized) parts of BFO2, or will be incorporated in the future. In the case of BFO_0000060, it is not currently in BFO2, but may be in the future. The RO ontologists assume this is the transitive form. (Allyson Lister)

participates in.rdfs:comment: Please see the official RO definition for the inverse of this property, 'has participant.'

has_part.rdfs:comment: The inverse property. 'part of', contains the full official RO definition.

has release date.rdfs:comment: The official date of release of software

has support URL.rdfs:comment: A URL for a source of support information about software
